IZ-Vo1BNQIX74cce8bwfpA.text: Happened to stumble in with my mates after a long day. I have had their sliders previously in a good ol frozen grocery store box, but was excited to see what the burgers tasted like fresh.  I ordered chicken, beef and the fish sliders. The line moved at a good rate and the food was prepared in a decent amount of time.   The beef was okay and the chicken a little bland, but the star of my order was the fish slider for me. First of all I didn't even know White Castle did this type of a sandwich, so when I saw it on the menu I had to order it, and I am glad I did.

u9-lLwgda0RLOJzk84NI_g.text: I love White Castle. All these people with the negative reviews obviously were given False expectations. Cheap small burgers packed with onions and pickles, oh and the meat is super thin. But theyre so dam delicious.

f8QIpi8eKyoVKhGrQkRbew.text: Years and years ago, I remember my cousins and I dined at a White Castle in New Jersey. We ordered an entire Crave Case. We ate the entire case! I can't imagine ever doing that now. This was the first time I had White Castle since then. I was severely disappointed and it's not because I went with the veggie burger this time.   Everything was disgusting. It was a poor excuse for what they are calling a "burger" and "fries". Their onion fries were their saving grace. It was the best thing we ordered, which was at least edible. My girlfriends had the burger and neither of them finished their meals. Our order took forever because I ordered the veggie. Apparently it takes longer to make? Perhaps it's because it isn't ordered as much as the burgers?   For the 3 of us, we spent a total of $17 which included a beer. This is definitely a cheap eat, and somewhere you'd go if you were drunk and hungry. There's no other reason why you'd "crave" this place ever. Save your money and calories and get a real burger from Shake Shack or In n Out Burger.

YD3RSar5OVee-hLBi5fkVQ.text: Dont waist your time or money. SLOW! Staff is working in slow motion. Felt like I was at the DMV in the Zootopia movie.

1ikm1PHygG_riVMtSSyBRg.text: Like many 30 somethings, I've wanted to eat at a White Castle ever since i first saw Harold and Kumar (we don't have White Castle where I'm from). Way too many years later, I finally got the chance when we were in Vegas. I don't know why people complain about these or what they are expecting. It's not an In-n-Out. It's a processed, tiny burger, but that's okay! If that's what you're looking for, it's pretty good. get yourself a half dozen and go to town. They're very inexpensive, and you get what you pay for here. I didn't expect gourmet Gordon Ramsey burgers that are $26 for a cheeseburger. I expected a fast food experience, and that's exactly what it is/was. I liked it okay, but I won't be rushing back per say. The service was fine, and the wait wasn't bad. I would say there needs to be more seating, because it's shared with the casino floor, so that was a little unexpected. I would have rather this been sectioned off, so it would be its own stand along place. Basically, if you go in knowing what type of food it is, you're going to be okay. There were some drunk college kids that kept running back and forth from the sports bar to the restaurant acting like morons, so the crowd you deal with is a crap shoot, keep that in mind.

lbXaJGehdnnWWHUJSuYWnQ.text: Planned on walking around the strip at night and been eying on this burger joint since the first day we got in Vegas. What a great way to finally taste this "famous" from the movie, burgers. It was such a nice topping on the cake to stop by here after a good stroll around. My wife n I ordered the #2 combo, 4 cheese sliders soda and a small fries for the kiddo. TBH, the sliders were pretty good. I just thought it was bigger than I thought at first I ordered it. Nevertheless, we just really wanna stop by and see what the fuzz is all about. The price was fair, $9 for all in that combo. If you think that's high, then why are you in Vegas?? Try going to starbucks in Treasure Island (maybe all Starbuck in the strip) and see what the price is...

The fries were the average crinkle frozen fries so party there. Overall, I didn't like it enough to eat there again. On to the next spot!

EFEuT6xXv98aJPPL2df80g.text: I went to Las Vegas wit my family and the first thing we did was go to white castles! The food was very good and the service was fast and friendly but the location was very confusing but other than that it's a great place defiantly suggest if you are visiting Las Vegas!

BXIu3M4YcZ_Bg1DJfOrcDA.text: Tried White Castle for the first time at the Las Vegas Foodie Fest and thought they were decent. I think there was more hype about how great they were that made me want to give it a try.   When I heard about White Castle opening in Vegas I thought I should try it from the real place instead of a food truck. So I went with a friend opening day. The line wrapped around the building. We waited for about an hour and a half but moved pretty fast considering the line of people. While waiting it was nice to see some of the staff coming out to talk to us and we're so enthusiastic about opening.   When we finally got to the front I had to try one of everything. Almost everything. We got the original sliders , fries, loaded fries and chicken rings. Once we had the food to ourselves we indulged. Loved the chicken rings and who doesn't love fries. The loaded fries tasted good but I could have done without the bacon,sadly it didn't taste like good crispy bacon we all love. Annnnnd then the sliders...they tasted just as I remembered from the foodie fest. Luke warm and wet, almost soggy bread.  I'm an optimist so I do wanna go back and try it again and hope it was only like that due to the craziness of opening day. If not, definitely munchie or drunk food.   P.S. Get a beer! The way they serve it is pretty awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UVC1I1l1fIek2HY7i-YS6w.text: It's White Castle. It's its own entity. It's not a hamburger as West Coasters (myself included) think of when you hear the word 'Hamburger'. Once you get into the idea that you're eating something completely different, you're on the road to success.  I fell in love with these little onion-y meat and bun nuggets in Kentucky. I suppose if you hate onions, you'll hate this. The onions are cooked and the patties and buns are stacked on top steaming everything with that onion-y goodness. These were every bit as good as the ones I've had in Kentucky.   Pro Tip: Get a side of onion chips, and order by the sack.

kddUqyVMdsOVhFwOywvPAA.text: I love these one- and two-star reviews from people who just don't get what the White Castle experience is supposed to be about. What were you expecting? This ain't In-N-Out.  My only beef with this place - no pun intended, but I could have deleted it and used another phrase if I really wanted to - is that they serve onion chips, which are whole chunks of onion covered in bread crumbs, instead of onion rings, which are built around processed, probably reconstituted onions. It's a nod to quality but I miss the old school rings.  And of course now I want White Castle. The crave is too real.

OlIt3p1ofXP6H6pkIcjZLQ.text: we were super excited to try White Castle burgers outside of the ones we buy at the grocery store and microwave. our hopes were high because we do love these and figured the real deal would be way better. but to our surprise, they tasted exactly the same. luckily when we arrived, there wasn't much of a line but as we ate, the lunch crowd arrived and the line looped around the casino. i would have been disappointed if I had to wait that long.   I was impressed by the chicken sliders which were made from all white meat chicken. the cheese fries were also very good. all in all, this is the perfect hangover food but I would not consider it "quality" food.

5yUvEwavFVwpfnyfafJi_w.text: I dont get it....sorry. Tasteless little nuggets of some kinda meat, and fries that are no better than Del Taco. Service was friendly and quick and she asked if I were a local (which I am) so she gave me a little discount. Not sure what the appeal is but I'd pass on by next time. Even in a drunken hunger this place didn't satisfy.

ixrdmbcYcBPo7Kkmr7mAPQ.text: I am from California  and Im super interested about White Castle's food. The tiny little burgers were alright and the onion fries were delicious! Overall it was a good experience, but there are many more burger places that surpass this place. I would like to mention that the staff here are excellent, the cashier helped us out choosing food since we didnt know what to get and was very kind and sweet. I dont remember his name, but we really appreciated his help!

1voxe84Q43DB8p7AaS8zqA.text: This shit is disgusting!!  I wanted to see what the hype was since they made a movie about it. Boy did it disappoint. Luckily there was no line or anything at 1am. The workers were quick and friendly but the burgers tasted exactly like the frozen ones and maybe even worst.  Go to in n out when you want good tasting fast food burgers.

S3ZwbxXEeTNR_Ck8eT15-w.text: Love me some White Castle! Am originally from Michigan but now live in Virginia where there are none.  So happy to find a oasis in the desert with White Castle on the strip!   Sliders and onion chips as good as I remember and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.  Added bonus is this location serves beer and is also open 24/7.   I'll be back!

R35_jdMz384bhpEqSeueKA.text: SHITTY ASS CUSTOMER SERVICE. They literally have no idea what happened to my order I waited over 20 minutes for it, when the wait is usually like less then 5. All the manager said was a weak ass sorry and told me they must have bumped my order. I understand it's only White Castle but do better man.

flLioOehux38IUovp28Xqw.text: White Castle, what are you doing in Vegas? I came here with a goal to try this place. I watched the movie and heard the hype and I pumped up my wife and son about the franchise. The tradition and history was the draw and the curiosity was the nail in the coffin. So our drive to Vegas was filled with goals, must do's, promises, and plans to try White Castle and Nathan's Hot Dogs. We were on a budget because we were staying for a week and we had a football tournament to attend. But White Castle was a must have and we decided on taking a walk from Excalibur to White Castle. It is a 1 hour walk from end to end because the sidewalks are so crowded and a 2 mile hike if you look at a GPS. It was a cold night and we worked up an appetite walking to the location but that did not help the outcome. Finally when we arrived with our faces half frozen we found a place to sit across from all the slot machines. The restaurant is very noisy because it is open on to the game floor. I lined up and saw the huge selection of options and I decided to keep it simple. My order: Original slider and original slider with cheese: They were a total disappointment bland with no seasoning not even a pinch of salt the cheese was flavor less but did add some texture. The onions got lost in the process and added nothing to the flavor. My 11 year old could not even finish one slider and he walked there with no dinner he thought it was gross and said he was scared for life.(preteen drama) I think when three people who enjoy fast food aren't willing to eat the food something is extremely wrong. (Negative rating if possible) Loaded fries: Those were okay and edible but nothing to rave about I would definitely order the wedges from Jack's than these.  Fries: What can I say about prepackaged frozen fries other than they weren't burnt or soggy.   Onion rings: They were good but not worth remembering or craving. Wo when the sides are okay and the burgers suck you get one star that is all there is to it and I don't think if I was in the East coast I would ever go looking for a White Castle or waste my money at one. Oh yeah and the customer service was just okay you can tell the staff was tired and not happy to be there even though it wasn't even 10pm. I though the walk would enhance the experience but it just added to the disappointment so I apologize if I upset White Castle fans with my review.

7duyemNm_MaU-wuzk-2xnQ.text: I'm from St. Louis & came in on a late night. Ordered the fish sandwich meal (#6) and added cheese to the fries.l, then substituted the drink for a beer ($2). Tasted just like home.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. # 6 - Fish Sandwich &amp; Fries (ask to add cheese). Oh yeah, don&#39;t forget the #BottomsUpBeer.
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Castle Collage

odtIWhUgA295bIJCDbW_gA.text: A friend reminded me not to try this chain the last time I came to Vegas.  I think I know why now.  Since my sister wanted to try it out, we ordered three of the sliders.  The bread was soggy.   Patty was just there.  The customer service was great.

aJZVFuOwomHjlCW6HbdWCQ.text: A east coast comfort food that reminds you how sometimes, you need some cheap food to fulfill your needs. It just so happens Vegas isn't a place to fulfill your needs. If your drunk, gambled all your money, desperate and hungry. This is the spot. Other than that if your in the west coast and desperate for some white castle fast food drop on by like I did.

FpDbOG5sixGUyga4bDRBzQ.text: I was not happy the 1st visit. I am invited back. Let's hope my next experience will be better.

eeijzmFoJWWItTXiy0xDGg.text: Was expecting sooooo much but was soooo underwhelmed.  I couldn't even get ketchup or mustard on my burger! Come on man! So disappointed. Better off getting the frozen ones! Oh and it's like triple the price from back home!

wR9bPZ7PfsmxKeBM7t-oZA.text: I like this place. The workers have great customer service and their services are fast. I seen a couple complaints that this place is similar to the frozen stuff.  Um.. yeah... shouldnt it be??  If i owned a restaurant and decided to sell my food to the grocery stores, i would want it to taste like it was the same as dining in.   Las Vegas is a tourists city and I'm very grateful for restaurants from around the world to land here.  It's very welcoming for those that moved out here and miss what they grew up with.

LTmYe_gmjuVxdauDP4nabQ.text: We decided to try this place since it was a short walk from our hotel. Located next to Harrah's casino, this place has several guards to ensure nobody cuts in line.   Depending on the time of day, you might encounter a line of people waiting outside.  We came here at 6 pm on a Monday evening - a short line of 5 people formed outside; when we left 45 min later, the line was around 20 people outside. Once you're inside, it's another 10-15 people. It took us about 30 min to get our food. Once you place your order, you are given a number, and once your food is ready, they call your number to pick it up. The lady would repeatedly call out the same number for a minute or two until the order was picked up. That certainly didn't add any great ambience to our dining experience.  As of 2/2/15 their menu was not quite extensive as the menu on-line. They don't have fish burgers or onion rings. We tried the original sliders, chicken ring sliders, fries, and onion chips (like onion rings but chopped up). Everything tasted like a 2/5 except for the onion chips which tasted better.

7Jbmdy_cQRk3RhbP8NLMgQ.text: The food was ok.  All the workers looked like they hated being here.  All looked unhappy. The cashier seemed nice.  Slow as molasses.  I cashier for about 50 people in line.  What a mess this place is

dQki36rW5CiHos_WMO5iDQ.text: Waited in line for about an hour and a half but it was worth it. We ordered 20 burgers added cheese to half of them and it came with 2 Fries. Also added a 6 pc chicken rings and soda and total came out to $37!  The fries were nothing special and I won't get them again and the chicken rings were alright. Nothing special either. Burgers of course were delicious and we took half of them home and warmed the rest up for dinner. Only complaint is the prices!! They should be charging the same that they do at all there east coast locations not jacking the price up cause it's on the strip. Hope they get the jalapeno burgers soon cause those are the best!  I also like to say it cracks me up how people Compare this to in n out!!! There is no comparison what so ever so stop comparing. There's actually not a single fast food or burger joint U can compare to White Castle.

VyBso3_xDJJV1apIU_XQCQ.text: Must be a nostalgia thing. The wife always wanted to try one as she had family who loved these. Neither one of us can figure what the draw is. Not real burger tasting or anything to make it stand out. If you just want to say you had one then give it a go, at least it's not real pricey.

DFnIoIZVyM0tab6KmFCp8A.text: Ok, I'm from Southern California, so I never really got the whole White Castle craze, since it was never in California to begin with.   A recent trip to Las Vegas with my Chicago born girlfriend certainly changed it around for me. First, it's not the in and out type burger most will want. It's a small steamed burger, and it tastes great. Small sliders that are bite sized is what White Castle is all about. Quick service and overall great place in my mind.  Yes, the prices were high, but drive 1200 more miles if you want the closer one, and you'll pay the higher than normal prices for them there. It's Vegas, get over it, most of everything in Vegas is overpriced.   Great times and good food.

qFdcFJASBy8OCVZV3Vl-ag.text: Hello Mr. Michael, thank you just received the card today. I always loved white castles! Will go back for sure when I'm around Vegas!

v0YTjiUtLlYMuyL0F2C37Q.text: Yum yum yum! I had never tried White Castle before but I am definitely in love!  Those tiny sliders are so delicious! Let's get one in San Diego please!  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was the environment. It wasn't very comfortable to stay and eat when numbers and people were regularly being yelled at through the intercom....

OKpg6qA9Yce5LQ46K56rPA.text: Ate here last night and cannot for the life of me, stop my ass from shitting. Really sucks that because they poorly manage their sanitation, now my vacation is stuck close to a restroom.

lXJgJlnRahzySnqo2WAiqA.text: My review in one word... YUCK!   I was so excited to try these little sliders, so my husband, our friend and I decided to go and we ordered their 20 slider combo. My husband is a picky eater so we ordered 15 with everything and 5 without onions or pickles. After waiting like 15 minutes for our order of course all 20 sliders had onions and pickles, so we had to order 5 more. Like I said... Yuck!! We were hungry as hello so I ended up eating 5, our friend 7 and my husband 4, we threw the rest away!! :(   I guess these are popular in the East Coast because they don't have In-n-Out!!

p0aRZ-27_uncdcFYNKinXA.text: If you never tried it, must experience it. Great little burgers that will fill you up. 10 should be enough for a person. Good place for late night in Vegas. Opens 24/7.  Line isnt so long. Worth to try and wait for. Great for hangovers after the club.

4dlL9i7nXJMS8Mn2_oWULQ.text: I remember as a kid having White Castle from the frozen food section of the grocery store and I was not too impressed with them back then. So when we saw they had a location to try on the strip I was interested in trying them. Well the taste is no better then what you would get from the grocery store, so might as well stick with that if they are the same plus you don't have to wait in long lines like you do at this place. On the bright side they are pretty inexpensive compared to the other food choices offered on the strip.

L78YGuZQsdiQf5O3OywalQ.text: First of all this opened 15 hours ago. The wait was not that long considering I ordered a crate w/cheese (100 sliders w/cheese). The manager maintained eye contact with everyone on line (less than 20 people at 530am). I seen over 400 burgers leave in the 15 minutes I was there. The place was clean and I could not smell smoke (it's inside a casino).

nNufUPtMKmP7Hd9-IAeixw.text: First time having White Castle in a few years and it was a disappointment, burgers taste like the microwaveable ones you can buy at the grocery store each tiny burgers were about over $1 in n out is way better!

V4RMIboQb8q8Avzwg1QEnw.text: My fiance wanted to come to white castle to try the food as it was on his list of things to do before he dies due to the movie Harold and Kumar go to white castle. He thought they looked good and he did not want to try the frozen ones as he wanted the authentic experience. They were such a waste of money and calories! We got the 10 pack of hamburgers for $11, and a large fries for $2.95 which would of been the same as getting a number #1 and 2 extras for myself and come out with less food. We waited 30 minutes for our food and when we got it and ate it, we were so unsatisfied with the flavor. IT tasted just like onions, thats it! so overpowering. Will not go back! Do not suggest.

0cQ9YpvsLtEXYayCZhEN5w.text: Loved White Castle since I was a child in Louisville, Kentucky. Moved to Florida 29 years ago and missed them ever since (the frozen ones suck so they don't even come into play here). Went to the one in Vegas recently and was extremely disappointed. Not the same flavor and restaurant not as clean. I know I could be remembering better than it was but going to NYC soon and will try it there and repost.

p9HJKkWkHWWbcIUoyxdn0Q.text: I just want to point out how thin these "hamburger patties" are. This place was full of mediocracy. 12 buck on 4 sliders and cheese bacon fries and we are leaving less than dissatisfied. 2 stars because the fries were good but save your self some time and walk a little bit down the strip to a joint called in-n-out! So sad, because we were excited to try something from the east coast!!! Maybe it's just this place, I will give White Castle another try while in NY. But never here again

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M7Ilk0kw-DTpxeGfNBH2DA.text: I've loved white castle! They only sell them frozen or have fresh ones in the east coast. I finally get to try the fresh ones. So darn deliciously. I don't have to go to the east coast to get them. Very good! Will back again and again!). :)

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lZXeAxkwcjDZx3e_6jFqgA.text: Straight awful and disgusting. I've been wanting to try these ever since like a decade ago when I first saw Harold and Kumar's Adventure to White Castle and these did not deliver. I think it's just something you have to grow up with as a kid to crave for nostalgia's sake when you're super high. As a grown-up who's never had these before, these were basically worse than McDonald's. They tasted like chemicals and I'm not even sure if it was even real meat. It made me and my girlfriend feel extremely gross after, and I had to walk it off for the rest of the day to feel normal again. Would never ever try this again even if someone paid me to eat it.

NJRmBDqsSeVW3wpnei4tkg.text: From the Midwest, and having moved to the southwest, it was great to have White Castles again on Our trip to Vegas....the down side is parking.....where do you park?   Luckily we stayed at the Venetian, but during the hot temps of summer we only visited once.  I don't know how you'd take a cab here either. If someone knows please let us know.  Walking is a problem for us.  They tasted just like we remembered.  Interesting set up, casino and Denny's all I. The same building.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tPqW3CRFc8cETcqJ-X1WAg.text: I'm so glad we don't have these in Niagara Falls. These were the greasiest blandest fast food burgers iv'e ever had and they weren't cheap for what you got.

ZfKxJdX-B4t4KWY0zql8OA.text: I once waited an hour for a seventh course meal and it was still faster than this.  Only reason I even attempted to wait this long is because I made myself believe that the bun was made of Egyptian papyrus scrolls and the meat was made of brontosaurus....

-TvwNlcOD07uLjZL4pl2AA.text: I've never had White Castle before...but it really wasn't anything special. Fries sucked (and they were fresh, just sucked). Nothing wrong with the burgers, I just didn't really like them. The cheese was really nasty, almost as if they had no flavor at all. I'll stick to In-n-Out.

uY8ZNqWTRe1N0K3W4BmRlQ.text: Decent. Expected more but decent Forsure. I don't wanna say overrated but Yelp wouldn't let me leave it at decent ( words min.) so now that I think about it I'm leaning towards overrated.

opWrdONTiMez_qj9I9MR5w.text: Overrated ...two stars because the line was long but they work fast and have a system... Not sure how the original White Castle taste like but the meat looks like thinly sliced mystery meat with soaked grilled onions and one pickle.... If you must try at least get the cheese slider the cheese gives some flavor.

PS_yqp2oWYYNXSYVt0p6mw.text: Growing up in the West, I've never really gotten to experience White Castle fresh. I've only experienced the frozen kind that you buy at your local markets. With that said, and with rave reviews of friends and family, my experience here was anti climatic. I'll have to admit that the fresh ones were slightly better than the frozen one you make at home. These famous sliders are steamed on a bed of grilled onions with a very thin slice of hamburger,  (And I mean thin. I suppose so that it could cook faster) and topped with a bun to also steam. If you want cheese, that is extra. Your slider also contains a pickle. If you want double meat that would be extra as well. I had order the cheese slider combo. It came with 4 sliders, fries or onion chips, and a drink. This cost about $9. Prices are a bit high for what you are receiving. That is to be expected considering it is on the Las Vegas Strip. It's always busy and within one of the casino in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink Station
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink Station
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders

BxHmAk-bBr4mOGW-YaSlMg.text: I line was long but it went quick.. The food was hot and it was good. I haven't had White Castle in years since I'm from California. I loved the bottoms up beer.. How cool was that.. It's a must try for sure..

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu

mftOLsqrF2hbdbBuvY_tlg.text: It was worth the experience to see what all the hype was about. 5 stars for service and burgers....1 star for the prices, although being on the strip I expected to pay more, It was a little much. The frozen ones from the grocery store are just as good:)

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q-TnRQr95IScwRsR9fDNHg.text: So I'm from Texas and was in town. I've always wanted to try White Castle so I thought why not?   Got there early around 10:30. No line and for my food quickly, but that's the only positive...  Burgers were so cold my cheese wasn't even melted. Fries were old and horrible. Wish I could say better things, but for the price you really are better going somewhere else!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sad little burgers...

rtw5VISr89qK-k2sSJZZgQ.text: This place is nothing special to be honest it taste like the ones I get from the grocery stores cause as I notice they will grab a bag from a box in the back you cause see it, fires and everything in the fryer are never fresh. Employees talking about customers getting my bag my fries were all over the place I didn't speak with a manager due to no one looking friendly at all! You can tell the employees are to into there conversation then handing out orders on time!   This is poor customer service food is poorly made! I understand time is a difference to them but really it didn't seem like it while there employees were talking. My business will just go to in n out or I would rather go to the east coast to get better customer service and a real White Castle burger.   As I notice that most of the employees did not wash there hands correctly. So I just threw away my order.

h7x1qALxufRDYNF9-6PB8Q.text: I finally got my white castle burgers and the wait was worth.  Would have given 5 starts but the fries were not good.  So So good.  Wish I would have gotten 6 instead of 4.

AKGZtil9ocIeGR-89nHF8A.text: This place was pretty good! Had never eaten there beforem the staff was efficent in how they made and delivered their food.

U7GR5Y5-zik3zF7VykXelA.text: Kids liked their White Castle experience taste just like the frozen ones. Try adding the new jalapeno cheese really good especially on the fish burgers. Long lines but employees are very friendly and efficient.

v7PheqsQlyrSFzeF0j2oPw.text: I've only heard of the wonders that are White Castle sliders. As a CA native, WC is a thing of movies and the frozen aisle at Walmart, but I needed to try the real thing. The line was short on a Sunday at 11am and my double cheese slider was ready in less than 5 minutes. IT WAS ALL I EVER HOPED AND DREAMED OF. The onion content is a bit heavier than I'd have chosen, but I'll know that for next time. Hot, moist, delicious, and satisfying. Why aren't these available closer to home?

9ywck1ar3fSYeGNXhjqKmQ.text: Haven't had White Castle burgers since I moved from NY. Burgers were ok but I encountered bubble guts within an hour after eating them. The taste  of these White Castle burgers isn't what I remembered. I will just buy the frozen one's next time.

6N49RrfcstqL2_gBvdJ7jA.text: I didn't expect  much being that they only had sliders. But it was surprisingly  good. The grilled onions make it worth it. Definitely  enjoyed our dinner date on the strip!!!!

cJrSR22mgT-h1uUCAh3okQ.text: We loved the very thin patties and super soft bread.  Definitely not for those who like a meaty patty.  Clean for being so busy.  Great place for a fast food snack.  I didn't like the ranch dressing, but I'm pretty particular about that.

fSaL6qdu_jJ2ELAi-bRiqA.text: So when I heard this famous east coast fast food burger joint was coming to Vegas, I was really hyped! But when we got there it was met with disappointment! The burgers tasted exactly like they came out of the frozen food section. I mean if that's how it's suppose to taste, that's fine but I was disappointed. It was nice to finally eat at this world famous joint but wasn't impressed. The chicken rings and onion chips were pretty good and that's why it's an average (3 star) rating. The wait was nonexistent. We walked right in and ordered (we went in on a Wednesday around 11am). We found it easiest to get there by parking at the Venetian and walking towards the strip and hanging a left.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Mw-gScvCjdf9VoRXTV4fw.text: I only expected better because we have these in St. Louis.  It took them forever to get our order prepared and then it was wrong...so disappointing.  once they got it right it was good.  However, the wait was way too long and I wanted it right the first time.

Nvsey5vUXg6-rJdsOP92sw.text: Very Busy. Long lines, So many people in line the cooks needed a grill 10x10 to keep up. Burgers were great but not quite as good as the White Castle in St Louis MO. I think the fast pace and long lines of people has staff in to big a rush to make the perfect White Castle burger. If you're on the strip and you have time to wait in line it's worth the wait for a white Castle. And staff did seem really stressed out by the sheer number of people being served. Also price of the burgers are higher there then I've paid elsewhere for a white Castle.

kV3zbAcSoFwWWT_beFLJZw.text: I don't know what all these people are complaining about. The food was delicious. They make the onion rings different but still good. My only issue is the lack of seating for larger and handicapped people. So from now on I'll just get it to go. And they need some big red. That's the best to wash it down with.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They make the onion rings different. But still delicious

GYuAb3cjdVQ0uJPuurohfg.text: Had to try it! I was more about the experience than the food I think! paper thin burgers with 5 holes in the middle. Great Mustard Fries were good Very long line, Friday nigh about 40 minutes in line and no lots of seating.

Ox13lKYAFJy0GNF2PFwBxg.text: To all west coast tofu eating tree hugging hippies, please stay out of my beloved White Castle. All you do is slow me from getting my crave case. I can not begin to understand how someone could "evaluate" a White Castle as if it was some kind of high end steakhouse.   1. White Castle is NOT an east coast thing. The first White Castle was opened in Wichita Kansas.   2. There are none west of the Mississippi? 31 in Missouri, one in Vegas and 68 in Illinois which sits on the east side of the great river, I say close enough.  Eat them sober, why? A shot of tequila should come with four ingredients, tequila, lime, salt and a Whitie! A twelve pack of beer should be called a twenty pack, twelve beer and eight sliders.  If it was up to me I would add one more option to the menu. Grind up all the west coast Castle bashers, mix them with the beef and call it the west coast Whitie. Go back to your over-rated In and Out burger!

Op7kSM8HCG1hmrazz7_z6g.text: Next time you see the line and ask yourself "is it worth it?"  ANSWER- NO!!!!!   Great food.. Terrible service. I get that it's a Friday night and you are understaff but to treat your customers with disrespect and roll your eyes when you serve them their food is just degrading. It's not that hard to make 20 sliders for someone. Especially after you already made 20+ for someone who ordered after.   "Here's your order (as she slaps the bag on the counter)" -staff  Just rude. Ps. 40 min after we orders   Been there, done that, never going to do it (in vegas) again.

6RmFwFUJ5DvJHRW9KEaugQ.text: These are not the burgers I was looking for ...  The White Castle of my youth was known for potent grilled onion flavor in a bun laden with grease drippings. The onions and grease are key to the entire experience. Without them, you've just got a tiny, boring, dry cheeseburger ... which is what you get here.   I mean, you can see them grilling the food right there, but somehow it comes out tasting almost exactly like the crappy frozen microwave version! You don't taste the onions at all and there's minimal grease to liven up that dry bun.   Dunno if this is typical corporate quality-cutting when something develops a following, or just this particular location not having their stuff together, but this ain't the White Castle people rave about. About as cheap as Strip food gets at 1.30 for regular and 1.60 with cheese, but you might as well just microwave up a six pack if it's gonna be like this ...

yktezVHE5LuOetYJb4WGKA.text: Three stars here because I love White Castle but not at the prices that exist at this location. I grew up in Ohio so White Castle was always around. It was a very cheap and fast way. Here in Vegas however, prices are doubled which quickly makes this place not worth going to. I love White Castle but not $10+ much.

oLjeR2NOoXQtAwcDFiYbGg.text: Ugh... I'm being generous with that third star... but whatever.  I grew up on microwaved White Castles... and my first time having them in person... they're honestly not bad.  Better than the microwave version, but not by much.  That pickle they put on there is just right for the flavor.  They're nothing special though.  What gets me is that they're pretty pricey for what they are...  I wouldn't seek them out again, but, if I was walking the strip and had the munchies while walking by, I'd certainly grab em.

racF8jPhpVuBUtmBwS1S1w.text: Ok it's in casino royale but surprisingly not smoky. I was there in the day time tho. As a local we parked in the mirage walked toward Carnegie deli past rhumbar outside and across the street. Go left and it will be on your right past out back.  It smells like an armpit.  Ok strong onions. The line  is confusing a bit. Walk past all the ppl waiting for their food to order. You'll see what I mean...

rNhtH_D8FOF79b7u5e4png.text: More of a nostalgia thing for me growing up in Minneapolis and eating them as a kid.  Price seemed always right and always fresh and delicious.  That thing they do with the onions is over the top.  Not as good a burger as I remember as a kid but maybe I have eaten too many celebrity chef burgers and acquired a different taste.  Hard to park to get there but if you're in the neighborhood pick up a few and enjoy.  Fast and friendly service and smells great.

GOkSCxLu2yQGRQ19wT4OFQ.text: Taste just like old times to me. Prices are different because it's on the strip. But nice friendly service

uiyeD7tWxv4dqdgxgjYwsg.text: I have liked White Castle since my childhood in Ohio.  It is great to have it here on the Strip and the doubles are great except for one thing...the cheese tastes slightly different than the White Castles back in the Midwest.

_3t-8SCTIAzlwmT2ZgNLoA.text: Good Mini burger with lots of fresh onions can't get enough of these burgers yummy I can't wait to go back will tell all people in California

e-tJHGDnbYZtBMButATy7g.text: I'm sorry Roldy and Kumar, but this crap is horrible.  I pictured this place being an east coast In N Out in slider form, but the burgers were horrible.  Love the movie, hate the product.

gwOYzAsvJqaFHgcvjEq2nQ.text: Late night snacks? Definitely. I think ti was $4 for a double slider and loaded fries. Can't go wrong with either!

0Lfd2SwAH19FyHrf7crkow.text: Of course I had to go to White Castle! Reliving the good old days... "... just thinking about those tender little White Castle burgers with those little, itty-bitty grilled onions that just explode in your mouth like flavor crystals every time you bite into one... just makes me want to burn this motherfucker down. Come on, Pookie, let's burn this motherfucker down! Come on, Pookie! Let's burn it, Pookie! Let's burn this motherfucker down! Let's burn it down! Let's burn it! So you guys maybe should just suck it up and go to White Castle." - Anthony Anderson as "the burger shack employee"

DgR-8p8FXm8guPkDfNT6Tw.text: Giving it one star seems like too much.  Was burping nasty burger for about a half an hour.

dGvqysvOoR_wI2jeD0zz8Q.text: Been waiting to try this place for a LONG time since they opened some months ago.   I like that casino Royale put it in their casino.  Smart marketing.  I can't say I was disappointed but not blown away either.  The burgers were fresh but I didn't feel too much of a difference between those and the frozen ones.  They were decent though.  Once I got to eating the 3rd and 4th burger my mouth seemed to get dryer.  Not sure why that was.  Anyhow I would come back but it would be because I'm craving it...more like I'm drunk and it's conveniently in the middle of the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Castle burgers and fries
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Castle cheeseburger

_7nDnRspBqqR8ca9bR_oPA.text: Sadly didn't live up to the hype.  I've had frozen White Castle in the past.   And who can resist coming here after watching Harold and Kumar go to White Castle :-)  Anyway it wasn't bad but left me thinking.. "Hey McDonald's is better."  Burgers - Good, expected them to come out hotter though since I could see them making it in front of my face.  Seems that they just serve the ones that have been sitting a bit though.  GIVE ME THE FRESH ONES! Fries - Mediocre. Chicken Ring Burger - Nah, just cheese on 2 chicken ring. Fish Burger - Okay but no condiments.. just cheese on a piece of fried fish.

wxKpyfSQPMGNHSKWFFIbDQ.text: Well, White Castle kind of is what it is... I don't think people come here thinking they're gonna get a gourmet burger or anything like that. White Castle is one of those late night craving fixers that used to not exist in the western USA, leave it to Vegas to make it happen. This place is a bit of a show in the middle of the night as most people are drunk and sloppy while ordering lol. The food itself is as expected, small but tasty, usually takes 4-5 of these bad boys to get you full. This is likely the only reason to go into the Casino Royale, as it is located within. Overall, recommend as a late night novelty fix, not necessarily if you're looking for a delicious burger.   Pros- Price Beer price Only one in western U.S.  Plenty of seating  Center of the strip  Cons- Average food A bit of a novelty burger  Messy  Cleanliness

4KctWubV7oqLCfyTnjfRvg.text: Stumbled upon this place while walking the Strip and I just had to try it just because. I only ordered a Cheddar Fries and 1 Burger. I am glad that's all I ordered because it did not taste good at all. First off, the service is cap. They didn't really care about you. The cheddar fries was nothing exciting, it had stale fries. The burger is just nasty! It's soggy with no flavor. Maybe if you are drunk and hungry you can eat here but other than that, I would pass.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar Fries

8VrxW0QArvo3Gx8p06_93w.text: Well Saturday night is over and what a better way to finish it than stop in for a few white castles, a Coke and some chili cheese fries

iYyJZIpitOS3SMhSCUoC4A.text: I still feel like the only difference between White Castle and Krystals is the holes in the patty and the condiments. I truly prefer Krystal. The burgers are nearly the same in taste. I think I was more disappointed because of Harold and Kumar making it seem like it was the place that would "hit the spot" for cheap.

6K1NCIoIuaaC3eepuDFdjg.text: This location is a hundred times better than the downtown location in respects to safety. However, it is significantly more crowded. It took about 20 minutes in line but that's okay. The burgers were good, nothing gourmet, but still good. The cheesecake on a stick is to die for. I will def get that again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finally got my fix.

7lAQreEwVLbmEGl983fd6Q.text: By far the least appetizing fast food we have ever had. They don't even deserve to be in the freezer section of the grocery store.

oIf9xohkjq1X66vFPNNHGg.text: Because this is on the strip, it's a little more expensive. Aside from that, I enjoyed the food. I got a couple of  hamburger sliders, fries and onion chips.   Sliders were good. Although I felt that the patties were so thin that you can barely taste it. The pickles were just as thick if not thicker than the patty. I loved the grilled onions on the slider. more flavor. I could probably eat a dozen of these guys. These fries are the best because the wrinkle cut fries has way more crisp because there's a larger surface area for it be fried than a normal straight cut fry. NOW let me tell you about the onion chips. If you like onion rights you will like this because they are just big size fried onion wedges. I would highly recommend this over the fries just because the fries were not as crispy as I would have liked. A great place to grab a snack after all the drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamburger slider with fries and onion chips

OX-znH9GSsJU5CjU2gMokw.text: I grew-up eating White Castle & have some at home in NY I could go to - but still always indulge when I visit Vegas. This location is convenient & clean (right next to Casino Royale, Denny's, Walgreens, near the Venetian) ... but irritating beyond belief in how SLOW they are.  Should not take more than 10 minutes to get your order (& that's not including a slow as molasses line to even place your order because the workers are just not efficient.  Managers should train their staff to be faster than this!!

FezHjbnGqfOY7SxnICpKiA.text: Parking sucks. White Castle need to move to a better location. We don't mind the drive.

zAkrux5xCZ0LwBKMqDTIOg.text: Been wanting to try these burgers for a couple years. Today was my first opportunity burgers were ok " In and Out has nothing to worry about". Fries were not fresh and served cold.

rNugNF6r-dG98axFkz4ntA.text: This isn't the best of anything by far but it's better fast food than the typical chains and their 24/7! And if your fan of the movie(Harold & Kumar) then you must try this place once cause those frozen ones you buy at the grocery store are fake and don't give White Castle anyway justice.   I ordered a combo.  *Sliders with cheese - Without the cheese they slider would suck so the cheese is good and def a must.  *Fries - Crinkle cut and very lacking. Easy pass next time. *Onion Fries - Your combo will be much better if you substitute for these. I like these a lot better.   I would probably recommend on skipping on combos and getting a sack. Because 4 sliders aren't really enough. Anyways White Castle isn't anything special but it is appealing at 4-5 AM, if you don't want Hash House or Earls.   The service is like any fast food joint. I asked for ranch and the lady said she had to go to back and get some. I waited 5 minutes and she didn't move at all. She had the easiest job of handing out sauces and she couldn't even do that smh.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo #4 $8.99

cipqHgTNXDkTq_qlHex2hQ.text: White Castle was on my list 'to try' when I was in Vegas. Though I was never a fan of the frozen White Castle sandwich I still wanted to try this one.  The line was super long when we got there, and waited at least 30mins in line. We ordered two of the Cheese Sliders Combo, which came with 3 cheese sliders, fries and a drink. I wasnt really expecting too much thinking it will taste exactly like the frozen ones, but I thought they were pretty good! I wouldnt say that im obsess with it tho, lol. I would still recommend it if you're in Vegas just to say that you've tried it. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YIM7hy88lKk8SJBZz3oSaw.text: My husband has always wanted to try White Castle so we made a point of getting it on the second day of our Vegas trip. If you are not a fan of onions, don't even bother. The bread is warmed on a bed of onions and they can only scrape it off, so it still thoroughly tastes like onions no matter what. The meat is not a good color and is so thin. The only thing that saved it for me were the chicken rings and chicken slider. We had In-N-Out the first day and this comes nowhere close to the quality and freshness, especially since they are just about the same price. Don't bother.

Zf0jX5faD8ZSkHGJK9MDCA.text: The hype was there. I think it was overly hyped but I get it a little.   We parked at the Venetian and walked outside by where Sephora was at and its tucked in a little casino. But you will be able to see the White Castle sign.   When we got there the lines were not as busy like we hoped it would be. It took me a long time to come just because the hype made it impossible to come. Thank god we waited though.  We ordered 20 like cheeseburgers sliders. They also has beer for you beer drinkers. They are like I expected little tiny cheeseburgers with 1 pickle Alice and some onions. For some reason it did taste good. But it taste like how the frozen one would taste at a grocery store.   Although those sliders were tiny I did get start to get full off 3.   I probably won't be returning here unless one of my tourist family members want to try it out. It wasn't a horrible experience I just feel like there's nothing special about White Castle. Maybe it's better on the East Coast!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xPl_pWzGKqgF9ttof82Dyg.text: I wish white castle was in Arizona still this was my first time here and very delicious I will be back if I ever visit las Vegas again

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soooo good..

cqKgXbKPrj-x-CmHBHSRUQ.text: I've seen the movies, I've heard the hype, so we had to try this, I didn't even know this was in Vegas, So we ordered about a dozen of them. And they were good, but really? I don't understand the whole big deal of these, yes they were good, the biscuit bun was soft and delish, the meat was good, but they weren't very special and they were small. So I'm not sure what there is to brag about. They were good, worth trying, but I'd rather have a bacon cheeseburger from a restaurant or another place.

3W6YZPzLlawXh-aBEZJRRg.text: Bonnie D. was the best. Great personality, attentive and helpful while I was ordering. As a local it was incredibly refreshing to be in a tourist spot and not get treared like... well a tourist. Thanks Bonnie and great job management for the hire. Shes solid.

LxpU3Hyx7d-g96Cf9qoDNw.text: Nom nom nom,  Mow down on a crap ton on burgers!  Located inside the casino, definitely one of the cheaper options on the strip.

7ciHoK_Yvu8g2WI2aSYGMQ.text: The burgers were great! The wait was a bit, but definitely worth the wait! We went to the location at the casino royale, but I would go with the cheeseburger!! While the burger was great, I think that the cheese would elevate it that much more. Definitely a great stop in Vegas!!

C6wt52QD3CHyyW4UfXvaSQ.text: Who the hell thinks this is good food? I've been wanting to try White Castle for over 10 years and finally walked across it and we had to try it. Of course we ordered the famous sliders, overwhelmed with anticipation we bit into them and were immediately disappointed. Whatever that substance was, no way you can call it beef! It was some science concocted mash that tasted like turf. Finally had it once, will NEVER try it again. In-n-out for life!

M86F0Jzdd7EZ9C5k5IjRQg.text: Came here for EDC weekend and the wait was crazy long! I believe I wanted for around 2 hours.  This place is perfect for midnight munchies because it's open 24/7. You can order combos or the items separately. I got the jalapeno burger with white cheese pickles and onions, a cheeseburger, and the loaded fries. I felt that the burgers tasted subpar at best and for sure I've had better. But if you're getting fast food style sliders these will somewhat hit the spot. The fries were a bit salty for me so I'm not really a fan.  Don't forget to get condiments. They don't provide them to you so you have to ask for it. I would recommend the Dusseldorf mustard. To me it's a bit spicier than regular mustard.  Also they have "swag" aka souvenirs that you can purchase and if you like beer they do have alcohol at this location.  TL;DR Don't expect fancy ass burgers for a fast food slider place. Keep in mind these guys have to make even 100 sliders for just one or many orders. Also it is a bit pricy here so order wisely.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Düsseldorf mustard. A bit spicy.
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño cheeseburger with white cheese pickles and onions.
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It says &#34;jala&#34; but it looked like &#34;vag&#34; to me ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

QXVqzHA_p8Ul5CgA4hvGhg.text: Food taste good when your drunk but sober it taste like frozen dinner. It's very cheap for Vegas prices and they also deliver. The cheese burger and onion rings are descent.

TuI8fhaBG2yMJLigB9hwQQ.text: Being from the West Coast, the first time I heard of White Castle was watching that Harold-and-Kumar-get-really-high-and-need-to-fix-their-munchies movie. After that, I noticed that you could buy them frozen in the supermarket and defrost them to get a fix. When I heard an actual location opened up in Vegas, I made it a point to get there eventually. It took me 3 trips to Vegas to finally go because I was scared away by the potential crowds.  Well, it finally happened. It's located on the outskirts of Casino Royale on the strip, really easy to find by foot.  I came on a Wednesday around 11 am. There was a very short line but the seating area was pretty full. I asked the cashier when it starts getting crazy, and she told me after noon. A hot tip for you guys, earlier is better. The service was great, and the seating area was clean.  I ordered ten sliders with cheese, onion rings, and fries. The fried stuff was meh but the sliders were delicious. Meat, cheese, onion, and a soft roll. They taste better than the frozen ones because they're cooked fresh. The difference isn't that noticeable though.   Verdict: I love their sliders. I don't care that they're mostly bread with very little meat. I'm not coming here to be healthy.   Note: They have cheesecake on a stick. I regret not getting it. They also sell beer.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders with cheese
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D2t0g3i24eAbUQaRqH1kuw.text: Left LA  0316 this morn,  got to vegas by 0745. Slow I  know. But at the king of sliders,  white castle.  With reference of reverence WHITE CASTLE! No frozen boxed junk for this lil punk. Steamed meat,  soft buns,  thinly pickled,  I d'int come out here to be fickle. WHITE CASTLE SLIDES DOWN THE GULLET, GOT RID OF MY MULLET. Say what you may,  but I be dismayed til 3 months when I come back for the SACK!!

jPrGeuMRPSWw8Gel0D9vNQ.text: While I do like and enjoy my visits to White Castle, this particular location has rapidly gone down hill and is circling the drain.  Key issues with my recent visit.    Rude staff. Not only do they seem to hate their jobs, they seem to hate life. No matter how polite you are to them, how much you smile, they are rude and unpleasant.   Dirty. As in disgusting. Food on floor. Smeared food on tables. Sticky, dirty floor in front of the soda machines. Just very unsanitary look and feel.   Dried nasty onions on the sliders. These things must have been scraped off of a counter. Inedible. Tossed those two directly into the trash. And I didn't dare approach the counter with the issue... As unpleasant as they were, who knows what they would have done to my food. As it was, I did get sick that night. About an hour and a half after eating there. First time I have EVER been sick from eating at ANY White Castle!  The sad part is I was there a year before... Almost to the date. What a HUGE difference. My first trip, it was clean. Staff was friendly. Food was great. I was so looking forward to my return trip to Vegas, and even planned with several friends to ditch the high end eateries at the Venetian/Palazzo, and go on a 'Crave' run. But in one year this location did a 180 and turned into a garbage bin.   Owners/Management please step up and do something to turn it around. Please. I beg you. If you don't, I fear you won't be around next year when I'm back in town, or the Board of Health will button you up. Yes, it was that bad.   Is it too much to ask to have a clean place to eat? With a semi friendly staff? And food that doesn't make you sick soon after eating it?

_XpdIP5sZnbdSCfwtUSdeg.text: Meh... The presence of White Castle in movies, social media and your grocers frozen food aisle planted the seed of curiosity. I just had to know what the excitement was all about. Stories of four hour waits and the Strip White Castle selling out of sliders back on January 29, 2015 during opening day, burgeoned the curiosity. Was it a craving? No interest in standing in lines so no special trip to find and pay for nearby parking to give it a go. However, when friends are staying at the Wynn, it's your day off and you're parking free at the Palazzo you cruise the Strip. It's been a day of Popping Boba, Lobster Tails, lunch salad and after a couple hours of penny slots, we decided to drop some coin in the Casino Royal.   My friend and I noticed White Castle. First impressions of the establishment were not impressive. It looked poorly maintained, trash bins full, tables needed wiping and bussing. Neither she nor I had ever had a White Castle slider so we ordered one each. $1.49 a pop! For this 2 inch by 2 inch burger with a 1/4 teaspoon of grilled onion and a pickle slice??? The patty is less than an ounce at  .89 ounces... the Micky D $1 menu burger you get a 1.9 ounce burger patty.   The Staff was nice and the sliders came quickly. I opened the slider to take a peek. It looked grey, wet and unappetizing but we pressed on. White Castle has been in business since 1921. They have something going on.   The bite...the bun was soft with a shiny exterior, somewhat appealing to the senses. The bun was fresh and had a sweetness kind of in that Hawaiian bun kind of way. There was the savory onion and the subtle beef flavor without the bite and texture I like when eating a burger.   All in all, been there, done that but won't be back. Not for me but please note it's not about me. Some folks can't stand cilantro but I love it. Also note that you can but a stack of 100 sliders for $115; this location sold three the day before.   Tomato, tomahto...

F7Pmq4ag98ZmxDA5lMZwuw.text: 2nd time coming to this location & it won't be my last!  Love White Castle had it since I was little! Wish we had some in Arizona.   Because we didn't have any in Arizona me & my brother & some friends made a spontaneous trip to Vegas just for White Castle! Yes it's True, that's how much we love it!   Best cheeseburger sliders! Make sure you ask for cheese on your sliders, taste so much better. They even have a case for 30 sliders & 100 sliders!   We also tried their onion chips which is suppose to be onion rings but they look like fish. It's cut up but still good.   The sliders are so small you can eat about 4-6 of them depends how hungry you are.   Also you might have to buy extra fries or drinks cause some of the meals don't come with enough, example the 20 pack comes with only 2 fries but I had to buy 3 extra fries cause 5 people were sharing. But 2 extra fries would have been enough.

QUH-pFmnAkM37JfKE4Mhxw.text: Sorry, my dear American friends (and Harold and Kumar) but this place is not good. At. All.  This was our first try of White Castle and we were pretty pumped! However, it didn't turn out the way we had hoped. The staff are slow and the thin, grey colored burger didn't have any taste. And the burger sauce? What is that??   While we were eating a lady who worked there hovered around us during our entire meal. I assumed she was the custodian of the restaurant, but it was creepy and annoying.  I am as disappointed as anyone that we didn't like it :-(

A9OVOgj8UDYBksR8juRTqA.text: 8.99 for 4 cheeseburgers, a drink and fries.  Not sure what the craze is, but it was good. Way too much food for me.. but I love when I have leftovers.  Saves me a trip and money to go to another place for a late night snack.  I'm glad I got to finally experience white castle after everything I've heard and seen, but that will probably be the last time I ever go... It's just not for me, My boyfriend loves it here.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bl5wdJaJ43GuvmDjzY04rQ.text: My husband had been wanting to try White Castle hamburgers for the longest time. Finally made it there and what a disappointment. Crazy crowded line at 3 in the afternoon. But it wasn't the wait to order that was awful, it was the wait to get your order. The staff could not handle it and the girl in charge of noting which orders were coming out could not keep up. She was putting out orders to be handed out without telling the guy which order it was. Luckily another girl came over and took control, sending the other girl back to the prep line.   When we finally got our order 30 MINUTES LATER, super disappointing. The burgers tasted exactly like the ones you can get in the frozen section of your local grocery store. The only difference-A fresh bun (not soggy like when they come out of the microwave).  Guess I won't ever have to make the trek back here or stand in line. I'll get mine from the freezer.

FxVq5tgsRH-Z5IIN6Fe4Kg.text: This place is far from being a White Castle their burgers and not taste the same and when I ordered my food there was a hair on my burger a lot of Riff Raff lot of weird crazy people so you have to watch yourself your family in your wallet when you go here

o-rngXVCd9qrlYFTE4hAfA.text: It's okay. I've always wanted to try fresh White Castle. Fries are super salty burgers taste like the frozen ones.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V4aqOLOvi1wF_XR7ddEYYA.text: We came here New Year's day for a quick take out meal. Upon entering there was a strong smell of urine. Seems to me people use the restroom right outside the establishment door. I almost lost my appetite. I ordered the 4 mini cheeseburger meal. The wait time was about 10 minutes. Once I got my order I wasn't impressed. The bread was soggy and the fries were dry and cold. I can say I have tried White Castle and most likely I will not return.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Ff96oX7e6xBMQD69ZH8zQ.text: Now I understand why Harold and Kumar went through all that trouble to eat White Castle.  I have never been to White Castle before and have wanted to since the moment I watched those movies. For some reason I only recently found out there was a White Castle in Vegas so the next time I went, I had to try it out.   This place is open 24/7 and is next to a casino so it's loud. You'll see a lot of interesting and drunk characters (like we did). There will be a long line no matter what. It's just how it is. Also, you can order beer here (as if you thought you could run away from that in Vegas).  We ordered three original sliders, three cheese sliders, onion chips, and french fries. If you are like me and can't tell how big the sliders are, I finished one slider in 4-5 bites. The onion chips are decent; they're just onion rings in chip form. I'm not a fan of crinkle cut fries so I thought the fries were okay.  This place is the place to go when you're hungry and need some comfort food to munch on and settle in your stomach before you pass out in your bed.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ETE6kJYwfQ_jahlm7KQLXg.text: White Castle on the strip. Amazing drunk food!!  I enjoy White Castle on sober notes as well. My mom and I ate here before our flight back. We hit the line before the lunch crowd appeared.  They give 10% coupons on the street off their value meals. The lady behind us was kind to give us one. We got the meal that comes with 10 cheeseburgers and two fries. It's the appropriate amount of food for two people. We even had some left overs.   The service was slow for a fast food place but I enjoyed getting my White Castle fix as there are none in LA.

D6e24HqehlLAeTIvtrnwWQ.text: The staff was friendly and it was kept up pretty well with the cleanliness. Food came out at a decent time, but the only the that was wrong were my onion chips because they seemed stale and the batter was too thick. I would def. come back here to try other things on the menu, but I wouldn't have those onion chips again

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese burger sliders combo w/ onion chips

sOoSM3jsNP8P3WaKJTjFmQ.text: Was not impressed at all, was so looking forward to this and  it was not my cup of tea. The place was packed orders were quick in and out regardless of how many people they had service was fine for an establishment like this. Food was not the best

WjYUX2_KMnq9tBb1kJbU-w.text: Decided to try the stuff fresh versus the freezer version....and honestly it's not worth the long wait in line, the food didn't have much flavor, and you honestly wouldn't be able to tell the difference if you were blindfolded.    Save your time and money and just experience something else in Vegas and just get this from your local supermarket freezer.

DDlAvnY3ogU7MLAnt2uGOQ.text: They're great for a burger place and we always stop in when at Casino Royale's casino. There's something about how the steamed onions and square burger in a square bun melt in your mouth. I usually add cheese, too. I usually get a bit of onion burp a bit later, but worth the price. The fries are just ok. Crisp crinkly fries, but I'm a McDonald's fries fan.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PmSKwrPmvP9_LL735krGFw.text: Look around you, take it all in.  You are at the OTB of fast food places. Opened 24 hours, they have beer.  I would say, White Castle because of how they cook the burgers, may take slightly longer than say a McDonald's.  So if there are tons of people in line, abandoned ship unless waiting isn't a big deal.  Get the bacon cheese fries, get a burger with jalapeno cheese.

q6qlC60TLnabijjIBTC3lg.text: I'm visiting Las Vegas and have been looking for mozzarella sticks the entire time I've been here and I'm so happy that White Castle had them!! It's the only place that I've been able to find them so that was great, but the only issue for me is the staff here is rude, and slow. My friend and I ordered 2 orders of mozzarella sticks and have been waiting 15 minutes for them and it's not even busy here. I walked up to a worker and asked if he called our number yet because we had been waiting a very long time for a small order. He responded with a nasty look and said "you've only been waiting 12 minutes".  Not for nothing but there's 15 people working behind the counter and max 10 customers ordering food. I'm really disappointed in the pace and attitude of this staff. Idc how strong my craving for mozzarella sticks is on this vacation, I definitely will not be back.

t0DHoHWqS1Bva_dvALSL8Q.text: We order a castle pack,#9 20 original sliders and 2 regular frys, we added chesse. Will should of ordered more frys, the regular frys are kinda small. Burgers came with ketchup, Mayonnaise, mustard and hot sauce packets. Slidders were bomb great taste, nice and hot. They come in lol boxes keeps them from being smashed. We crushed some sliders and we had some to take home. There was an older lady that was cleaning up she was very nice and did a great job. I had to give her a tip. Will be back

You can't help help yourself, they're addicting.. and if you're like me then you'll eat at least 3. Their fries were delicious. I wish they had locations in California!

yxYZqD9GRYIn3WTnwRYqbQ.text: Food and speed of service gets a solid 5 stars. Manny the security guard gets a -5 stars resulting in a score of 1.  Manny should not work with customers.

xw7itgqt_f3utIRJN1Uaug.text: You know, I wasn't too impressed with this joint. The burgers were okay, had those double burger sliders.  They really tasted plain to me. I had to put ketchup on mines to add a little flavor. To me, they didn't live up to the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It didn&#39;t live up to the hype. No taste. Had to put ketchup.

kloRfnnrU_DowHNSl1trhA.text: This place is over hyped and not worth filling up your stomach with, and emptying out your wallet for.  Be prepared to be greeted by two security guards as you enter the front door.  Expect two to four more security guards in the tiny, cramped dining establishment.  That is not intimidating at all.    The GF and I ordered a slider and fries.  I saw them putting pickles on the slider and knew this would be a no go for her.  Sadly, the cashier had already rung us up.  It took an awkward 2-3 minutes for him to refund and re-swipe my credit card.  Sure, it is my fault for making him go through all that trouble. But, could he not have simply told the person making the sliders to not add pickles?    A minute or two after being witness to sheer incompetence, our number is called.  I guess in all the confusion, they forgot to put fries in the bag (even though I was charged for it).    Despite being the only one in line to order, I feel this place can be described as chaotic.  There were so many employees at work.  There must have been hundreds of sliders already pre-cooked and just hanging out, waiting for someone to buy them.  Freshness is definitely not a high concern amongst them.    Now on to the actual taste of the slider and fries.  The slider was nothing special.  It tastes like an exact replica of the microwavable ones.  The fries were average at best.  They taste so plain, and crispiness is word miles away from the texture of them.    Yelpers, you have been warned.  Proceed at your own risk.  If you are drunk, by all means, you will absolutely love it here.  If you have standards, please head to our friend Ronald.

W13afG7xixnnesq1MkkgAQ.text: White Castle Burgers has finally decided to bring their iconic sliders to the West Coast! And Las Vegas is a great place to test the waters. Hopefully with the successes and buzz the Las Vegas store is gettin. There will be more stores opening soon! In the meantime, the one in LV on the strip across from the Mirage Casino resort will do, eventhough they charge an arm n a leg for a tiny burger! I remember it used to only cost 25 cents a slider in the NYC area.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The White Castle onion chips n fish slider r my favorites!
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Expect the price to be higher than your local White Castle franchises!

zaF7zs9aXRR6a9VXB0AT8Q.text: Not sure what all the HYPE about White Castle is all about. You can get a way better burger for cheaper at Shack Shake, Steak N Shake, Fatburger, or even McDonalds, if you want a late night meal, Del Taco is better than White Castle. I think people rate it in the nostalgia feeling and the memories, because it's totally not worth it.  The line did move fast and it was clean, but based on taste, no way. You're in Vegas, were you can get a gourmet burger for $6.99  (at Flemings Steakhouse)  or a decent burger at local bars for the same price.

kX8TsHw6YlY74m8hDPCuyQ.text: I was extremely excited when I found out White Castle came to vegas. I remember eating those ones you get in the freezer section at the grocery store. The burgers at White Castle taste exactly like the ones in the frozen section. I am very disappointed.   First of all, every worker here looks miserable. Does anybody know how to smile? Say thank you? Don't you work in customer service? I've worked in food and beverage and customer service for a long time and I know that your job can be stressful or whatever but at least look up at me and look like you care. I feel this place could benefit from the manager monitoring everyone. Anyway,  I order original cheese sliders and jalapeno cheese sliders. I am awaiting for my number to be called then loudly and obnoxiously on the intercom I hear mine. I'm pretty excited still. I go up to get my food and then ask for ketchup. The lady goes to grab ketchup and hands it to me without saying anything. Then I ask for ranch. She looks irritated and then goes and grabs me ranch. I also asked for mayo then she finally looked up at me, kind of rolled her eyes, grabs that even more frustrated and hands it over. She never said one word to me.  The burgers... were okay. I open the bun and the cheese is not melted. In some of them they were partially melted. But man.. at least throw it in the toaster oven or microwave or something. I hate cold cheese.   It doesn't look like I'll be coming back. I can just go to the store, buy the freezer ones and warm those up.

78-LxMwWFgR8YpjTnhqg6A.text: Ummmmmmm, I don't know. Way too hyped IMO. When you have In N Out or Shake Shack as other options, why would you come here? The sandwiches taste EXACTLY like their frozen ones.. Which makes me wonder.. I guess people enjoy it as drunchies but even as a drunk I didn't like it. I guess the only thing that I thought was alright were the onion rings.  Btw, the next day I was on the toilet for most of the day. Yup. Definitely not a fan.

IdN-nVMIZsibkxW3ozDybw.text: Nothing special except that the prices are way higher than the East coast White Castles! Well, duh Vegas!!! Ordered the #2 combo. It comes with 4 cheeseburger sliders , fries and a drink for $8.99. I really thought i was going to finish all that by myself, but i was wrong!! Definitely, come here if you want to what the big hype is. If you can't, Frozen version from the supermarket is not so much of a difference!

1mL_dBB21eFYXeX1cCikmQ.text: There arent enough adjectives to describe how disgusting the food is. Complete disappointment. Would never try it again.

fA7kfwtkpmrJcc7rduU4OQ.text: It's... fine.  I'm not really sure what I was expecting, but this has been a questionable item on my bucket list since the first Harold and Kumar movie.  Being a west coast girl, this was adventurous fast food cuisine for me.  Turns out the hamburgers taste pretty much exactly like the microwaved versions you buy in the grocery store.  The chicken rings taste a bit like breaded shoe leather, definitely don't bother ordering those.  There can be a a significant wait to get your order, and the dining area is suffused with a quiet, desperate sadness, so if there are no available tables, go get (a lot) of drinks elsewhere and try again later.

bdqSJCx28WCSlzYZAQakbA.text: If I could compare the burgers they're pretty much the exact same ones from the freezer section at any grocery store. Unless I was hungover or drunk I'd probably refrain from coming back. Service was great though!

-_hmsMccHiFTgyB2TQ8R-g.text: Best hang over food. Burgers and fries. Enough said.   Only thing I have problem with is they stop serving coffee after 11am or noon.   Coffee should be all day thing esp in a city like Vegas.  Otherwise burger is pretty much basic and self explanatory. Cheeseburger over regular burger and you need to eat at least 3 of those to compare to eating one burger since it's so small.  Get regular fries and onion rings... they both go well with the burger. They also have beer on tap.  Enjoy!

C36ujYeKf33sSpvVZj-xYg.text: Hellooooooo White Castle! I've been waiting for you to come to the West Coast (or as close as can be to the West Coast) since the Harold and Kumar movie. Yes, it's been THAT long. -_- And those White Castle sliders in the frozen aisle of the grocery store do not do it justice! Located in the Best Western Casino Royale, in between Venetian and Harrah's, they're open 24/7, perfect for late night munchies and as expected for a Vegas spot! There's a direct entrance off the strip so you don't have to go through the casino floor. The direct entrance takes you through the dining area first while you make your way back to the counter to queue up and order.   BF went all out for 2 people and got the #9 combo pack, which includes 20 original sliders and 2 orders of french fries. Just 10 sliders short of a crave case cardboard box, which meant our order was packed slightly discreetly in a paper bag with a plastic bag instead. LoL. Sliders come with bun, patty, pickle, and onions. Cheese is an extra $6 (about 33 cents per slider) for the #9 combo and was well worth it! I bit into the slider with low expectations because I've been searching for them for so long and I didn't want to hype up the slider only to be disappointed. I wasn't. Flavorful and all gone in 4 bites (2 for the BF). Enough flavor on its own. You can also politely ask for some sauce (meant for dipping chicken tenders but oh well). I used ranch, BBQ and zesty zing on some of the sliders. Even though we ordered and took it to go, and made the 15 minute trek back to our hotel room to enjoy, the burgers were slightly damp, but still good!   How successful were we in finishing the entire order? Maybe 70% of the way through. We dusted off all the fries and had only some sliders left. The remaining 30% was an excellent breakfast/lunch (not brunch since it was a weekday) meal!

LiHFd-WeqzCEdp2MSoORzA.text: Ok so for those of us who have never ever had a White Castle from an actual "White Castles" I was so freaking stoked about my visit to this holy grail. I truly believe I had the  exact same feeling that Harold and Kumar had when they finally arrive at the place where they have been dying to get to all because they have been yearning for those little magical sliders in the pretty little white box.  As I stepped through the double glass door from the Las Vegas strip and entered this gold mine I was filled with happiness. Who would have ever thought that we would be so lucky to have a White Castle here, but I guess dreams do come True.  The line was not bad and space was pretty small and yes they only have 2 cash register but there was an army of workers in the back cranking out them sliders and the food came out fast. As I am placing my order I am still in disbelief that I didn't have to travel to the east coast to experience this must try burger joint. Any how that was just it. I am giving them a 4 stars because although everything was great the burger itself the one thing that this place is all so famous for was good but I wish was better by being hot and fresh.   I totally understand that in order to meet demands and keep customers happy by getting their food quick they must constantly pump out burgers and let them sit there, and that's where it suffers I think. I burgers itself was a little cold. But never the less I was extremely content. I ordered almost every item on the menu because even though I wish it was a hope skip and a jump, it is not easy for us locals to just drive up and pick us up a bag full of burgers...no you must be strategic about it and actually plan your day to enjoy this place and it's food.   All in all everything was good and I defiantly will be back again and again. I'm crossing my fingers they will open up other locations where we can just pull up to a drive thru and satisfy our cravings a little easier. I think I have been building up the anticipation about White Castles since the movie Harold and Kumar and never thought I would ever get to taste them or get to one without actually leaving Vegas but now I can. So say what you want about this place I am just so happy that after all these years I Finally Made it to WHITE CASTLES!!!! Thank you for opening one up in Vegas.   Oh and the staff was super nice too!!!  ***OOPS I PUT THIS PLACE IS DRESSY BUT I MEANT CASULE*** I hope we all could figure that out! LOL
