u2ZNACiOMC406BSixKGMYg.text: It's White Castle.. It's late night munchies.Grab a bag or box of burgers get a milkshake. The power is bulk burgers, you are supposed to buy a bunch of them.  Not as good as a $10 burger? Yeah no kidding, Its a buck.   I personally hold the pickle on the cheeseburger.  The staff is great, and the lineup seems long but it does move along at a fair clip.  Now open one in LA guys...

ZCxSprLl4cvAmMxEdRcsdg.text: My first time ever!! And it did not disappoint! We grabbed one of the large packs which included 20 sliders. They are small since they are sliders but they are yummy! Flavorful cheesy meaty goodness that melts in your mouth!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy meaty goodness

xYmddD9LEtZSoPK0x7u52w.text: Been wanting to try this place since everyone keeps talking about it. Came on the day of Christmas and it was packed but we managed to get a table and came before the rush. Ordered the fish slider, chicken slider, and the regular beef slider. The sliders were good but the portion were so tiny compared to photos..I enjoyed it but it was gone before I knew it..took like 3 bites and it's gone. I wish the patty was slightly bigger, it was quite thin I almost missed it. The fish slider was delicious and super soft. The chicken slider was probably best out of all 3 for me. Please increase your portion!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish slider and cheeseburger slider.

HiZbImFBVgub3vfdz9Tzuw.text: I think just like most people, my curiosity for White Castle developed after watching the first Harold & Kumar. I never wanted to settle for the frozen stuff because I wanted to try the real thing, or at least as close as I could to the real thing which was the location in Vegas.  I love sliders. If sliders are on the menu, I'm 110% all about sliders. They're just really delicious, bite-sized, soft and convenient little burgers. My girlfriend thought they were okay and tasted just like the frozen ones, but every bite was extremely satisfying.  It ended tragically though. My motor skills weren't all there and I dropped a whole slider on the floor. Rest in peace, slider I never got to enjoy.

xqLlTuQ_qFxDJaphUWXWmQ.text: White Castle has always been on my bucket list, thanks to Harold and Kumar.  Last time my family and I visited Las Vegas, my brothers went and raved so much about the place. So we just went and honestly, I'm not sure how I feel about the place. The burgers itself were kind of dry but I really did like the grilled onions in it. I just think if there was some sort of sauce in the burgers, it would've been much better. I was expecting much more.  However, the price wasn't that bad. We got the combo with 20 burgers and two fries and it cost $25. So that wasn't bad at all.  Overall, I'm glad I got to go to the place for the experience but I'm not keen on going back anytime soon.

Ov_HMPOFBYjLH-hltNs6_g.text: Since we've never had white castle aside from the frozen burgers from the grocery store this was a must stop.  We had the luck of getting a 10% off coupon while on our way there.   We opted for the number 7 combo which consisted of 10 sliders, 2 fries, and 2 drinks. We upgraded the sliders to have cheese because who can eat a burger without cheese? Total after discount came to around 21 bucks.  The sliders were good and didn't require ketchup surprisingly. The fries come unseasoned so you need to add your own salt and pepper.  The downside is that you wind up having gas all day after eating them. The plus side is theyre way better than the freezer stuff.

JyMOZ8blazhFOhCZFjoVag.text: Bomb i wish they had one in los angeles! Every time im vegas i have to visit and order the #2

R2hxF9WGadFi1_Q7Ij1_vg.text: It's very good, but being from Chicago it just taste as authentic... I'll try again in a little while.

n9gZSK7uTdTQxZumXb0CTQ.text: Cashier was sweet, but whitecastle has this weird taste to their food that makes me gag.  The water or steam that cooks like food mixes together or something.  I've lost the taste to these little jewels... It's just not a burger.

xJdw-F7mm7RgMX6Y6H8fAQ.text: Me personally I didn't like it all it taste weird to me and it smelled like a dead animal n my opinion I will not return to any because it's just not for my taste buds the staff was friendly and very knowledgable about the menu and suggestive selling... The lines can be long but that's expected need more setting...it was pretty clean   Overall I rated it 2 stars because of staff....

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The #2

YUwNt-BRNPj7IgbU-0arHw.text: White Castle was a must-try on this last trip to Vegas with my friends.   We each ordered the original sliders with cheese combo, which comes with four sliders, fries and a drink. I liked the overall flavor of the sliders, especially the grilled onions, but the patty was like the consistency of a McDonald's patty. I also liked that there were different sauce options but some were kinda bland. Fries were good, no problems there. I did appreciate that the sliders were individually boxed and that it was reasonably priced.  Service was awesome - everyone at this location was so sweet and made sure that our order was correct.   I really don't have much to compare White Castle to but I have to say that out of In-n-Out, Shake Shack, and White Castle - In-n-Out is still my number one choice when it comes to a burger. If you haven't tried White Castle, it's definitely worth a trip to cross it off your burger bucket list.

kyJwSQbBO-RoS8U72kZc-Q.text: Ever since I was a kid listening to the Beastie Boys rap about White Castle, I have always wanted to go there. Living in So Cal, we don't have the opportunity.  Low and behold signs on the way to Vegas advertising for White Castle.   No traffic, no crowds, no parking issue was going to keep us from going.  Park behind and walk to the front of the strip location.   The customer service was great, the location is clean and inviting and the food was so, so delicious.  The burgers were just as good as I had hoped, and the dipping sauce zangy sauce was OUTSTANDING.  I tried to find a copycat recipe of it online, but have failed.    I will definitely, be back when in Vegas again!   Love White Castle.

yF0tom1xKa0i-mJojCJU3Q.text: A White Castle on the west side of the country!  Being from California, I'm surprised they have invade this state yet.    Tried the Las Vegas location on a short trip recently.  It's a bit tough to get to.  I parked at the Venetian and took the long walk all the way to the strip to get to the restaurant.  It's not necessarily big but there should be enough tables to accommodate who's in line.  If you've had White Castle before, I always say its good if its late night eats or if you're pretty drunk, or both.  Other than that, the food isn't exceptionally great.  In fact, it's actually a bit on the expensive side.  A four slider meal with a handful of crinkly fries and a coke goes for about $10 after tax.  Not really cheap.  You actually might still be hungry after that.  I don't hate it but if it was a few bucks cheaper, I think it would be a better value for your buck.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Register counter
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small and so good (when drunk)!
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Four cheeseburger meal. A bit pricy compared to the East Coast.

JztXi1Oc-PDTO6A1U4_x-g.text: Went here on a busy Saturday night and there was ONE PERSON taking orders and over ten people on the assembly line - extremely poor management of man power.  There were workers goofing off or just blankly staring off into space.  I felt bad for the guy taking orders.    Food wise: sliders were OK, nothing special and definitely over hyped by the movie Harold and Kumar.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original sliders &amp; sliders with jalapeño cheese (the best).

ck_fuGHzOtg7J9z25Kb5EA.text: It's always busy here, but to me, it's worth the wait. Every time we are in Vegas we make a stop for White Castle. This time I tried the onion chips and loved them. Burgers are always good. I wish they had one in my city. Maybe one day.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y2ww9W3vjepRjihHqnOkxA.text: After years of eating the frozen burgers from the grocery store, I finally got to try them in person in a real location. I'll be honest, these are not the best burgers I've ever had - nor are they best sliders either. But hey, they're tasty and they get the job done. They're pricey but that's common in Vegas, but I must say the sliders with cheese are delicious. Their chicken rings, yes "RINGS" are delicious as well. So if you find yourself nearby while walking the strip and need either a small snack or full meal, try it.  It's not the best burger in town, but it's a tasty for what it is.

1x5xGqyKg9vtfrIXKVd6uw.text: Need to be a teenager, drunk, or stoned. It took 15 minutes for a single to go original slider. Greasy, heavy on sauteed onion, very thin patty with very little texture... I'll take a McDonald's hamburger any day. Looked better in the movies.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T0vDAcf6bDpmvGI-XvwIsw.text: I grew up on the west coast, so White Castle is a relatively new phenomenon for me. I've been here at least 3 times, and I have to say that it tastes the best after a long night out.  This is located in the Casino Royale casino, in between Venetian and Harrah's.  This past time we went, we tried 1 of almost every slider available. Here's my personal ranking from best to worst: Double cheese slider  Original slider w/ egg and cheese  Cheese slider  Fish slider and veggie slider Chicken ring slider and chicken breast slider I hope that makes sense. I honestly couldn't tell the difference between the two chicken sliders. The fries are a must here, especially when they're freshly fried. Also, don't forget to ask for all your sauces at the counter when you pick up your food! The food usually comes out pretty quickly, so don't be discouraged by long lines!

ZmV4SO04-xC2Q_98cRbTVQ.text: finally tried this place out. the food is way overpriced for what you get. low quality overpriced. first time is the last time.

bJJuIFmT52A-Ye6kZ54I6g.text: Growing up back east we would go to white castle and get the burgers by the dozen. Of course that was many years ago and you could get them for around 25 cents, that's really showing how long ago that was. So I was glad to see one open here on the strip. So I packed up the wife (who never had one) and off we went. After a short walk and a short line we ordered. Shocked by the prices, but everything costs more today. Told the wife how good these were while growing up. I guess all things change from what I remember. As soon as I pulled the burger from the package it seemed the burger was way thinner than I remembered and after the first bite I was disappointed on the taste. Guess this is off our list on coming back along with the "shake shack" also. How disappointed this was from the memories of my youth. Pay a little more and find one of the other burger places nearby so not to be disappointed.

xONZEbEbkzDjYOy9AmRZdA.text: Leave it to Las Vegas to ruin a Midwest gem. I was looking forward to White Castle being here but it is definitely not the same. I expected there to be a wait so I won't complain about the 1 hour and a half that I stood in line but I will complain that the line is like General admission for the club. I don't think they thought thoroughly about having a line outside on a busy strip sidewalk. Also I wasn't that far back in the line so I thought once I got into the building I would be minutes from ordering. Okay so the food; when I received my burgers they were lukewarm after coming fresh off of a grill! I also ordered chicken rings and they didn't have honey mustard! Dont even get me started on the employees! They need to bring some people from the MIDWEST to train these people. For those who have not had White Castle before this is not what all of us Midwest folks were excited about! It wasn't nearly the experience from back home! I agree with those that said you can go to the frozen section for what they are serving up here. Also they need to figure out how to get one off of the strip and with a drive-thru and breakfast. I will not be returning to this location.

sVqCFYcC2CvEsjnXGFsbOw.text: The white castles I had here were just ok. A lot of the flavor comes from the onions and i was lucky if I got onions on each burger. I remember eating them as a kid all the time in the seventies in New Jersey and they were really tasty back then. Perhaps the meat isn't the same too because you know big business. Let's cheapen the food and raise the prices because all we care about are profits. You can't slip anything by me though because my palate is so sensitive. From now on when I see a White Castle I will think twice before I stop. Such a shame.....

AjXO5rY1hsvPxaSRuRU-1Q.text: I have only ever lived in the west coast, so after watching "Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle" as a kid, the idea of eating a white castle burger has always been in my mind. I finally had a chance to try it in Vegas.  I am not a burger expert but I am going to say the bread to meat ratio is way off. Every bite I took, it felt like I got a sliver of meat and a mouth full of bread. I had to force each bite down with a large gulp of soda. Overall, I am very happy I got a chance to try it, but it will probably not be on my list of fast food to eat.  TLDR: Keep expectations low. Try it for the lolz

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bite size burgers

01uulcbQt2eb2tG6GmUcJw.text: I've been trying to eat at a White Castle since 2004, but living on the west coast has made that a geographic challenge.  Its been 14 years since I saw Kal Penn and John Cho's awesome hysterical movie "Harold and Kumar go to White Castle". Fortunately White Castle decided to open a couple of locations in Las Vegas, not far from my native San Diego!  Well...those slim, salty, soft, gentle, and delicious cheese sliders lived up to the hype and satisfied all my dreams!  Its not your typical burger, these sliders are served in the softest white bread bun with a extraordinarily thin slice of beef, grilled onions, pickle and generic American cheese...somehow these very basic ingredients combine into a near perfect harmony of meaty, cheesy, and carby deliciousness.    $8.99 for the 4 cheese slider combo with fries and fountain drink...I'm sure that's much more expense than the typical non-Vegas location, but its cheaper than trying to drive out to the east coast to save a couple bucks. Note: Avoid the chicken sliders...so gross!

Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SzC4S0SWdxkTLAGksD3jTw.text: Hadn't tried a White Castle burger before this past weekend. It was delish! The simple double cheese slider was so tiny but had a lot of flavor. Yum!  I gave three stars because the employees weren't very welcoming. Other than the tasty burger snack, the rest of my visit wasn't very memorable.

7sZWxUNmnSXBzq8MPPLvlw.text: Been wanting to try this place for the longest. I've never been to any other location, so this review is based on this location only. My expectations weren't too high since I've heard from others that it wasn't all that and I have to agree. Sliders are tiny and taste exactly like the McDonald's cheeseburgers. 4 cheese sliders, fries, and a drink were 8.99. Also tried the chicken rings (which I thought were gross), the onion chips (tasty), and the fries (just okay). Line looked long but waited about 10 minutes to order and maybe another 15 to actually get the food. I'm glad I got to try it and make my own opinion about it but I wouldn't have it again.

1ht6DMhQBLTQ7r1pYmGdsQ.text: Really wanted some sliders for breakfast and White Castle seemed like a pretty good option as it was right outside our hotel.  Ordered one regular breakfast slider (egg and bacon), another one with sausage, hashbrown bites and a coffee. The egg and bacon slider was pretty good, the sausage one had a very weird taste, but the hashbrown was the real MVP here. The coffee was absolutely terrible, had a sip and I had to throw it out.  Service... nonexistent, we were the only ones there and even though there were 5 people in the back 'working' our food took an eternity, not because of the cooking part, but cause the people were basically sloths.

lvDVbKeenYJNjxAKgyleZw.text: Ate here as a quick late night meal and made the mistake of eating here sober. Being connected to a casino you would obviously expect it to look like it had some major traffic going through it and did it. The restaurant was run down and dirty looking, homeless people littered the place. We waited in a long line for at least 20 minutes and finally ordered. There were about 20 or so people working behind the scenes to ensure this machine ran efficiently as possible and they failed completely. After ordering it took a solid 30 mins to get our food. And when we go it is was cold and not very impressive, I know I know what did I expect? Well....what I got I suppose.

d1IZpnyeqbEt8Mv1BdYFmw.text: Came here with my husband in the middle of a hot afternoon looking for a quick bite. I used to live in Tennessee so I knew what to expect food-wise. The line was long but moved fairly quickly and we were able to get a table. Food was ready pretty quickly and as we set our bags on the table we noticed the grease already starting to come through the bag. But this is totally normal for any fast food place.  I gotta say, this was a good choice for burgers and fries in Vegas. AND we were completely sober! I imagine this spot is packed at night with people looking to soak up their booze (or other substances). If you need something quick and less expensive, this is a solid choice!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. When the grease is coming through the bag you know it&#39;s gonna be good

pVDPZgAZQ3daa8SUV_uIsg.text: For me the staff was friendly, attentive, the slider was hot and fresh.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qCgulSbUhT0OIYRVv9g4Pw.text: Everyone talks about WC but it wasn't very tasty for me and my three kids. My husband enjoyed his #1 but we didn't.  The cheese fries were decent and my son preferred the chicken slider over the originals.

f7_ZnyQYSavO7MqogZmA0Q.text: This place is too hyped up. The sliders have too much onion. The meat on them is as thin as a slab of cheese you're basically ordering onion sliders. They're not too bad when youre eating them but wait till after when youre burping them out for 5 hours. Never coming back here again. Also too overpriced.

6mC_JcdukEivaqxFRsoliA.text: How did the jury find the hamburger? Grill-ty as charged!  Making our way down the strip to check out the Venetian, Joyce W. insisted that we stop by White Castle. Adamant that having only had the frozen White Castle burgers, I absolutely HAD to try the real thing. And, being that her advice has never led me astray before, I was all for it!  So, after making our way through a few of the sketchier casinos farther down the strip for the sake of escaping the heat, we finally found it. Nestled way back in Casino Royale! Not the fanciest place for them to be, but it really doesn't matter all that much to me. They do have a door that leads straight out onto the strip, but being that it's summertime, you take the walk through the sketchy casino.  As for the food, we tried four plain sliders with cheese and one fish slider. Proooobably wouldn't try the fish slider again... But, the cheeseburger sliders were great! I very much enjoyed them. Not-so-surprisingly, they were much better than their frozen counterparts!   Having now tried this iconic chain, I don't think I'd necessarily make it a destination. It's definitely someplace I'd pop into if I were close and wanted some simple noms, though.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish slider and four cheeseburger sliders!
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bOxs_uM6dg3YhjBEDG9IwA.text: Bad customer service, made the food just that much worse. Will definitely not be visiting again.

Y2FnwLh6rgX3_n5NO-taMg.text: We were looking for a quick stop for lunch on the strip.  White Castle is located in the Casino Royale and right off the main drag.  There were 4 of us who shared a mega pack that had 2 orders of chicken rings, 2 fries and 10 sliders.  Definitely enough to feed 3 of us!  The food wasn't anything out of this world but still pretty tasty for fast food.  We did ask for our sliders plain as they come with grilled onions and pickles and we saw them scrapping them off existing burgers they had pre-prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders, fries and chicken rings.

AMPpeWvr_D2ZMK-ykIv96w.text: I have stumbled into this place after midnight twice on two separate vacations. Staff was always speedy and polite, restaurant was also in pristine condition considering the time of night and the number of patrons the location was servicing. If you need a quick bite to hold you over while bar hopping, stop in and get sorted.

jsXVTAUxtjGsZ9Xzf9_C_w.text: It's good food for stoners or drunk people looking for a late night bite. The burgers are really oily and fries are basic, but none the less tasty. Wouldn't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original white castle burger and fries

zhVcn9JB5Ty8SVcnsk3nVw.text: For all the hype and the noise my friend made about White Castle it was only fitting that we went on our trip to Vegas because we don't have one in Washington. We decided to order one of their combo meals and the smile that lit up on his face told me that it had to be good.   Of course after getting our order and mocking him the burgers and onion fries tasted exactly how we thought it would taste. Definitely not a bad thing but also something that I wouldn't crave. For a fast food chain, especially visiting the one that's smacked right on the Vegas Strip, I wasn't disappointed but also wasn't overly impressed. The dining area was clean and maintained and the service was timely.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dF1cx-i6o2IJGTDtEOVgkA.text: I'd prefer to give it a 2.5 rating.  I am so appreciative that the owners of the local Las Vegas area White Castles finally joined the corporate-owned restaurants in offering the Impossible Burger patties.  They're much better than those nasty Dr Praeger veggie patties they used to serve up until earlier this month.  But come-on, guys. $3.60 (plus tax) for each vegetarian slider?    You're White Castle, and these are sliders.   Please come back to reality, and lower the price.  I know they're quite popular -- only three people in-line -- the woman in front of me ordered one, I ordered five, and a guy that picked up his order shortly before I did had ordered some too.  But I really believe by lowering your price, you could greatly increase sales & profit off the volume -- with a reasonable price, you could count me in for about 10 a month, instead of the 5 I had being it for the whole year.  The place wasn't busy when I placed my order at 1:44PM on a week day -- just one couple in front of me, one or two people behind me, and maybe about 10 people in the dining area.   Yet after waiting 11 minutes to hear my order # called, I decided to walk-up to the pickup area to investigate.  There was a bag sitting on a prep table, a worker called-out someone else's # & he came to pick his up (he'd also ordered some Vegetarian sliders) and after it was handed to him, I asked the worker about mine. She checked, and it turned out to be the bag that's been sitting on the prep table for the past couple minutes, but she told me it'd just been made ready.  It was now close to 14 minutes after I was issued my receipt, again, at a fairly slow time.  As much as I love their new vegetarian burger using the Impossible patty, 14 minute wait for White Castle *sliders* that cost $3.60 +tax apiece -- $17.95 before tax for the five *sliders* to fill my belly is NOT at all a good deal, and for that price, I can go to a nicer place and get a full-sized veggie cheeseburger with the Impossible patty, plus fries or a drink.  I also ordered Onion Chips.  I shouldn't have. Very little flavor, & a tough deep-fry coating that made me worry about chipping a tooth.  Yeah, you're on the high-rent Las Vegas Strip, but you're WHITE CASTLE, serving SLIDERS inside Casino Royale, not some place serving full-size burgers or located inside The Wynn.  The fact that you have a uniformed security guard there much of the time to shoo the vagrants out should remind you that you're not a classy place.   I love those veggie burgers, but PLEASE lower the price to something commensurate with who you are, where you are, and what you're serving.    I won't  be back until that happens.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 minutes after I ordered 5 sliders &amp; 1 onion chip side, I finally got up to see what the delay was.
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almost $18 for just five sliders!  Actually when you include tax, it was over $18 for five.

2kUHuxJci8DI_wT6OSWnIQ.text: You can never go wrong with a late night snake at white castle. This is a real convenient location right on the strip. The cheeseburgers are small and can devourable in1 second. Nom nom nom. The fries are just ok though, hence the 4 star. Also, the sliders could be a little less expensive for it's size. All being said, I would come here for the drunken times in vegas again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 30 cheeseburger box

mtet7HAWYTcSfOKn4x1ptg.text: My boyfriend has this inexplicable love for White Castle, despite only having the versions from the frozen section at Safeway. When we walked past White Castle on the Strip - we had literally JUST eaten dinner - but he was so excited he went inside and bought 10 sliders. He vowed that we would end our night here as well (which we did, at 4 AM).   The sliders are super cute, and each come in a personal sleeve so they're easy to eat. The bread they use is super soft and fluffy. I wasn't a huge fan of the cheese (it tastes like Kraft American singles) but the plain hamburger tasted pretty good! When we came back after a night out, I tried the Mozarella sticks. Not sure if they were actually amazing, or it was just the alcohol - but they were delicious! Great place for drunchies, especially since they're open 24/7

YGEGP7TtPsogJky634eh0A.text: Drunken 2:30am Vegas nostalgic mid-west food at its finest. Sliders were great and just what I remembered. Fries were a bit disappointing, but again, drunken 2:30am Vegas food.

iMgWJpDYJWczU5p8Ja7j7w.text: I think it's pretty pathetic that a market like California does not have a physical White Castle location. Is it really that bad for business here? Why must we be relegated to the grocery store freezer for a taste of their burgers?   Luckily for us there is one on the strip in Vegas. Understanibly they're open 24/7 to keep up with the demand. This is the second time I've been to this one. The people aren't the nicest or maybe they're just tired after dealing with drunkards for the duration of their entire shift, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  The food here with the exception of the onion chips is awesome and fresh. You can't go wrong with the cheeseburgers and cheese fries but avoid the double burgers as they have extra bread and tend to be a little soggy. There's always a line so patience is a must but it'll be well worth it in the end. Hope we get a real one soon.

ASnfrdHrwdOCODMx-B_qlQ.text: What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas... right??? Well, not my Yelp review-heehee! This place is small and quick to grab a little snack. By little snack I am not kidding. The food here is tiny! I absolutely loved the fish burger it is a must when you're here! Please, make sure to request the tartar sauce. I also, ordered a the special White Castle burgers and they were okay. You may have to order a few because, there small. I had the cheesecake and it was tiny and okay. You're better off getting dessert elsewhere. The cheese sticks were amazing! These are a must when you come to eat here. Overall, the place is clean but, there is NO sense of urgency. They all look real brand new working here and the customer service is something can work on!   Until, next time Vegas...

IY9EN0L7HS8Uy-DJjGW95g.text: This review is in comparison to White Castle I had at New York almost 10 years ago which I really enjoyed that I grabbed extra 6 pack to go to eat in the plane on the flight back to LA.  Going back to reminiscent on the past experience and to give a new experience to my kids we visited the Las Vegas location despite its review.  Kids liked the burgers.  What I've noticed wast that buns were too soggy.  Kids wanted 2nd serving so I ordered them twice.  2nd time, same thing.  Buns were too soggy.  I tried it but don't think I'll come back to this location.  I will be going back to NY in couple month and I'll try to jog my memory but what I had in this Vegas location didn't taste as good as one I had in NYC.  In fact I'm almost tempted to say microwave version probably taste better than this location.   I saw a sign at Jean, NV.  Maybe I'll try that location driving to Vegas to see if that one is better.

XqcrKcv3sD4Lzl4BFqAoyw.text: I got there at 11:00am and asked for a veggie burger.  They were out.  How can a fast food restaurant be out of something on the menu?  I'm guessing they just didn't want to have to remove them from the freezer to accommodate one customer. I ordered two doubles and asked them to hold the middle slice of bread.  Didn't happen. For the money and for the wait this place is not worth the trouble.  It's sad because I have happy childhood memories of White Castle on the east coast.  Guess it just doesn't transfer well.

w9RuntWHfRjfl3Ok7GjKuA.text: This review might be biased because I wasn't drunk or high as a kite; it seems that you have to be extremely wasted cause honestly white castle is shit LMFAO. Yet there is that charm of:  "If I was absolutely wasted this ball of grease would be heaven."  But let's be honest, it's shit.

GTNOumFk7r9JtAUTNQQ7TA.text: Not sure how I feel about White Castle. It is definitely not the best quality of burgers and the slider meats were super thin. I also ordered the chicken fingers and it tastes just like the Costco Dino bites maybe worse than that.  Overall, this place is quite expensive for a meal. I don't think I'll be returning back to White Castle again.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Castle life

hlr6FLMvlPpqJde7WmAwlQ.text: What a way to ruin a great memory from childhood. I came to Las Vegas for a sad mission to say goodbye to my mother who's lived here the last 30 years. I came to this White Castle because we grew up in Chicago and I knew coming here would bring back fond memories of what castles with my mom. What a horrible terrible disappointing mistake this was. Its 3 in the morning and the line to get the food is crazy the service is incredibly slow and the nasty clientele hang around here selling drugs begging for money looking like hookers is just absolutely disgusting. I am going to take my meal and leave I cannot wait to get away from this place. I'm almost tempted to not even wait for my hamburgers and just leave. This location is a horrible representation of White Castles. It should be closed just for the hookers alone. The Beggars and the drug dealers don't help either.

kltsUI0D3-mhdz-9j1GWYw.text: Over priced, over hyped ; Mc Donald I won't ever take you for granted.   This place is not worth going to; if you really want white castle just purchase the frozen one because it taste exactly the same. I highly do not recommend this place

czFCVgxVC-1LF-ko33UsTQ.text: While in town visiting Vegas, I had to stop by to taste a fresh White Castle slider. When you go to their site it will list numerous of locations near me, but that is because they sell the frozen sliders. There are no White Castle locations near me so I had to try one.  As soon as I got there, there was plenty of seats and no line. It was in the afternoon when I got there. I was surprised to see they had beer there. That's cool! Beer and sliders. Great! I ordered my food and it came out quickly. Woohoo! I'm glad I came at the time I did since the place got busy as I was leaving.  I went with the cheese sliders and fries. The sliders were warm and tasty. They were so good. The bread was soft and the patty was tasty. I wasn't expecting crinkle fries for the fries. They were ok. This is a place you should try at least one.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Slider with fries

USOKx8i4GgbFrLyru2P1JA.text: 2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge -     47/100  I had no idea these palm size burgers existed till I watched Harold and Kumar in the theater, 10+ years ago! Because of that movie (one of my fave movies btw), I have also been a fan of White Castle before trying those bite size burgers.   Luckily, before they opened up shop in Vegas, I had to settle for the frozen squares at the local market.   Now that we are lucky to have our own White Castle, I finally got to try them!   I was not disappointed. I knew what to expect and I can say that they taste a little better than the frozen - microwave version I tried before. Still a fan.   It's convenient if you're walking the Strip. Once you pass this, you're gonna wanna pop in and grab a couple to continue your walk.    There are toppings available. Try them if you haven't before. Prices are reasonable. Keep in mind, it's on the Strip.   The only thing missing was a photo booth with Harold and Kumar! haha John Cho..... :-)

XWuW5D5n4VuPkpwt_JXTEQ.text: YAY! Finally we get a White Castle on the west coast area. I live in California and they do not have one here. We decided after riding the High Roller we would pick up some burgers.  There are two locations in Vegas, this one is located on the strip, and the other is somewhere in Fremont. This one is located inside Casino Royale. We entered right from the strip, so we had to walk through the casino, but then we saw there is an entrance that will take you right through to White Castle's seating area. There is not a ton of room to sit and eat, which was fine since we took our food to go. The line was long, which from what I saw was constantly long. This location is open 24/7. I ordered a #1, 4 burgers, fries and a drink for $8, a side of onion chips for about $2 and change, and a brownie on a stick for $2. It was like $13 and change. They were out of the cheesecake on a stick which I wanted to try. You can get ranch, mustard, ketchup, and other condiments for your meal.The staff wasn't super friendly and seem annoyed with tourist. So these reviews on here crack me up, because many people think this is supposed to be a high class burger joint. Dude, it's White Castle. It's what Harold and Kumar, our stoner friends from the early 2000's, embarked on to try. This food is for sure drunk/stoner/junk food.  Now, my favorite menu item was the onion chips, which are pieces of onions deeper fried and super crunchy. Really tasty and addicting. I recommend with ranch! The fries taste like any crinkle cut french fries you may have had elsewhere, but weren't bad. The burgers themselves were good, greasy for sure! The patty is super thin and comes with onion and pickles. I didn't eat the burger with condiments seeing as though I wanted to keep the traditional taste of White Castle. My friend was not a fan, and had ate the frozen ones at the grocery store. I never had, and I didn't mind it. I would get again for sure, but it's not my favorite!

3vbK0S0PmDnZWgiicZFTsw.text: Well, my experience at White Castle Las Vegas was consistent with a lot of others: just short of bad.   We stopped by midday and ordered one of the slider meals, adding mozzarella sticks to it. In the long wait for our food, I noticed that every person working behind the counter looked miserable. Everyone.   The food that comes out of this kitchen (despite its fast food quality) does not equate to the product sold elsewhere. Add to this the fact that prices are marked up to "Strip value."  Come to the Casino Royale to grab a few cheap beers at the bar adjacent to this place, but don't feel bad if you decide to skip White Castle.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders &amp; mozza sticks
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

Ns82jGBzzPl0zIoemW0AHg.text: I lived in Indiana for 9 years. I learned to appreciate White Castle from the locals. I'm going with 5 Stars due to years of memories from that extended experience. This was before things like WC fish burgers and the newest veggie option. I don't understand all the 3 Star reviews and won't even try to. All I can do is state my own opinion.   Venue: Very small shop, by Las Vegas standards,  that is right off the strip and is right next to/inside of  a casino. Most easily reached by walking a distance once you find a place to park. There is no convenient parking to speak of. So I recommend combining a trip to WC with something else. Small eating area that was full because the shop was so busy.  Food: The traditional White Castle menu is very simple. Onion Chips, Regular White Castle Burgers, and White Castle Cheese Burgers. But, I don't eat meat burgers anymore. So I was very interested in trying the fish burgers and veggie burgers. These are non-traditional items. I'm sure some are shocked and appalled with the concept. I was motivated to give these a try as I may not get to the midwest in the near future.  Veggie Burger: Good but a great effort at providing meatless. i appreciate the effort. They provide a choice of sauces with these as they are needed. The fish burgers were a similar strong effort. Well appreciated by those on dietary restrictions.   Yes,  I was a bit underwhelmed by the veggie burgers but the chance to indulge myself in old memories was priceless. I'm glad I made the effort to seek out this White Castle experience.  Service: 5 Star Service from a very busy crew.

Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. grill
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qPHXqZoYNjDorU_kcibi7w.text: First time trying this place and tbh it was just ok. I got he cheese slider and the double. When it came out it looked kinda gross tbh. It wasn't very appetizing but tasted just alright. Not too sure if I would come back.

sDjJfVzVMYZjZRdSK3JhOQ.text: After years and years of waiting to try these after watching Harold and Kumar.......I eagerly opened the box containing the burger only to find the thinnest piece of Meat (I'm talking like 1/8th of an inch...yes 1/8th) inside of the burger. It wasn't bad as the bread was pretty tasty but just wasn't great. The fries were not good. Reminded me of frozen Ore Ida ones. Would not come back again. Save urself the trouble of coming here.   My kids got the chicken ones and liked them more than the beef ones.

LhkIKkS1LLAs-PahOfU-pA.text: I'll be honest, this is the first White Castle I've ever had the pleasure of visiting. After seeing one in Saturday Night Fever as a kid, I've always wanted to eat at one. The food is REALLY good, and the vibe of the place REALLY cool!!!!

tjdE3i4YBThpZS60-1YVRQ.text: Ebony treated me so fantastically. It's my birthday and I was so surprised white castle was open 24 hours! The staff was so friendly and inviting

cRtzGeVI704c_blx0hJovg.text: This is as good as it gets late night noshing. They don't look great, the location is small and weird right inside of the gross Casino Royale, everyone inside is plastered, and it just doesn't matter. When your number is called and those little boxes of heaven are handed over, all the pain in the world goes away and the most amazing flavor of deliciousness is all that matters.  I suggest getting doubles; double the meat, double the cheese, double the fun! I just prefer the extra meat and gooey cheese to bun ratio better than the singles. I also prefer the jalapeno cheeseburgers to the regular ones. It is not a spicy jalapeno flavor at all, just a little kick to let you know it's there. Just an added bonus for who like a little spice.  There's not much more to say. If you're looking for a gourmet burger, this is not it. But if it's late, you've lost some money at the tables, and you just want something delicious to chomp on, this is the place. The lines can get long, but who cares? It's Vegas. Grab a drink and relax. What are you in such a hurry for anyway?  SIDE STORY: My wife got hit on right in front of me and I still didn't care. White Castle. That's all that matters. She stayed with me.

Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double jalapeño cheeseburgers. They might not look great, but oh my goodness they are amazing.

Ufjd_X9i2AgqlMMRbn__9g.text: This White Castle location gave me the worst customer service I have ever received. I was verbally abused by the manager working and will not be returning until Christina, Kandy and Nikky are reprimanded and/or let go. It was July, 27 at 3:10AM and I had asked Nikky if she had called my number. The screens that show what number is ready we're down and she wasn't using the microphone so I could hardly hear. She stared at me for 30 seconds and I asked again did you call my number or are you just gonna look at me? She said "did you hear your number?" I said I didn't know and she said "you didn't do you can go sit down" in a rude tone. I went to sit down and when my number was called, her coworker (a male standing next to her) had already complained about her being rude to him so she was moved to the back. I asked for the manager and Kandy came. I told her the story and she was apologetic and said she would handle it. I watched as she went nothing and resumed what she was doing before. Irked, I ate my food and went back up asking the nice worker at the handoff for both of their names so I can call corporate. He said that he could get her higher up manager if I pleased so I said yes. Christina came up and immediately told me "you need to back off you're being confrontational by coming up and asking for me and it's none of your business how I'm going to handle this situation" blah blah blah. Excuse me, isn't that your job to deal with confrontation about poor service as a manager? She told me Nikky would be allowed to work the rest of her shift. So... Nikky can just abuse her coworkers and customers and continue working? She was staring at me the whole time I was complaining to the manager and again, not working. I was mad so I left and called corporate. Again they were apologetic and said I would like to be contacted back after they talk to the restraunt. I haven't heard back. No email, no call or ANYTHING. I also emailed the store and haven't heard anything back. I will be calling again tomorrow and if I hear nothing back I will be posting to my 6,000 followers on Instagram, most of whom are from Vegas or friends that come to visit that I used to take to White Castle, that they should boycott the restraunt and I will continue to share this story of the rude customer service I and others endured. Thanks for nothing.

qJi5NMOImFoBfMXYlechxQ.text: If you want to be racially profiled and eat shitty food come eat at this White Castle because that's what you will get. Employees are assholes and hate there jobs

jzmxTup3fKJIGkFM2P-G1g.text: Came here for the first time with my husband to see what all the hype was about. It was disgusting. I took 1 bite and was done. My husband forced himself to finish 2 sliders. We had stomachs afterwards. They tasted not fresh and maybe even frozen. Buns were soggy and meat slices are super thin. I got cheese fries and they were ok, nothing special. Only good thing we experienced was great customer service from the cashier. I wish I would've caught her name, but she was the only good thing that came off that place. Save your money and go elsewhere.

hPhvzLhQnrmxr0wDOvBJVQ.text: Highly disappointed. I have been eating the frozen white castle burgers ever since I was a kid so I was super excited to finally try it unfrozen. I still liked it, however it tastes exactly the same as the frozen ones. Next time i'm gonna drive/walk the extra miles to go to shake shack because those burgers are 10x better!

7jeXytiPbcTTMOo3VBU_Yg.text: Many years ago, I visited a White Castle back east (once) so I knew what to expect, but we decided to give this place a try just because it's new to Vegas.  Before I get to the food, I have to mention that the two cashiers were both visibly annoyed at the customers in front of us, and they treated the couple two spots ahead of us in a completely unacceptable manner, simply because they were new to the menu and unsure how to order, making an annoyed face and screaming "NEXT" to get to the customer behind them. I was sure to place my order as quickly as possible (we ordered the #2 cheeseburger, fries, and drink), so at least the cashier appeared to merely tolerate me as I paid. This place has only been open a few weeks and the employees at the front are already burnt out. What's up with that? With so much unemployment in Vegas, couldn't they have found a few cashiers who are a bit friendlier?  As for the food - well, it's White Castle. It is what it is. Tiny, thin burger in a plain bun, with a bit of cheese and onion. There's a burger in there, but can anyone really taste it? I estimate the ratio of bun to burger is about 8:1, so you'll have to eat a huge amount of bun before you get much burger in your tummy! The fries were just bleh.  About the location - I'm not sure where to park to get into this place. There is no parking in front, so we ended up parking in the Venetian and walking back to the Strip, but surely there's a spot closer than that? Also, there were TWO security guards working this location, which only amplified the negative vibes in this place. And our table was damaged enough that it made eating uncomfortable - such a shame at such a new location.  Not recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mostly bun. Where&#39;s the burger? Please find friendlier cashiers. This place has negative vibes.

Gk9PVGXfvC_7VAfqmSI08A.text: Coralee is an absolute rockstar. Sweet, polite, attentive. We had forgotten to tender a coupon prior her ringing our order, and she went out of her way to calculate the discount back in. 5++++ stars.

jA0LQt2dCysuHbpnqMfJbQ.text: Wanted to try this place since forever, there wasn't much of a line and the orders came out quick, my daughter is a chicken nugget queen so we got lucky and ordered the chicken rings which were small so you gotta order the 9 piece. We tried both the cheese sliders and original, I think without cheese they have a better flavor. Love it!

1Hr9A4ckCvg3ufpMTKBcqw.text: Soooo disappointed! Harold and Kumar don't know what a good burger tastes like... sliders tasted like it was microwaved I threw it away I couldn't take another bite. Just thinking about those nasty onions makes my stomach turn ... BLAH!

Rlt70iLYoKjZ0oF7Qtg6ig.text: Don't get me wrong. These steamy little cheeseburger sliders are good, but they didn't satisfy my curiosity in a way I thought they would. They taste just like the microwaveable sliders you can get at the grocery store, so I'm much happier just getting those. Fries are nothing great. Remind me of Del Taco fries. JMJsxMDXlnrgOTdULsya9g.text: I don't know what the heck Harold and Kumar were on when they got white castle but boy do I wish I had some of that. youtube.com/watch?v=Lgii... So growing up, I've had White Castle burgers from the frozen aisles and I loved it. However, after watching Harold and Kumar, I've always wanted to try White Castle. Luckily, they finally opened one up in Vegas in Casino Royale and I just had to give it a try. Just walking in, there isn't much separating white castle from every other fast food joint. I ordered 4 cheese burger sliders with some fries for around $8. Boy, did this place suck. Honestly, minus the cool boxes the sliders are in, the cheese burgers here taste the same as the burgers I microwave. Same goes for the fries. Just salty empty carbs... Overall, this place disappointed me. Next time, I'll just buyer the microwaveable ones and just eat those or I can go to the millions of better burger joints in the area.

ZQeHd3xm8nn4U7iAevp7yg.text: My husband has always loved White Castle so of course once he found out there was one a block away from where we were staying (the Venetian) we had to stop in and grab a bite to eat! Thank god this place is 24 hours because the best time to eat it is when you're good and drunk and that is usually late but then again it's Vegas we are talking about! Lol when are you not good and drunk? Anyways!!!!! Awesome drunk food for sure! And it's nice that it's cheap too!

Uu9KkHvojcmEIvI1Ttukqw.text: Ever since I went to White Castle when I visited back east as a teenager I've always wanted to go back because I really enjoyed theirs food. Circumstances be as they may I've never been back east but low and behold they're here in Vegas which is way closer to California. Many people have ranted and raved about shake shack and after trying their much over hyped food my money is and will always be on White Castle. Better service and Better food. It's the way I remember it so many years ago.

v7eSpoBZ2FyOPF7MwQDDRQ.text: This place conveniently next to The Venetian comes in CLUTCH when it's past 2am and most of the major/good foodie spots along the Strip are closed and you just really need something to EAT. While the wait is a bit long and it's not the most high quality fast food, it gets the job done (and the hangovers cured, let's be real).

6mC3h18xZqMkwIrwPl5X7g.text: Great little sliders. I can finally say I ate at a White Castle.

ThXwRX0Wp3HhpFqvUZHL3Q.text: I love having White Castle every time I'm in vegas. The portion isn't crazy like most foods (depending on what you order of course) and it's the perfect food for those late night munchies. The service is decent and the food comes out quickly which is great. Definitely worth giving a try!

8Gd3_Q77EuHlk36-nSypFw.text: This place isn't too bad, I'm sure you've all seen the movie "Harold and Kumar go to White Castle". Well we were always wondering if that place is really as good as the movie portrayed it to be or was it because they were having the "munchies".  I was finally able to try this place, turns out I stumbled across it while walking up and down the Las Vegas strip. The place is pretty busy, especially since you have everyone from the strip just drinking and looking for food. Which in all, isn't a bad thing. That means it must be good.  What I ordered was two chicken sliders with loaded fries. It's cheap, I only paid $8 and thinking these small sliders were not going to fill my appetite but they sure did. The chicken and buns were fresh, no stale taste. The fries were the amazing part to me, loaded with bacon and ranch. I just couldn't get enough of it.   Give it a try next time you are wandering around Las Vegas trip, it's quick, cheap and will get you fed so you can continue your Las Vegas adventures!

P8gvc3kgBuAu_WYRI0FcNA.text: Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle!  I have seen this movie at least 5 times and I have been eating the frozen cheeseburgers for years!!!  You can actually buy the 6 pack White Castle frozen burgers at Target, Safeway, and Walmart, which are very tasty if you microwave them properly!  The only difference from the real deal is they don't have pickles on them, yet taste almost exactly the same as eating in person at the restaurant!  On my recent visit to Las Vegas, White Castle was #1 on my list of tourist things to eat!!!  My brother has been to the ones on the East coast, so he told me they opened up the very first West coast WC on the Las Vegas strip a couple months ago.  To my surprise, it was just across the street from our hotel :D  I was very happy to discover that White Castle is open 24/7.   My first visit, was in the late afternoon, loooong lines, a bunch of loud drunk people, no where to sit, and crazy busy wait.   We opted to eat a quick snack instead at the little Footlong Hot dog place in Casino Royale, and came back next day 10am!!!  NO LINES and NOT crazy busy lol.  Definitely had to try the Double cheeseburgers, Onion strips and of course the crinkle fries.   I loved everything, Double cheeseburger was great, comes with the tiny onions and pickles, crinkle fries were great, and Onion strips were good.  I really didn't mind the prices, for my first visit, it was worth it.   I just want to say if you are a big eater, make sure you get yourself at least 4-6 cheeseburgers because they are tiny and won't fill you up compared to regular cheeseburgers elsewhere.  I think White Castle is more like a snack for some people...  Staff was very friendly and helpful, place was clean too!  I am really glad I had the opportunity to come here and try it out for myself.  It really was more about the experience and enjoying my vacation in Las Vegas.  Next time I come back, I'll try the chicken rings and loaded fries.   Menu is simple and easy to order from, and for drinks they have a fountain soda machine.

The burgers melt in your mouth & your left thinking "Why didn't I buy 30.." 5 stars to you, White Castle. You will be missed!

J0VC9wLcIRNl4NbTThTm3w.text: I feel silly reviewing the actual burger - surely it's something you've had before and can't we all just agree Krystal has vastly superior cheap sliders ? The burger itself isn't anything special and clearly it has to be a nostalgic thing for you to actually enjoy eating them (how brainwashed are you Midwestern people?). That being said my pregnant self wanted a slider for a snack at 10 AM and this place delivered. There was no wait at 10:00 AM (surprise surprise) and the food was cheap (for the strip) and came out very quickly (maybe 3 mintues?). The place was clean, not overly crowded and a nice fast snack option for when you're roaming the strip.

flAAoquBQ2fW0WKFErylYg.text: This place is more hype than anything. I got one of each of the burgers and they were all disappointing. Same as the microwaveable crap you buy at the grocery store minus the long ass line. Save your money and time, go to a grocery store, or skip it entirely and get yourself a habit burger, hell, even McDonald's taste better than these tiny crap burgers. Two stars because I did like the loaded fries. PS I was not drunk, had I been, I'd probably think they were the best damn burgers in town.

vrWJ-DUmBjdGoAoVs4MlvQ.text: Tastes just like the Midwest classic! Lots of seating and it's open all night! Definitely will hit the spot!

ppxetbHXhPvFgGHdZWSwzw.text: At $1.29 per slider, a totally underwhelming bite. All i tasted was a mouthful of mince meat and onions. I've tried the frozen white castle burgers back in college, and I think those were more memorable. Skip this place, and save your belly for tastier Vegas eats.

Was a bit disappointed on my first visit(I think the employees were still learning), however all the rest were just right. This is not gourmet, it's fast food. MWiriT_riAE9Sz3yE4sRGw.text: On my last 5 day visit to Las Vegas I ate here all 5 days. We don't have White Castle here in California so we take advantage everytime we visit. I love the cheese sliders and for the first time we were able to try the breakfast menu. Amazing. I wish they served it all day. Great prices and the best fast food.

Wap4jWEuPsCOcxlCT8AqIg.text: Great first time and I'm digging the sliders so hard.   I've wanted to try White Castle for a while but I'm unsure of where one is in my area. Finally got my chance to and I don't regret it. The prices of the sliders were delightful and affordable. Quality isn't top notch but I feel like it's more enjoyable than a McDonald's burger. And it simply melts in your mouth, it was great, I didn't know that a slider could run like gold down your throat.   I was also really big on the free onion ring slices that came with the sliders. That was amazing! I didn't even ask for that and there they were! I think that's a thing? Am I wrong? Or did the server just love me that much? I'd like to think it's both. Yeah probably both.   While I loved the flavor of what I ate, White Castle is definitely more of a late night snack than a stomach bloating meal. For me at least.  But I loved it none the less.

gF8No4sOY3cOJ-egkk7VDg.text: What a disappointment! If you have visited the original locations in Illinois, do yourself a favor a STAY AWAY from this place. Grease-drenched, bland flavors reign supreme here, so no matter what you get you won't care for it much. The long lines, and the smoke stench that linger into the dining room from the casino floor, makes the experience really sub-par. I will wait to have another White Castle burger until I go back to the midwest.

-qnvpIU7acL2R_kMkpjm8g.text: I finally got a chance to try out this place. I tried a little bit of everything. My favorite was the onion chips, but I'm a big fan of deep fried, battered onions. I liked the fish burger, but I wish they put sauce on it. The chicken breast burger was just OK but also needed some sauce & seasoning. Last, I got the cheeseburger. It was OK and had too much filler in it that it didn't taste like hamburger meat. Also, it was pretty bland. I liked the soft buns on everything, but it's not enough to bring me back. For tiny sandwiches, it ended being pretty pricey. Service was good.

B7DFrNlEG_mNjMYx-mb9Hg.text: Had to come check this place out, I'd never had a fresh White Castle burger and I was not disappointed. I got the 4 cheeseburgers with fries and a drink, it tasted fresh and was nice and hot. The onions were a tasty addition and even though I could only finish three of the burgers and half the fries, it was really tasty! Would definitely go back.

FLCVS0sFuHAFA2ozFJb_vg.text: Would classify as hangover food and nothing special. Expensive and not delicious. Located in the opening of a big, smoky casino. Nice stop on the strip if you want to waste money on not so delicious food and just looking to eat anything. The sliders are so tiny and nothing was that great in taste about them. Can't understand why people would select this place for a meal. Would never choose to eat here again, which is why I'm choosing to rate the place with 1 star.

6ZjELVX-kHkEzTVqV503tQ.text: Nothing to go out of your way for. The sliders honestly sucked. Cool that it was open late but not worth the wait. Onion fries had really no onion

kes4L46Rrl7VnjoGjPMd8A.text: WOW! So disappointing. Perhaps I was all about that Harold and Kumar hype but really...? Why did they travel far af to get these soggy ass sliders?   Don't expect anything fabulous at White Castle. Pretty disappointing. It was rather expensive for 4 sliders & fries. The bun was really airy, could have been a good or bad thing depending on how you like dem buns. The patty was a sliver. Pretty sad.  The meal itself served its purpose of helping me hold my alcohol for the night soooo... 2 stars.

-e3BEs5Hm84AldD49RrMpQ.text: I've always wanted to try White Castle, even before the movie came out and now that I've tried it...it's nothing special.  I would rather have In and Out or eat at McD. 4rN9vUokxLCCvcS2BmpJwg.text: Definitely not the easiest to access unless you are on foot already on the strip. If you are going to drive there, maybe reconsider and have an Uber or Lyft driver, make sure they drop you off at the casino (where white castle is located) front on LV Blvd during a red light. Like I said I made a mistake of driving, pulling into park at the Venetian, and then you have to find your way over to the casino where Whitecastle is located and then make your way back. Definitely delicious once I got my food and I would probably go again if I was actually walking near by already on the strip. I almost felt like I was either Harold or Kumar. mFRBDpmUPks3PDpwxlFGBQ.text: I was actually expecting something... more exciting.   My friends and I ordered the sliders.  They tasted pretty okay. The presentation is cool and all, with the little boxes, but other than that, there's really nothing special about them.   And the way that it's so hard to find somewhere to sit and how messy the area is.. it just kills the appeal some more for me.

ddWlBonZIU_D31JKpoKsFg.text: Ahh, I couldn't wait to review this place. This place sucks! Overrated to the max!!! The burgers are the size of my palms and the meat is thin as paper. G-XR5PLwpanObIc-xG3K8A.text: You shouldn't agree to sign up for Postmates if you aren't prepared for large to go orders. No one knew where the order was. I was given a shake with no lid, spilling over the top that made a huge mess in my car. You don't have to go lids??? You could seriously cost someone their job/rating. Also, what is with this photo you're using? It's completely uninteresting and not at all appetizing. Who is in charge of your social media? You're on the strip. Get it together.

g2msMIdgpi6OxvU8jbROpw.text: Oh White Castle! Even though I never watched the Harold and Kumar movie before, I have heard about the sliders from White Castle and I couldn't wait to try one. Luckily, this fast food restaurant was open 24/7 so after a night of clubbing, my friend and I headed over to this place for a quick meal. There was definitely no lines on a Tuesday morning around 4am, and I quickly ordered one original slider ($1.29) and one chicken ring slider ($1.99) to try. The cashier proudly told me he had 15 chicken rings for lunch when I seemed hesitant in trying the chicken ring slider. I was definitely not hungry enough for 15 chicken sliders, but you do you boo. However, props to the cashier working on this 4am shift!   When I received my sliders, I was quite surprised at how tiny these sliders looked. They were about the size of my palms and I'm pretty sure I can eat the slider in one bite if I tried hard enough. Taste wise- they were both okay. They were not mind-blowing and I don't see myself craving these sliders in the future. They actually tasted a bit plain to me, since there was no special sauce included in the beef or chicken slider. I guess this a good place to grab a quick bite if you are on a budget since the prices were more reasonable than other restaurants on the strip. I can't say I won't ever be back, but probably not in the near future.

kVp7nKiVzdESXOJER_FUKA.text: Harold & Kumar brought us here. Lived off the microwave White Castle sliders for years 'twas the only way to shave off the cravings, but it always made me wondered what the real thing tastes like. And man oh man did it hit the spot! It's just a simple tiny little slider, why does it taste so damn good!? Why? I don't get all the complaints about bad service. This joint is about serving up damn good burger sliders to satisfy your cravings and stomach, not about making you feel like a lord. Stop getting butt hurt.

m-o_gjEyaRERXCK_krSbiA.text: We came Sunday 5/28/17 at 4:30 pm on our way home. The fries were the best part of the meal but let me tell you, nothing special about the burgers. We have had White Castle in New York and my husband was excited to try it here in Vegas.   We BOTH left (my husband and I) with FOOD POISONING and we BOTH ended up in urgent care on Memorial Day and still too sick to return to work today! Right now is my second attempt to eat since eating there Sunday.   I will NEVER eat there again! I have been burping up those nasty onions for two days! Ughhh!   I will stick to the regular White Castle on the east coast. Lesson learned.....

LuJ6-1KKHy5vUrpkeBQgag.text: Thank heavens this has finally landed upon the Las Vegas strip (at least until it happens to finally be bestowed upon California) is all I can say!  Well ok maybe not everything.....I will admit at first it was a bit difficult to find (was across the street pretty much from Mirage and tucked inside the craziness that is the Harrah's portion of the strip), but once I did it brought me back to the days of my youth in Minnesota and damned if nostalgia didn't make this meal taste that much better..Oh yeah and I'm talking about the REAL White Castle and not the supermarket abomination!  So I just kept it simple and got a bag of sliders with cheese (no condiments needed and that's a bold statement from this guy). It was just as I remembered from the taste to the smile at the end. They are small in nature, but I don't feel like a fatty if I pound out 5 of them! I did like the fact they are put in paper containers now and the pickle in the middle gives it that perfect hint of umph when partnered with the tender meat and gooey cheese..Just thinking of the slider salivates the mouth indeed!  I did take notice that the line does get a bit lengthy, but doesn't that tell you your taste in food is better than most? I thought the staff managed to kill the line pretty fast, so for me waiting wasn't a complaint at all. I also found that they treat you with respect if you give it back so my experience was just as I remembered it.  All in all, I will be back again and this time I just might bust for the 100 slider snack pack..Signed, sealed, and delivered their mine!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger Slider

uCV3FSTJhIDGH24Z_qWhIw.text: It was good and the place was clean and not too crowded. You can't ask for much more on the Las Vegas strip. It's good to eat there if you can get a table, or you can take the food to go and go back to your hotel room. The employees are very nice and they got our big order correct.  It's hard to get dropped off or picked up by Uber/Lyft around this place though. We had to walk halfway back to our hotel before we could find an Uber/Lyft pickup area.

gS7ctN0wgrVVfcsZZD6Z2w.text: Soda was ok. Thats about it. I'm not mad, just dissapointed. This brand carries a power that i don't quite understand.

KFEW_RFkKlpw2D6rbG6xcQ.text: I havent had white castles in years and it was a nice surprise to find one in Las Vegas and it was in walking distance. Enjoyed my meal and it was hot

nWLDTedSq9gJDDkwH7Zj4w.text: Finally got to eat at White Castle in Vegas!  I believe this is the only one near the west Coast!  It was delicious and I tried almost everything on the menu!!!

SzG61avZWB3GWXlpMmq-zg.text: Gotta agree with other poster I think Krystals is better but they are still tasty. Should have asked for mustard on my burgers. Fries weren't hot. Giving 3.5 stars because I forgot my change and they were honest enough to chase me  down and give me my change.

bLiqh4PgkxtrOTYoY850Kg.text: Every time I see this place, I think about Harold & Kumar go to White Castle. Although I've seen and passed by this place every year for the past several years, I finally decided to come in and try the place in February. I actually walked from The Excalibur here and walked back. In a way, it was my own White Castle adventure. I was able to snag a coupon from a guy about a block down and that really sealed the deal. The restaurant was pretty packed, there were absolutely no seats available, but the line was very short when I got in.  I got the 4pk cheese sliders with a drink and fries for about 9 bucks before the coupon. I was kind of expecting the prices I heard in the movie, but I'm thinking since this is Vegas and on the strip, everything is like 50-100% more. Food came out within about 5mins, and I took it to go and ate at the fountain right in front of In N Out. If you ask why I didn't just go to In N' Out, it's because I have one close to home, so I wanted something I can't get back home. The burgers themselves actually didn't look very appealing. The meat kind of looks like spam (not that I have anything against spam). I have had the frozen ones before and those looked better. As for the taste, it wasn't bad. Typical fast-food burger taste, but the little chopped grilled onions add a lot of flavor. I was pretty full after eating all 4 of the sliders. I would probably come back again if I had a longer stay in Vegas. If I'm only here just a few days, I would probably rather have something a bit nicer. The only exception is that my brother is pretty crazy about these, so if he ever comes along on one of my trips to Vegas, I'll bring him here so he can try to eat 20 of these lol.

Omgosh I won't choose sides I love them both. They're different! White Castle is delicious mini bite sliders. The first time I went I was  dumb I got 3 regret it so much and was too lazy to walk the strip from my hotel to get it lol. The last time I went 6 with fries and a milkshake. So good. Do it!

FtO1FykFid19U03zPxbobg.text: I expected better from here. The sliders weren't that tasty and became a chore to eat after a while. The chicken rings tasted like frozen dino nuggets (not even as good as Dino nuggets). I also had the vanilla milkshake, which was pretty good. It tasted like an In N Out shake, but sweeter. The fries weren't that bad either, I would eat them again. Lastly, the onion chips were probably the best out of the whole meal; they were really crispy and delicious.   Overall, I wouldn't come back here by choice but it wasn't a HORRIBLE experience. Their staff was friendly and service was quick, impressive since it's pretty full..being on the strip and all. All and all, i say come and try it out for yourself. It just didn't meet my expectations.

FnZwwd66LQC0fj68BzgYNA.text: Went here today and was extremely disappointed with the location! Food was ok (mini burgers what do you expect?) but being harassed by homeless people and having them look through the trash for food while you eat? Not to mention the horrible smell they had which made you wanna gag your burger right out! And worst of all employees did absolutely nothing about it! My husband almost got into an altercation with one of them because he made us feel extremely uncomfortable & also unsafe. Nothing like feeling like you're gonna get mugged after dinner to make you feel right at home. Horrible night to say the least. Don't come here unless you're armed and don't have a sense of smell.

X-q-ZfnBjNLeVKX1HiB4MQ.text: id rather eat my shoes than eat white castle hamburgers. they were terrible when i lived on the east coast and they are no different now. Stick with In & Out burger.

7stXP4Gn31uVVTwmUEdehQ.text: Authentic and typical White Castle...Except it's on the Las Vegas Strip. -Typical White Castle food, either you like it or you don't. -Prices are a bit steep, but it's a high rent location. -This location serves Beer! -Good central location on the Strip. -Friendly employees. -Restaurant was clean. If you want a White castle hamburger and not frozen from a supermarket...this is your only option on the west coast.

7EYkApUD8tee2sijWKttlA.text: In short - if you grew up with White Castle, it tastes like White Castle. In-N-Out is a better burger, but there's just something about these. The super soft steamed buns, the grilled onions. I love White Castle as an adult for the same reason I did as a kid.. because I can order a pile of tasty burgers and gobble each in 3-4 bites, and it makes me feel like the Hamburgler.

sIPTFtWxSNlalAD2DXc7sA.text: One word: overrated!   This place is not even in the same ballpark as some of the great burger joints! Came here with high expectations due to:  1) Everyone ranting and raving about how great the burgers are 2) It's renowned reputation in the East Coast 3) they made a movie about how amazing it is!   Always wanted to try it after watching Harold and Kumar so naturally when I had a chance to dig into a pack of these "amazing burgers" during my last trip to Vegas, how could I not???   Although the service was great, the staff worked hard & fast, and the restaurant was constantly being cleaned (thus the 3 stars), the burgers were just OK and left something to be desired. They were mini burgers with paper thin meat that you could hardly taste and bread that was somewhat soggy due to the pickles/onions. it was a huge let down when I took my first bite. I immediately regretted being overly excited and buying a whole pack of these mediocre burgers! My husband and I didn't get through our pack of burgers and ended up throwing them away knowing we weren't going to eat them later.   Huge disappointment!  :(

Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NZVKejZURAY6de_2R0e-eQ.text: First off, this place is white castle and is definitely not in the same leagues as bachi or even in n out for that matter.  Essentially the competitors to this restaurant are establishments like mcdonalds and wendys but I would much rather eat there than here.  1. OVERPRICED! you get the 6 slider meal and i think it comes out to $12? WTF go to glaziers and get the 6 cheese for $4 guys.  2. It tastes exactly like the kinds you buy frozen.  There literally was no difference at all in terms of taste.  3. Don't plan to go to hot yoga after because you will get bad gas. seriously... big mistake  Overall: It's really overpriced and the taste is comparable to the ones you can buy frozen but I will say that they do not taste all that bad.

GRR3feJBrUOHdMOq9YK3kw.text: OK, let's be honest here...if you like White Castle you like White Castle.  There is no in-between.  I grew up in the midwest, so I happen to love them!  So, I can't help it...  It is a True guilty pleasure.  They are simply little steamed cheeseburgers of joy.  Soft, fluffy and delicious!  I always just get the cheeseburger sliders.   The line here in Vegas can move slow if there are a crowd of people, but the burgers are as good as any White Castle in Chicago.  If you crave...you crave...and this location delivers!

YYBdTIQ1Q0INRE-NqNHCpw.text: Disgusting...   I'm quite the burger fanatic and review on yelp quite often. I usually stick to eating at gourmet burger joints, rather than getting the fast food type, however in Vegas I had the chance to visit White Castle, a place I've always wanted to try after watching the Harold and Kumar movies..   I was very shocked at the standard of meat being used in the burgers.. it looked inedible and made me want to feel sick at the site of it..   The cheese and onions being used looked burnt and plastic looking..   There was no sauces etc inside the burger it was plain and stale...   The prices are cheap, however I feel this place is more for those who are heavily drunk or intoxicated by other means...   I would never try White Castle again...   I'm shocked this place hasn't been shut down.

cBd-_3u4NOFd0ldDdasVdA.text: More hype than anything.  I've had my share of burgers including WC in NYC and they did not bring their A-game to LV.  Long lines, greasy burgers, no seating, and wafer thin patties for a premium price.  Also, if you've had WC on the Easy Coast, you'll be disappointed to find that they only sell the regular or cheese burgers and you can't buy them individually.   Only in meals.    I was pretty hungry the day I went, and didn't even eat all of my burgers. And it wasn't because I was full. Nuff said.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q8EVqVzQMkQNmDnOcPlm0w.text: Vegas Valentine's Day Adventure!  February 15, 2015  So lucky to have such an amazing boyfriend who planned the whole trip for us to eat in Vegas. Not only was I here for Shake Shack (my most favorite NY burger spot and the place I've been talking about for the past two and half years).   So, after clubbing at Hakkasan, we went to get grub and feast on 30 burgers and two fries! Coming from a person who has never had White Castle, I loved it! The chicken rings burger was amazing too! After eating these, I wanted more and more the very next hour.   Overall, spent $46 bucks on the food for two!   Yes, he is perfect because we share our fatty side with each other
