doPAUwYfbvBtrS35N8nGBA.text: Why?  Why? If you can afford not to, don't. I must hate myself. Harold and Kumar were dumber than they looked.  THESE ARE THE POSSIBLE TITLES OF THIS REVIEW.  I came here super hammered trying to have my drunken stupor wear off.  So I was quite out of my mind.  Going here was another example of poor judgment while intoxicated.  I parked in the Venetian and walked a good hike to get find this place.  When I finally found it inside the Casino Royale, there were a lot of people waiting for their food.  I have never had this before, so I asked the lady in the line in front of me if it was really "that good."  She replied, "Well I grew up on it.  That's why I like it."  In most instances, that's not a good sign for newcomers.  It means, "If I wasn't used to this stuff and didn't have fond memories associated with it already, I sure as heck wouldn't be eating it otherwise."  But again, I didn't listen to my intuition because the alcohol was screaming down my cranial highway still, killing any brain cells available that night.  I ordered 10 of these bite size burgers and a 3 piece of this chicken ring thing.  What should have made me leave was the fact that you can see the food as it's being made.  I don't mean the workers cooking.  You can see that.  I mean you can see very clearly what it is you're about to eat BEFORE it's cooked.  Well let me tell you... the so called beef patty was this weird spam colored looking cube kinda sizzling on this flat stove.  It looked as processed as spam or an MRE for our brave military folks reading this.  Well when you're not in war, sacrificing your life, you kinda want a nice meal since you're not about to die.  I got the food, walked the long walk back to the Venetian garage and began my journey home.  I tried very hard to eat this stuff.  Very hard.  I made my way through half the burgers and chicken rings before I tossed the rest.  When you compare mcnuggets or strips to these chicken rings, you at least get a sense that there are chicken remnants in the nuggets or strips.  These chicken rings are more chicken flavored than anything.  It made me a nit nauseous, beyond the liquor, thinking about what I was eating.  I thought to myself that there must be some homeless person who could benefit from this.  But I felt actual guilt if I had to give someone this to nourish themselves.  Basically Ill choose McDs, JintheBox, KFC, Taco Smell, BK, or even Arbys over this place.  Now I realize how pompous and spoiled I sound.  As I was forcing this stuff down my pie hole, I thought to myself, "Who would choose to eat this stuff on their own volition while not only paying for it, but waiting in a line and waiting after to get it?"  So I realize how blessed I am to know what better food is and being able to make a choice.  I fully realize most all people don't have a choice or have ever had better.  For that, I am humbled and grateful.  So why the two stars?  Well, good question.  I guess it's relatively cheap and it does have a strong flavor.  Chalk this one up to experience and having checked something off the "try anything once list."  ADVICE:  ORDER JUST ONE AND TRY BEFORE YOU BUY.

Ee2B5NJf4oZjb_wxdmDDHg.text: This is the worst burger place I have ever had in my life. Was excited to finally try it, the burgers were flat, tasted like it came out of a freezer, was luke warm, and soggy bread.  It was sick, I am never going back. They're not burgers, they are an abomination. I would rather have a Big Mac.

D0AvcnNCO62CVpH9b9DuPg.text: Not what I expected.. will not be eating White Castle ever again.. the flavor of the grilled onions over powers the whole cheeseburger.

YfWQJTwpnX_7cBenv_Sd9g.text: Although I've had White Castle on the East coast, I was pretty excited to stumble across it in Vegas! It was 1am on a Sunday night and it was still pretty busy. The line moved quick and they were cranking out order after order in minutes! I ordered the Original Slider and the Chicken Slider with a side of fries. The Original Slider didn't seem that fresh to me but I was surprisingly impressed with the Chicken Slider. It came with cheese and was crispy yet soft. It was great! You can't go wrong with their crinkle cut fries here too. It's a good place to go to at the end of a long, fun night out in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Right: Original Slider (top), Chicken Slider (bottom). Left: fries.

okarVUiGdOw2xxIZ1l6SOw.text: Was okay.  The packaging is cute, the staff is friendly but overrated. Maybe we arent used to the East Coast burger style but its just not our type.  Will probably not visit again.

BTgbsaqtKt2CUdmq2hj3kQ.text: Food 10/10 we bought a box of frozen White Castle cheese burger and loved it. The real store is way better   Ambience 6/10 it's on the Main Street of LV, not great but understandable   Service 7/10  We cannot wait to come back again

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZMM18cCsbNSWBjl65TxruQ.text: It's been a few years since we had White Castle so when we found out they were opening a location in Vegas we wanted to visit.  I was little disappointed about the location. It is connected to Casino Royale and there is not much seating here. The restaurant was dirty and they didnt have any staff cleaning up the tables. The line was long but it did move fast.   The burgers didnt taste good as I remembered. Maybe because it's been a few years but I was happy to get my White Castle fix.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iYpxZbgdtX6iWKeywIoJig.text: What can I say? It's White (mo fawkin) Castles!! Only complaint is we need some in California. I've been writing them for 30 years BEGGING!

8aJQu4t-XRVlSL5v_pxuog.text: Friday night, 3:30 AM, girlfriend needs food STAT!   Off we went, coming from the club we had heard good about this mystical 24/7 White Castle and after seeing Harold and Kumar we wanted in. So we took orders for our other guests at the hotel and stood in line for what seemed like forever. The restaurant itself was crowded, packed with people and rather dirty with trash and slider containers still on chairs and tables. The line started towards the back end of the register and displayed a crowd of people either looking to the menu, waiting on food or in line to order.  After about a 25 minute wait we ordered two #2 combos and a slider suitcase. Worth it. The food was not that great but hit the spot and I assume is the taste of most if not all White Castles.   Could have been better, not complaining on the worst end but it was good enough for three in the morning!

PE_JLb4EE2lqgJSpCy0KxQ.text: Yeah, that's right, I love White Castle. It's nostalgia for me. I feel like a kid in Chicago again every time I bite into one of those tiny littler cheeseburgers.  This spot is on the Strip (next to Walgreens and the Venetian). It's open 24/7. And they serve alcohol too (duh, it's Vegas!).  The staff are always friendly and nice. When it's packed, it can sometimes take awhile to get your order. But most often, your order comes up pretty quick.  Personally, I always opt for one of the meal deals - usually the one with 4 sliders. Both the fries and fried onion thingys are decent choices.  It's also pretty fun people-watching when you come here at like 3am on a weekend.

Z_qBYgd98cWgBAOy4kRbew.text: I'm honestly very disappointed in this White Castle. It is like someone decided to throw a White Castle in the Las Vegas Strip just to say one is there. I feel bad for anyone who is trying this for the first time, because this is NOT what White Castle tastes like. Staff is very friendly though, so that is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slider and fries

gS1mLdZUKXamxHpEkoZM0g.text: I don't care what people say, I crave this stuff and when I can get it I'm beyond satisfied. This is the closest White Castle I have access to living in California.  Oh how I didn't appreciate you when I lived in the East Coast.  Those little mini sliders that fit perfectly in my little hands.  It's always a stop when I leave Las Vegas. Don't really eat it earlier because hey, I don't want to chance getting sick during my trip. But haven't gotten sick yet!  This place is located inside a small little casino (which I learned has $2 craps tables!) and is open 24/7.  If my husband and I drove to LV we would stop by here on our way home, get like a small party box of 10 or 12 (and some other stuff I love like their jalapeno burger and fish burger) for our drive to treat ourselves. Which is usually subsequently followed by hating ourselves.  The grandest of traditions!

Y64IXgRBNbwxJu80yLcuKw.text: Are you in Las Vegas in the north part of the strip, drunk, hungry, wandering around, already took off your heels and have flat/slippers/or just nastily barefoot? White Castle is there for you! I mean, it is what it is! If you think chicken nuggets are unnaturally shaped, get on some chicken RINGS! I cannot differentiate between regular White Castle burgers from the brick & mortar and the frozen ones. It's like they might as well have a bunch of microwaves to warm up the frozen mutant meat--no one is going to notice or care.  Chicken Rings, wtf? Yes.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xhrV6Bl-15fRXmsJZxXczg.text: Extremely rude service. It's 7pm and they have run out of veggie sliders but had no prob of charging of them.

SiI2hN9QrQMg3Hi0rWx4zQ.text: Simple, super quick review: Mini McDonald's cheeseburgers, but a liiiiiitle bit better.   I wouldn't say these burgers are something you must try in your lifetime, mostly because if you've had a McDonald's cheeseburger, you've had one of these. I will say that due to their small size, they can be a little addicting.   They start with a square mini patty and top it with cheese, onions and a single pickle. They put that between two warm buns and that's it. Don't get me wrong, they are good, just nothing amazing. Ditto for the crinkle cut fries.   What I did think was great, were the chicken rings and onion chips. The chicken rings have a light breading to them and a nice saltiness that make you wanna keep coming back for more. The onion chips are like onion petals, small little slivers of onion, and are pretty addicting as well.   Where this place is severely lacking is customer service. I get it, this is Vegas. I'm certain the staff has dealt with its share of rude customers. But getting condiments for my order was like filling out a credit application. How many? What did you order? Why do you need so many. Look, between my brother and I, we fed a family of 12. We need a TON of ketchup for the 6 in our party under 10 years old.  Also, you know, I wanna sample your sauces!!!! (Ranch is terrible, BBQ is great by the way).  Also, from the woman who took our order, to the guy cleaning the dining area, everyone who worked there seemed depressed or angry (again, it's Vegas).   Anyway, stop in for nothing more than to say you have and for the experience. Don't do it for much else.

uOMCKYOxXbNkBmZqlEIg9w.text: The plus, it's open 24/7.... the downside, if you want no onions, they open up your wrapped burger, scrape the onions off with a spatula, and hand it back . Stick to the fries, those were pretty good.

-hUIQPuW37T5T8mqsTehfA.text: The burgers were pretty good. I don't know how the burgers weren't hot when they were served, we got them as soon as we were called. They literally tasted like the ones they sell from the freezer section at my local store... except those are hot after they come out of the microwave! Fries were pretty good but for sure nothing memorable. I was really hoping this would be a great experience but it was disappointing. I guess I have to go back east to have the real deal...

OF0xRk_l7TXobH2n5d_0BA.text: Got up early in order to participate an event...  My bf and me was looking for a breakfast place and heard this is famous in east coast so I'd like to try it.  We ordered 'Two Breakfast Sliders Combo' includes two of Breakfast Sliders, a small Hash Brown Nibblers and a drink $7.99. We were lucky that the line was short...  Since it's fast food so I didn't expect it too much, but it wasn't an disappointment and one slider with hash brown actually last me until 3PM so I feel $7.99 is worth the price!

RvCU5l8v1R4abPbF3U97eg.text: I miss White Castle and was so excited to see one out West.  I don't even know what to say to  the reviews of people who don't "get" WC and the amount of people that let Harold and Kumar influence their choice to go here and then be sad about it.   Maybe, you were or weren't drunk enough? These have never been a thing I wanted to eat while drinking and the Vegas location is the only one that serves up alcohol with them. The outcome seems to be on par with birds, mentos and coke, WC is not for faint of heart if you fear onions or massive gas bubbles.    Yes they are steamed little patties of beef or little fried squares of fish and circles of chicken rings but that's what makes them them. You cannot begin to compare these to freezer case burgers, but if that is all you know then that is what you will think they are supposed to be like, its not, they don't have the pickles or enough onion from the freezer,  trust me.   We have been here three times and every time its been close to midnight or later and we have stood in a line of about 5-10 people and it takes about ten minutes to get them. Comparison, I was just home in Kentucky, stood in line at 12:30am in a line of 10 people and cars wrapped around the building. Point is doesn't matter if its Vegas or Louisville where there are a million WC to choose from, there is a line.

DwXVQimn0BKIunLi5gMjEg.text: WHY is this even a thing!!!!!!!!!! Yes, we have to thank Harold and Kumar for keeping white castle alive.  My bf too, had this nostalgia of trying white castle. It was a thing he had to do. We didn't get a change the last few times we were in  Vegas, which is quite an excuse, since white castle is open 24/7. Well on our last trip to Vegas, the stars must of been aligned because it was the time we got to try this famous White Castle. I was going to go and order 10 little sliders for instagram sake, but my bf convinced me otherwise. I was so glad he did because boy were the sliders bad. I couldn't even get past two. The bread was moist like it was soaked into water. The onions were over powering since there wasn't much meat within the sliders.   We couldn't even finish the fries, but the worse part, were the chicken fingers. They were no bad. I wish we didn't order them.   Thanks but no thanks Harold and Kumar! Perhaps it was all done so that the chain can live on! I do not plan on returning in my future. The way they were making the burgers just was not appetizing.

5DVwKOu7zlV5sVvBflBc4w.text: I'm not pro-Harold & Kumar getting high on weed... However, they're people with basic needs like eating food. Remembering the movie, I had to try it. I probably should have tried 1 of each slider or what was eaten in the movie. White Castle was okay. Vegas.com suggested White Castle as place to eat.

NJE0F93KRvcSJv33b-WT0g.text: Fun fact: Kal Penn who played Kumar in 2004 movie "Harold and Kumar Go To White Castle" is actually a vegetarian and never ate a White Castle burger. Crew members created meatless substitutes. (You can just click that cool or useful vote now) Luckily, White Castle now offers vegetarian sliders and I can't think of a better place to indulge than in Vegas. This place is hopping and stays pretty busy 24/7, but the food gets out fast and hot!  Since no trip to Vegas would be complete without at least one walk of shame and one greasy meal, White Castle fits the bill for the meal, the rest is up to you.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Sliders!
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie Slider!

IMpr7ou-Pyqc7WpCJtq-lQ.text: Why else am I drawn to White Castle? Aside from having watched Harold & Kumar Go to White Castle. I can finally removed the bookmark, during we're trip to Vegas we stopped by.  * Ordered their classic slider cheeseburger, and crispy chicken breast slider, fish slider.  * Fries -Nothing special, but totally satisfied my desire for crispy potato sticks. Apparently there's a secret menu! I'm so bummed out I didn't know earlier, next road trip. It wasn't the greatest burger, you have to be drunk to enjoy them, plan sliders with no seasoning.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paul famous Tower of Sliders
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e_37fo_PpVP6XmJr5_A8qw.text: I don't know what the hype is about for White Castle burgers.  Their burgers are the size of Hawaiian rolls, the patty is really thin, no condiments except for a few diced pieces of onions and a slice of pickle, and they come in a paper box. $1.29 for a 2-bite burgers. They tasted like steamed patties but I'm not sure how they're cooked. We also tried the fish sandwich - same size with a slice of cheese and no sauce for $1.89. These tasted better than the burgers but needed some type of sauce. And the fried onion chips were small pieces of deep-fried onions - $2.89 for a regular-sized order. These were good but mainly batter. I've tried White Castle a couple of times now but I can't envision returning anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mX_gOqb5R7OBmAlHYAXBjA.text: My trip in Vegas won't be complete without visiting this fastfood chain.  This WC is located beside the harrah's hotel & casino.  Pretty decent size place and could need some improvements on the cleanliness of the place.  There use be a long line here when this was new couple of years ago, but now there's none.  There is nothing special about their slider but it's sure it's mouthwatering.  The softness of the bread and the combination of the patty, onion and cheese is very satisfying.  Simplicity is the best and white castle has that!  Service is fast enough.  I ordered the Crave Case which has 30 regular sliders $35.99. I added cheese for an extra $9, my order was ready in less than 10 min.  Staff are nice.  i didn't have any issues with them everytime I come here.  I will keep coming back here whenever i'm in vegas

Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Slider
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 30 Original Slider Crave Case

VQLNtrE05jowb1VWeVkw5g.text: So some reason (Most likely the water) it tastes better in NYC. Tha Yelp Daddy was kinda disappointed with this one. I mean, even the frozen ones in the grocery store taste better. But, the service was nice and friendly...although, it took a little to long for my order...it only one small burger and fries and it was like almost ten minutes...anyway, Tha Yelp Daddy wasn't pleased!!!

LPNj4UiNRzdi8Z29Oyqw-w.text: Hey, this is what it is. For those expecting a gourmet burger- you will be disappointed. For those craving melt in your mouth, three bite, smothered in onion goodness - bingo!   Belly Bombers (with cheese for me), fries, onion rings and shakes. These wonderful little burgers are the same country wide and were perfect for "dessert" after our strip dinner.   I find them suitable for any meal, breakfast, lunch, dinner or dessert. Only two tonight but it sure hit the spot. Line was short as well. Life is good

UCtPa9eN8Wno_dZITW6QQg.text: Took some time to find White Castle. We finally found it. Husband and I decided to split a meal. The meal was fresh and hot. Not sure why so many negative reviews. Maybe we came on a good day.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a06jCxlP7uOJH6jOSGAbyw.text: I've spent years scarfing down frozen White Castle burgers purchased from the grocery store, so getting the chance to see it in all its glory was wonderful. I still have hopes of going to visit a location in the Midwest someday, but I'll take what I can get for now. This location is located near the casino royale, and was very clean on the inside. I ordered 4 burger sliders and some cheese sticks, and jn True Vegas fashion, they had beer and alcohol readily available. I didn't have to wait long for my order and there was plenty of seating available. The food tasted better that what I was hoping for and I wish I had their brown mustard with me all the time. It was a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rvMiKNTvrU73-GQOpDab5A.text: I never had White Castle before, so I decided to visit with bae to see what all the craze is about.  There was no wait-time when we arrived on a Friday at 10 AM, but a long line quickly formed behind us. It's on the strip, so you know how busy traffic is.  We got 2 cheeseburger sliders and a fried chicken slider to try out. The cheeseburger slider had really thin unnatural looking patties. They weren't bad-tasting, but it wasn't anything exciting. The fried chicken slider was decent and and somewhat crispy, but still somewhat thin. I think you would need to order a lot to get full of these; and even so, you would be getting full from the bread. Despite their cute individual containers, the sandwiches don't appear very appetizing. This would make for decent drunk food if there weren't so many other better options on the strip.  I actually kind of liked the flavor, but the service and wait-time don't seem to make this place worth it. Service is lackluster and dreadfully slow; the staff look really unhappy to work there. I'm glad I was able to try it, but I don't plan on revisiting anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken slider and 2 cheeseburger sliders

2kYzjfg1JZP5Q0kekOF8IA.text: I've heard sooo many things about White Castle, so I was super excited to try it. It was super late at night, after after-hours, and I had the drunchies really bad. The line to order was long, so I thought it was promising that the food would be great hence the long line.  I got my fries and sliders, and took a bite of one of my fries. The fries were the driest fries I've ever had and it wasn't even warm - I was so upset! Even with ketchup, it was overly dry. I then tried their tiny slider with some ketchup, which was better than their dry fries. Skip the fries and order their sliders. This was the first fast food place that wasn't satisfying while drunk. I'd rather go elsewhere next time.

4CkmPiDHBtY4FD-i1Hkkkw.text: I went to this location not once, not twice but three times in 1 vacation this weekend. I ordered the Double Cheese sliders twice, Bacon and Cheese fries once, Cheese Fries and Chicken Rings with a couple of Original sliders. It is definitely worth the hype. I went there on Saturday night, Sunday afternoon and Monday morning. Please build a location somewhere in Southern California, my state definitely needs a location.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c2JHGxFbWbSjuYF1EsmXAw.text: I decided that it would be good to get some snacks before eating and decided that white castle be a good idea. Unfortunately, my experience here that day was not so great. We ordered some food to-go and as I got our order, I noticed the cheese fries missing. I informed the person about it and he went to check with another employee.  Then one of the employee was not happy at being accused of forgetting it and it was a bit uncomfortable.   Moving along, as we ate the sliders,  my friend had an instant reaction and had to use the restroom after he finished. My stomach also was suffering for the first half of the day. I'm sure it is probably just an isolated incident, but it was not a good experience.  I'm not sure when I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xbI63Y771dOv7NGYPznV8A.text: Yum!  White Castle!  I haven't actually eaten at a "real" White Castle for over 25 years (the frozen burgers from Sam's Club don't count).  It was exactly as I remember, well without the smoke cloud from the casino that is.  The flavors were spot on.    I gave their breakfast a shot and, not expecting too much, I was very impressed.  The sausage sandwich was excellent and hit the spot.  The hash rounds were hot and crispy.  And, most importantly, the coffee was strong with free refills.  WOW!!!  The service was average, but it is WC on LV strip.   Open 24/7.  The prices were more than I remember, but it has been 25 years or more. :-{  I wouldn't hesitate to visit again and get my burger on.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-kYJ-ZORtmlCSx6k2Vvblg.text: Being a fan of Beastie Boys since the first album came out and enjoying Harold and Kumar, but never having made it far enough easy to try White Castle, I was excited to give them a try. It was pretty much as expected, relatively crappy but decent when you're high or drunk. Surprisingly juicy though (I'm assuming the onions are to thank for that). The crew in the store looked like they were stuck in some kind of purgatory or nightmare but I can't fault them for that, I wouldn't want to do that job either. My recommendation is don't go there sober.

r34RxfSBlF3WxdwDC6BoVQ.text: These sliders are so tiny, and I was impressed that the buns where pretty fresh but the burger was just meh. It was small, one pickle, cheese, and a thin patty smashed on a Hawaiian roll. I can say I have tried it, but I definitely won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-bmQywNtrGyUYPAmfHVFRA.text: I actually wanted a hot dog, but after getting juked by the sign on the strip, I wasn't about to walk to the back of the casino for a hotdog and White Castle was the next closest thing. Small little square burgers with a sad slice of meat patty, sandwiched between some grilled onions, cheese, and a dinner roll. It's overpriced for the amount you're actually getting for each burger, but this place is open 24/7. I enjoyed the fish filet burger, ask for tartar sauce.

XgRf95B6ywtFwE9tzZR40Q.text: That was probably the most disgusting burger I have ever had. I could only eat the fries. lol

EsPfr0RsgK9FTn3RmBPv0Q.text: The absolute worst crap Ive had in a while.  Eastcoasters say its the best food they had growing up! !! You people are crazy.  This can't be life.  Avoid. You have been warned.  If you didn't grow up on this,  don't die on it.  Eat some real food.

zZLutWTNw8SFsncf41EgpA.text: I won't rate based on long lines and wait times. You obviously see how long the line is and should be able to judge that that wait will be lengthy. You get in line of your own free will, if you don't want to wait then go elsewhere. I also will not rate based on comparisons to other fast food empires (in-n-out, shake shack, McDonald's, etc).  What I am basing my rating in is the food. Let me be completely clear here...if you have ever had the frozen, microwaveable grocery store White Castle sliders then be advised that it is EXACTLY the same as what you will get here. Kudos (I guess) to whoever produces the frozen versions available at the grocery stores because they have 100% matched the taste, consistency, texture and quality of the famous White Castle slider. I wouldn't waste my money on that stuff at the market so I certainly would not ever walk in to another White Castle brick & mortar restaurant location. Sorry but there are WAY too many quality options in town to even consider wasting my time, money, or tastebuds on White Castle.

LIUszIz7M_seKPo61AoQ8A.text: I had never been to White Castle before and I was excited to try them for the first time. Seating was awful and so was the food. What was I thinking. I don't even think I could stomach them on a drunk stomach.

Ssfdnb9F-b_38_JBbPHd-w.text: Buns seem to be steamed better than when I first came. Still disappointed with not having onion rings and clam strips on the menu.

fsieB-SdQBr6LuZ2k0tYHw.text: it's been about 10 years since i've eaten at a white castle restaurant (queens blvd, woodside queens, october 2005)... and being somewhat of a drunk i'm a big fan of the microwavable white castle sliders.  a few weeks after the grand opening of the very first west coast location on the las vegas strip, i decided to drop in and give it a shot, seeing that there were no ridiculous lines to be encountered. i stood in line for about 10 minutes, ordered the #2 (4 cheese burger sliders, fries, drink) for just under $10, and waited another 10 minutes to receive my food.  the overall meal was somewhat satisfying, but the food is a bit overpriced, and obviously geared towards tourists. would i recommend any locals go through the trouble of navigating through las vegas blvd. traffic, find a spot at the harrah's parking structure, and take a long walk through the casino to get to white castle? well, i personally wouldn't do it again. i think i'd only eat here again if i was already close by and doing something else. the only advantage to eating here rather than microwaving some white castle sliders that you bought at albertsons is that the buns on the restaurant sliders are fresh, and don't get hard like microwavable variety sometimes do after you take them out of the wrapper... and the restaurant variety comes with a sliced pickle... not that the pickle really adds to the overall taste. but overall, i'd have to say that the microwavable sliders and restaurant sliders still taste identical.

dn_mp9Mgxgn3Vsd5XpvR9A.text: Typical franchise location that created a ton of hype only to disappoint with frozen disgusting meat and a dirty and extremely crowded dining room.  The meat was just more like a thinly slice of roast beef that lacks flavor.

EkS4zjSy7MKP_m2HIpb2KA.text: I was so excited that Whit Castle opened up a location closer to the west coast, so I definitely had to eat there on my next trip to Las Vegas. My wife and I just recently visited this location on the morning of Friday 02/06/2014. We placed our order at the cashier and then head to the soda fountain to fill up our drinks. Before we are finished filling up our drinks, the man (5'8-5'10 with short hair) at the front counter is already calling out our number to pick up our order. I'm already trying my best and hurried up filling up our drinks so I can pick up the order. But within seconds after the first number call, the man at the front counter started to sound impatient and angry when he calls (yelling and screaming) out our number for the second and third time. I'm appreciative that they provide fast service on the orders, but the man really scared us and made us feel forced/rushed, it was very unprofessional!  Note (02/26/2015): This location barely just opened and it's the first location on the west coast, it's already at 2.5 star overall rating on Yelp, it's shameful and embarrassing.

rNVo-YnSbz2Gp95SY03yog.text: 1st time I had white castle sliders... woo-hoo!  very delicious!  cheap, yummy and fast on the strip!  i like their fries - which are not salty, and chicken rings ! open up in canada, will ya!?

qEpnKbWhlKFgjevnmTMG4w.text: cool for us west coast people.  came here late night 2 am and maybe 4am.  place was pretty clean.  food came out fast.  no complaints here.  minor issue of someone passed out and some goofballs trying to take pictures of the dude koed.    yeah-burgers         -onion rings ok-fries  no-chicken rings  fast, quick, easy done!  the food is w.e but hey now ive been to white castle.  me and harold we did it

FmPprK_FWNHU54h9VtkAOw.text: First off, it's definitely not worth the 2 + hour wait. Wait like a month or so to go when the hype is over. My friend and I, being locals, drove from Henderson to the strip to try White Castle out. My family is from the east coast so I've experienced it before, but my friend hadn't.  After our long wait, I ordered a combo with 4 sliders, a side, and a drink and I ordered the 10 slider pack to take back home to my grandma. My friend ordered 4 sliders, a side, and a drink. I received my order fairly quickly after ordering.  I ate my food and waited an extra 30 minutes before my friend got his. I order 10 more sliders than he did. He went up 3 times to ask what was taking so long and the guy calling out orders said he had his ticket there and he would call him. Still nothing. He finally went and asked the cooks and they made his sliders right then and there. I don't see what the problem was.  Also, two of my sliders had a pickle and two didn't. The fact that they are already inconsistent is pretty bad.

gFhcaowcadwKLEXSESG8Kw.text: White Castles are my favorite. They started in Wichita but Kansas has no White Castles. Go figure. Las Vegas White Castle opened in January. Order the family pack with 10 or 20. Fries or onion petals atr a must. Cheesecake on a stick is great

3cdRXZiBSXwQscQO4OwafQ.text: NAAAAAAAASTY!!! BURGERS tasted like paper! We were so disappointed! could honestly say we will NEVER eat there ever again.

pla0yY7hNIsOmD20a7iNFA.text: Thank you White Castle for coming to the WEST COAST.... As soon as they opened in Las Vegas, I was there that week. Can you bring one to CALI please, if not will travel for food.

RA-HJIqaM-A-ZAk9J638ow.text: It's exactly what I expected. It's worth 4 stars for not having to fly east for fresh sliders.  Price is a little higher than normal and I wish they had the jalapeno cheese burger. Still happy they're here.

siiMbm0xWZDWpa6DPeR7ww.text: Having lived primarily on the west coast, I have never had the opportunity to go to a White Castle. So whenever I went on a trip to the East Coast, I tried to make White Castle a must visit place. Unfortunately, it always eluded me, thus making the allure of White Castle that much greater. Even when it made its appearance at the food truck festivals, I opted not to wait in the 3 hour line. so when I heard they opened up a location on the strip, I figured I'd try it once and for all. And no, the Wal-Mart ones don't count. I also understand ones expectations usually does not meet their perception when yearning for so long. Plus I heard it's overrated. So when I tried it, I wasn't surprised it wouldn't live up to the hype. But what I didn't expect was for the frozen Wal-Mart ones to be better. That's right, I said it. I like my microwave sliders better. Maybe they rushed to get all orders out quickly, which is why my order felt on the cool side. i have to say though, I went on a Wednesday night and got my order quickly. So that's a plus right? So to end my review, I'll say it was ok. Worth the hype? Nah. Will I go back? Probably not. Vegas is surrounded by burger joints in the same price range. So I think I'll just check this off my list of places to try and move along.

qSAUkdc8-SueDBuNHGbSRQ.text: I felt like I had to try it since it's so well known, talked about, and movie about it. I never make it to the east coast and now that there is one in Vegas, I had to try it. So far I've only had the frozen ones which are just "ok". Well unfortunately it tasted the same as frozen. Guess that says how good of a job they did with the frozen burgers, but also about how "meh" the burger is. I'd imagine the prices are a lot higher at the Vegas location than ones on the east coast, at least I hope so for there sake. They had combos with 2 or 3 sliders and the things are so tiny I wouldn't be surprised if people easily take down 10. I got a single, a double, then split some onion rings (although they werent rings, what? they qere quarters) and chicken rings (which actually were rings). There is way better food on the strip, especially for burgers, but if you go here, I suggest just trying it for a drunking snack, not for a real meal.

38YD0RN4lGSHEqXgpfpKIw.text: Another Harold & Kumar fan checking in. Glad to finally cross White Castle off my bucket list. Still not really sure how I feel about it though. All of my bodily senses tell me I shouldn't like it. I mean, the famous sliders were soggy and tasteless, and yet I came away from it all kinda enjoying the experience. In a way, I can understand the appeal. If you're completely famished, it's easier to stuff yourself with White Castle sliders than with any other fast food burger precisely because of the very traits that make it so unappealing to foodies. Dunno if I'll ever come back, but regardless of all the bad reviews anyone who liked Harold and Kumar owes it to themselves to try the food at least once.

AvBoEmxqeHNK53VlwR7Dlg.text: This review is specifically for the people who left crappy reviews saying White Castle is overrated after being told how great it was. You likely heard this from someone who grew up with WC and has fond memories of eating it while stoned or drunk. That's exactly what it is and I think it satisfies like no other drunk food in existence. Don't come in expecting a knock your socks off burger because you won't get it. Enjoy it for what it is and understand why us west coast transplants are happy to see it in Vegas.

LeOHJIMLKjK9xhKGE3T2ig.text: I preferred not to give any star at all! Taste nasty. the burger was wet,soft and it's like worst burger I ever had. Burger King's burger is way better than this shit. I don't know this place is so popular.

wcljx7MelKn4INEwcn9SqA.text: What's all the hype???? I will never understand.   Upon arrival to Vegas, two of my friends were so excited about this place, so we ended up going here on our second day for a late lunch. I ordered a regular combo that came with 4 burgers, fries and a drink. They were so unorganized that I ended up with someone else's food, but after standing there for 8 mins I decided to just roll with it. I actually ended up with some little tasty onion crispers instead of fries. Now, I will say that I liked them a lot, but the burgers were exactly like a Krystal burger ( no biggie, nothing major ), it looked like a Krystal & tasted like a Krystal. I later had a tummy ache. There restaurant set up is wide open, so you can see everything going in the kitchen area.    The restaurant dining area was a complete mess, I mean,  if you know you have that much traffic coming thru your restaurant, one would think you would have a clean up staff on duty at all times.   I wasn't impressed, once was enough for me.

ckmb2Ke5x20FUQOaSWKuoQ.text: I've always wanted to eat at a white castle! And I finally did and I liked it! Ordered 3 small cheeseburgers and fries. The burguers were quite good! Good costumer service!

Qh7eP_6EU9IApClwtlUCXA.text: I had high expectations for the famous White Castle this place was nothing great the soda even sucked burgers were freezer burned and the buns were so soggy the onions were disastrous this place is an abomination get your shit together White Castle you've failed us. NO STARS IF THERE WAS AN OPTION!!!! ITS NOT EVEN REAL MEAT ITS GREY COLORED WITH HOLES

mz0Os467GFecQktCYaq14w.text: I've always wanted to try a White Castle and this is the only place in western US.  The burgers are more like small sliders, so order a few of them. They come with pickles and grilled onions, but they are very tasty!  I also ordered 'onion chips'; Its like onion rings but in French fry form. They are really good.  The service was quick, the prices were reasonable (considering it's on the strip). I would definitely come back.

Os1yN4RnktnT9PWEiFSnAw.text: I came here the first time hearing about the hype and definitely fulfilled my expectations from the slider being well cooked to the loaded fries coming out warm and filled with cheese and bacon to filling me up with 3 slider!! I came again last night and will always crave it at vegas.

28krQn6BW3Bz3QPGfEGsPg.text: OMG!  There is a White Castle now in Vegas!?!?  Why??  Guess it's for the dudes that did not score...  I grew up in the East Coast surrounded by White Castle's.  Basically it's a gross hamburger that ONLY tastes great when it is between 2 AM and 5 AM and you meet ALL THREE of the following conditions:  1. Your are drunk, and  2.  You are very hungry, and 3.  You did not score at the club.    My friends and I would come to White Castle in HIGH SCHOOL after a night of cruising, boozing (fyi: drinking age was 18 back East--16 if you looked older and cool), schmoozing, and losing.   At 2 AM all night long the place is filled with dudes that have no squeeze box--otherwise they would not be here--you have loser spelled all over you when you step foot in the door.    But after a few White Castles at 25 cents each, 30 cents with cheese it was, and some greasy ass fries--you don't worry about it till the next morning when you wake up alone with Hamburger breath.   Not a place for children, not for the sober, not for anyone looking for a quality hamburger, not a place you take a significant other or any woman unless you want to get dumped fast.    I still have vivid memories of the those days back at WC. If I could only go back in time, I would not have needed to make as many trips there with the boys.

ESxmfb43eerIuusSoi-IBw.text: First time and last time i try this. Have yall heard of bubble guts?? Yup that is my ass hurting right now. The food was blah. Ive gone to the restroom like 10 times just airing the gas out!! Never again.

XBAOIjGY9KYBxqU5VzzlpQ.text: It's possible that I'm just an easy sell when it comes to nostalgic food items, but I've always enjoyed their sliders ever since I knew how to use a microwave, so despite the fact that they're greasy and incredibly junky, I still love em!  They taste exactly like the ones you find at the frozen section of your local grocery store/7-11 (after they've been defrosted/heated, of course).... even though they're supposed to be *somewhat* more fresh when prepared right away. Really, it's not any different, so I wouldn't make it a point to stop by White Castle when in Vegas, unless you want to try their other items like chicken rings, fries, etc.  If you're planning a visit anyway, the deep fried onion petals are a must as a choice of side! Super crunchy and delicious. I don't know about you, but I always felt awkward biting into an onion "ring". These are so much more fun to eat! Just pop those little suckers right into your mouth. I went with somebody who has tried it in New York, and apparently this location doesn't offer everything from the original menu.  The mere thought of horseradish makes me cringe and shiver for irrational reasons, so if you and I share that intense disgust for it, stay away from the zesty zing dipping sauce. Had it by accident without knowing what it was. Blarrrggh!   I'm not an active environmentalist, but I don't litter and am aware of other issues relating to the matter, so it did sort of break my heart to toss out so much cardboard boxes that only served as brief housing for such dinky sliders :( But I suppose that it's because they are very delicate, and typical wrappers would've squashed them.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_8jrrsVmiHvjDrWKmLJzlA.text: I think I was more excited about the fact that I got to finally try White Castle than I was about the actual food. My girls and I checked it out after a night of club hopping--and this food is perfect for that sort of situation. I HATE onions, but was so tired I ended up eating them anyway. The burgers weren't horrible, but they weren't amazing either. I know that folks say they're like Krystal's burgers, but I liked them better...although I couldn't tell you the last time I had anything from Krystal's.  All in all, the restaurant wasn't great, but being able to experience it during an awesome Vegas vacay made it worthwhile.

fuA5oQuv2mEXL_H_otB5EA.text: ***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 54/100***  You know what they say... when in Rome, do as the Romans do. Since we were staying on the strip for a 3 day staycation we planned on finally trying White Castle and cross it off our list. Personally I have had no urge to try this popular east coast chain but the hubby was adamant in trying it at least once. Ummmm NO, not going back. Lol.   After trekking the unforgiving 110 degree Vegas heat from the Flamingo, we arrived at the very well lit White Castle space inside the Casino Royale. The area is decorated modestly and everywhere you looked was clean hence the extra star because reality is, all I can give for the quality food wise is 1 star.  We ordered 2 cheese slider combos ($8.99 each) which consisted of: 4 cheese sliders, regular size fries and a drink; Large order of the onion chips ($2.99) the buy 'em by the sack which had 10 original sliders. All that set us back $32+ after the 10% local discount they gave us. The first couple of bites were okay but it was downhill after that, I had 3 sliders and I was fighting to down it. The middle was somewhat soggy which was very unsettling, the taste is indescribable but not in a good way. The fries and onion chips have nothing going on for them either, nothing to write home about. My daughter who likes cheeseburger barely finished one, my husband had the same sentiments, after his third one he was done. My son is the only one that liked it. I told him he can come with his cousins if the mood strikes him because there is no way you can ever bring me back here, it's just not worth the calories. White Castle, check, on to the next adventure.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PR5gJejinbqabO6DU_tpcQ.text: White Castle had been on my bucket list for years. When I heard they recently opened a location in Vegas my smile grew big as I bookmarked it and forgot about it for a few months. We decided to head out to Vegas last weekend sporadically and I knew I had to find it on the strip and try it. Luckily, without planning our hotel was not too far from the White Castle that we stumbled upon our first night in town casino hopping. It is located inside the Royale Casino, which was another amazing find (cheap drinks), but that will be another review.    We got in a long line and waited eagerly. We ordered a number 9 which included 20 original sliders and 2 regular French fries for $25.99. We added cheese and the total was around $35. Amanda took our order. She was patient, polite, and informative on our questions. Give Amanda a raise. We took our booty back to our room and began to pig out after a long night. I was surprised to bite into pickles on the burgers. Prior, I had only tried the frozen White Castle burgers, no pickles came on them. After the two of us devoured all we could we quickly realized that we had ordered way too much food for two people. There were MANY burgers left over. I am glad I checked this one off my list, and didn't have to travel to the East Coast to do so. It was not the best food but for being hungry in Vegas it hit the spot.  *The french fries were not good at all. Wish we had tried another side instead.

AT9VF34lhLFHDjZ-yhL51A.text: Hell yes! That's all I said when I Jumped in line, growing up with a New Yorker in the house you learn a thing or two about the east, one thing I leave was WC! Growing up he always said the freezer boxes weren't the same.. I didn't understand till my first time in his hometown, the greatest experience ever!  Came to Vegas for my Bday and relieved a Childhood memory of a deprived west coast child, bitter sweet coming without pops but I know he's looking down smiling because I ordered the same way he used to! The service was Great! The line was Short the fries fell short on taste but that's expected they aren't known for the fries not bad but not amazing.. The employees were great! Very involved! Over all a great experience this will be a go to spot for me every time I come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FKnTbqstbPjgKjAUQvytcg.text: I think just like everybody else, I wanted to try this place after watching the movie Harold and Kumar. 11 years later, finally made it here. For some reason, could not locate it in New York, but found it in Vegas. Saw people taking pictures here.   It's actually really good. Surpassed my expectations. Got the mini cheese sliders. It's really good. Fresh and lots of flavor. I love the onions baked into the meat. It's so much better than the ones sold frozen in the grocery aisle.   The bad is the long line, long wait, and price. However, would definitely return.

1hTDNnZLtPOnPMj2emRrFw.text: From 7/24/15  We came here after a concert, and let me just say this White Castle is not like the ones I am used to in NY. Now, taking in account this location is on The Strip, I had to remind myself not to pick it apart for being overcrowded after all there are tons of hungry tourist to feed.  Once you get your burgers, it's typical White Castle- cheap and delicious. I just hope they make one off The Strip for those of us who just want their burger goodness minus all the tourist.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Typical burger and fries.

-y5A40dc-Ix6p6QoUrF78w.text: I've always wanted to try White Castle burgers made fresh from their actual restaurant. My experience with them to this point had been buying their frozen burgers they sell across the country in most grocery stores (which I really enjoy).   I have to say that there wasn't much difference between the fresh restaurant product and the frozen product. I even think that I am slightly fonder of the frozen one. Also the added benefit of there being no drunk people stumbling around the freezer section of your local Walmart gives getting the frozen burgers a leg up on visiting this location which is in the middle of the Casino Royale (a fun but slightly shady casino on the north end of the strip).   Burgers were okay, fries were okayish, and prices were average. White Castle ended up being a luke warm purgatory like experience.

DzYxTjrim8T5Kh4HLQY1vA.text: Thankful the 'belly bombers' are now on Vegas. I was raised on White Castle ;)  nothing beats those grilled onions! I usually order a dozen with cheese and a dozen without.  Recently tried the fudge dipped brownie!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grew up having these &#39;belly bombers&#39;!  The grilled onions make these.  Be sure and try the fudge dipped brownie!

3G_MSnhTUSlRnTQbeR7qtQ.text: First time experience at 5am after a long drive from San Diego to Vegas Baby.  Great hours considering they never seem to close. Great burger. Easy menu. Reminds me of Krystal burger back east.

EsRBQuUnLro5LzeQ6LHWuw.text: Yes we went again. My first review was lower only because the Las Vegas prices are higher than what I'm used to in the Detroit area. Food was fine.   This time we looked past the prices and just fixated on the food. The burgers were as good as any WC anywhere but the fries weren't exactly fresh. So while I could knock them for the fries, it's a White Castle and it was a WC experience    The line wasn't long, the wait for the food was alright and the burgers were as good as any. They don't serve win mustard and ketchup but when you have such a massive operation as the LV location you make allowances.   Kudos for a great "dinner". Work on those fries and we'll be back monthly because.....it's White Castle baby!

OlRC7GX2aR3EawqmXm_G3g.text: I hate onions.  But White Castle burgers are the only things I'll eat them on. AND their onion fries.   That place was heaven. I bet it tastes like magic when you're drunk and/or high...   The chicken rings were pretty good too. Not a fan of cheese on my chicken, but the portion was perfect.

j6qvz5Lc0oCRNLBTHr9WbA.text: Meh.  It tastes like the ones you buy in the frozen aisle and is nothing special.  Harold and Kumar what were you thinking... oh right...

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Az1wtxvfv8JQAjPOnKl-ww.text: Growing up in Texas, we have always had the frozen White Castle burgers in grocery stores but never the actual castles. For some reason, the frozen white castle burgers have always been incredibly delicious to me. Disclaimer: I am no burger aficionado. I'm a simple girl, I can have a meal consist of frozen foods and be happy. I've always wanted to go to the actual White Castle after obviously being inspired by Harold and Kumar and I'm glad there's a location in Vegas for me to finally check out. The burgers taste exactly the same as the freezer burgers except the "fresh" ones have pickles. I can rest easy now that I can continue buying the freezer burgers back home and know that it does not taste any different from those at the actual White Castle. The onion chips are addicting as well. I would opt for those over the crinkle-cut fries.

zsJzPkqlJfc3ynlyNu8z5Q.text: We drive up from the Phoenix area for White Castle. Husband is a WC freak! I grew up in No Cal, so I only knew from the movies. ;) He says they are far better than the microwave / grocery store heat and eat. We did a drive across the good ol' USA last summer (from coast to coast) and I honestly can't tell the difference between Las Vegas and St Louis. Which is a good thing. They taste the same here as they did on the East Coast.

9AQoVvkL_R-QyMY8W5CArw.text: First of all, anybody that leaves White Castle less than five stars is obviously not a winner because I just won $1000 and I'm pretty happy about their crave case. It reminds me of my wonder years in Noblesville, Indiana. You know what you're going to get when you order those juicy sliders. And you know what's going to happen after you enjoy them. You should buy them by the sack for the highest quality enjoyment. They go in as fast as they come out. Enjoy them with the ones you love.

8yGzJiGXsgGOjcYvWYD41g.text: The burgers are alright. Taste becomes bland after a couple of em. Good to snack on though.   Been here 3x and it gets really busy at night. The longest me and my buddies ever waited for these burgers was probably 30-40 minutes. Waiting in line was probably the longest part.  Overall, good midnight/early morning snack after a night out.  I would prob be back...whenever i visit vegas and need late night/early morning snack lol.

YvQPTEe4o5jvQm7jkcKL_w.text: Your average burger place.  Its a novelty coz its the only one in Nevada.  Normally White Castle comes frozen in a box. I was surprise they had the vegi burger.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tVdwLX24jqWcT3pzGLLa7g.text: I think if I lived in the East Coast I would go to White Castle because it tastes good, but for now I could settle for eating the frozen ones from the store because they taste EXACTLY THE SAME.   Do not come here, it's a waste of time. The line wraps against the wall and the entire dining set up is one long table top in the middle and then a bunch of small tables on the sides in a really small space. There's a casino right next to you also, but the entire location is pretty run down because it's one of the older areas of the strip that's still left.  When we finally got to the front after like 20 minutes we ordered the Crave Case which comes with 30 sliders, which is cool if you have a bunch of people with you. The cashier asked if we wanted cheese and we decided to only do half with cheese. Turns out it's an extra $5 just to do half with cheese! He didn't even warn us it was going to be more, but I guess we should have assumed it. There's honestly nothing too special about the actual slider. All I can say is that it tastes pretty damn good.  All in all, I love White Castle but this location sucks. I guess it's cool if you want the sliders fresh, but it doesn't make that much of a difference. Like I said, head over to your local grocery store and buy the frozen ones instead.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 30 sliders
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If the line is this long, I&#39;d skip out on it

Uy54cfMrRSgm0TMNfg99og.text: This is the very 1st White Castle to have opened in the West Coast!  It opened on January 27th, 2015; and it was the very 1st time in 56 years that a White Castle has expanded in a different state.   The 1st time I ever had a White Castle slider was back in the 90's when Costco used to sell them in their freezer section.  I didn't even know that they were a fast food chain since there weren't any in the West Coast.  After Costco stopped selling these, I never heard of White Castle again until the film "Harold & Kumar Goes to White Castle" was released in 2004.  Ever since I saw that movie, I've always had a craving for White Castle.  When I went to New York in 2008, it was the very 1st time that I ever dined at a White Castle establishment.   When I went to Las Vegas in 2015, I was pleasantly surprised to see this White Castle since they've only had their restaurants in the mid-West & the East Coast.  I had to give them a try!  This is a cleaner White Castle than their other locations, and it was fun to sit by the window and "people-watch" the folks walking on the strip.  As for the food.., it's your typical White Castle.  Small portions & very greasy.  You always have to order more sliders than you think, if you just have a normal appetite; and even more sliders if you're really hungry!  What makes this White Castle unique is that they serve breakfast items from 5am - 11am, and they also sell cold draft beer.   It's a good place to get cheap food at any hour of the day/night.  In the past, the only place to get 24/7 fast food was at McDonald's.  It's a novelty to finally have a White Castle in the West Coast; but at the end of all things.., it's still just a fast food chain.  It's just nice to have another alternative than the McDonald's on the Las Vegas strip.

UyOPDa9alOSKAu0WyVeeBw.text: For my husband's 31st bday he had the goal of conquering White Castles 100 slider crate with 10 of his friends. Mission accomplished! We got 50/50 regular and jalepeno sliders with fries and drinks to go all around. We called ahead to place the order. It was on-time, fresh (sliders and fries alike), and not greasy. Bravo, truly! Further, the restaurant was clean and had plenty of seating.

Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r8gUEcZp7yZebfglUCkSTg.text: Nothing special about White Castle burgers. It was very pricey for small simple cube-shape burgers. It was worth the try but something I wouldn't eat again. We ordered number 7 with cheese for extra $3. The late night crowd is not a pleasant so I recommend anyone with little kids to go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original sliders with cheese

91QV8di_3SYOAi-jkfNx8w.text: My opinion is a little bias, I grew up in Jersey eating White Castle, after moving to California for 16 years and then currently residing Pittsburgh  I haven't tasted White Castle in 24 years, then I went to Vegas last week and Long and behold I saw one and ordered 12 of those little burgers from heaven and it took me back all those years. I love them like spongebob to crabby patties, thank you White Castle and thank you Vegas.

1jyt0yORrSxOdojBCwtP-Q.text: I live in Georgia, where we don't really have White Castle restaurants.  We do have something called Krystal, which sells small sized boxed burgers too but all the northern transplants down here (which are annoyingly plentiful) always say White Castle is so much better and they always wax nostalgic about growing up devouring their burgers.  I'm not a fan of Krystal either, so I believed them.    The only White Castle burgers I'd ever tasted were the refrigerated, microwavable ones you buy at the grocery store.  They were bland, but I gave the transplants the benefit of the doubt.  After all, the microwavable sandwiches probably didn't taste like the real thing.    Fast forward to March 23, 2016:  I'm on vacation in Las Vegas and I'm staying at the Casino Royale Hotel.  There happens to be a White Castle restaurant right here in my hotel!  It was late at night, I was starving after a long day of just having fun on the Strip without eating anything.  Just about anything would have been delicious to me at the time.  I walked in, ordered their $9.99 package (which includes 4 small cheeseburgers, fries and a soft drink) and immediately took it back to my room.    A previous poster here, named Leanne L., summed it up perfectly:  It tasted no different from the microwavable White Castle burgers you get at the supermarket.  And the fries were only slightly better.  After all these years of having northerners tell me how great White Castle is, I was disappointed.  It sucked when the best part of my meal was the Coca Cola I drank.    I guess the northern transplants will tell me that since the restaurant I went to was located in Vegas, it was just a bastardized version of White Castle and not the one they grew up eating.  We all know Sin City likes to replicate themes from other places, but I doubt this is the case here.  I doubt I'll eat there again unless I'm just desperately hungry and don't feel like walking all over the Strip to go somewhere else.  I do admit that their chocolate cheesecake on a stick looked good on the menu, but I didn't try that.    I give them good marks for having friendly cashiers and quick service even though the place was crowded.  But I was there for the food and it really wasn't much different from Krystal.  Little, bitty tasteless burgers with cheese, diced onions and no tomatoes.

C13bNx4aqLlWpUbqEQ5-RQ.text: Disappointing. White Castle was pretty hyped up for me thanks to my friends. As I was walking the strip looking for a place to eat, I stumbled across it and decided I might as well try it. I ordered a variety of things: onion rings, chicken nugget like things and two sliders.  Onion rings, unfortunately these were the highlight of my meal....they were the best tasting thing I ordered and even then they were just okay.  The chicken nuggets tasted very stale and were pretty small too. For reference I am a fan of McD's nuggets.  The sliders were bad. They tasted like meat paste covered in onion inside a bun. I cringed while eating them and so did the friend I was with.  At least their service is nice though?

Nznd1eqv1My8vwx3dwDSPQ.text: This is probably the most confused staff I have seen. Complete confusion, tickets out of order, waiting forever! Unacceptable I won't be back! Where the hell is managment? Have been waiting 25 min.

o6NSkoSM9ViKgMMB8jPxng.text: Well I finally tried out the famous White Castle and I did not care for the burgers so much they kinda hade a wired smell to them. The chicken sandwich was good so I'm giving this a 3 star!

Vrm9mffNiLflnkY33ixRvg.text: Harold and Kumar sure make it seem like this is the place to be. For many years, I have been wanting to try this hoping that I would be blown away from the taste. Since they do not have this chain down south, where I stay, I had not been able to taste it.  Until one day, I was driving by the vegas strip and noticed it tucked deep in the sidelines of the Casinos.  After some tricky parking, and a long trek I was finally at the register ordering the cheese slider meal.  At first glance, everything seemed good, heck it sure did make for a great instagram post, which is mandatory for me on all food I eat.  After the first bite, I was left unimpressed.  I would easily rank Fatburger and In and out above this chain and even Mcdonalds.  It was definitely great to finally try it but would not go out of my way to do it again.

Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sJPmzcX7Ut39rRLQ8QLCBA.text: I was so shocked and excited after arriving in Las Vegas to find out that White Castle now exists in the middle of the desert! All I can say is, regardless of whether you are a huge fan, you need to stop by here at least once to order a sack of sliders. They are delicious, fun to eat, and very convenient when you've been staying up all day and night wandering around the casinos. In fact, this particular location is open 24 hours a day!  Now, I'm not saying that I ate baby burgers for breakfast, lunch, and dinner on my last vacation, but if I did I could definitely say it was worth it. Only in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Castle location--across from mirage hotel.

tpsekFIaUL6MpTaaqAv27w.text: The vegetarian burgers are HORRIFIC. Literally horrific. It's a bun with a small veggie Pattie in it, no toppings, no sauce, no cheese, no NOTHING. We drove way too far for us to go back and ask for toppings on a burger, but who in the hell puts NOTHING on a burger!?  **Edit: I ordered one sweet chili veggie burger and one ranch veggie burger.... Neither of which had anything but bread and a veggie pattie. Also, onions and pickles are vegan and come on all of your other burgers (FYI to the business owner who wanted to mention that cheese isn't vegan, as if this somehow remedies the situation or amounts to any sad excuse for customer service)**

JSp0rnAl371Pg-MyfpEsPA.text: Had to come here after watching Harold & Kumar and was so excited they opened one up in the west coast. Came here before heading home from Vegas and I thought it was perfect for a hangover. It is fast food so don't expect anything fancy or high quality ingredients. Just greasy goodness on the go!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 sliders with cheese combo

W26ykfpKI0ADwfr3bD8plw.text: I wanted a White Castle burger for years but as I live in Texas they are not easy to get. The burger took me back to my youth when there was a White Castle in Dallas. Glad I had it.

9SJTl8Ecn5HJ5wYwgZbkuA.text: My boyfriend's a fan and he liked it.  So that's why it gets 3 stars.  It's a weirdly laid-out restaurant in a small, shady hotel.  Service was less than friendly.  The food was White Castle-y.  And my boyfriend liked it.  So there's that.

iVXhUsBly2mbefJ7t3qEGw.text: I so wanted to see and taste why Harold and Kumar went through all that trouble to get a bunch of these burgers. So no better place than coming here and in Vegas! The outside looks like a castle, pretty cool. Inside looks like a regular fast food burger restaurant. Packed on a Friday afternoon but fast and good service. Now for the food, we got the combo meal that comes with 4 white castle cheeseburgers, cringly fries and a drink. Fries were good but the burger was just ok. Nothing to get excited about. They are very small with a very thin slice of meat and a ton of onions with pickles. If you love these two veggies then I think you will love the burgers. It was a good experience but it is a type of "one hit wonder" for me (basically I tried it once and I had my fill of it). I would suggest just trying it out, it doesn't hurt!

t3LPwoQzFMYKvuUNBVUusg.text: SERIOUSLY?? I see these dumb reviews on here and it blows my mind. People act as if they are dining at a 5 star restaraunt. Complaining about noise, wait, and anything else. White Castle is a fast food chain located INSIDE a casino. Clear on that?   Ok, on to the food....  Amazing! These little sliders taste different than any burger you have ever had. From the first bite they absolutely melt in your mouth. Although primarily on the East coast I'm glad to see one come out here to the West coast. The line is pretty long here but that's to be expected. It's a new restaraunt in town and the taste is amazing! I will be visiting here every time I'm in Vegas! It's a great grab-no-go spot while roaming the town of Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Setup

eqRPVeCpcNhb8n5gK5OLtw.text: Not a big fan. The burgers tasted just like the frozen ones you pickup at the grocery store and pop in the microwave. Patties are just as small. Nothing special other than you see them being made.

Ppff5yR4dP4xkmBGpV7KYA.text: My husband and daughter enjoyed the burgers.  I thought the chicken rings were tender and tasted okay.  Chocolate shake was good. We came at a good time and there was only one person in front of us. Fast and cheap food. Glad they opened a chain here in the west coast.

yn6Pxvx-R5X3LUrdxVSq2g.text: Thoroughly enjoyed the Midwest sliders. Freshly made and tasty. Brought back memories from Chicago late night slider runs.  They have onion "chip" rather than full onion rings. Think onion rings cut into pieces.  And being Las Vegas, this White Castle serves beer - keep that buzz going!  Friendly staff and a dining room cleaning crew that was constantly keeping the place clean.

7aNZSgWcwpm2bDtbjBzmuA.text: If you've tasted the White Castle frozen burgers, the fresh ones are pretty much the same. Service was great and we got our food pretty fast. The place was clean and pretty much inside the casino. I guess I was expecting a lot more than I should've.

moir5eYkWaMtIVvdc9lWjA.text: So, I came here the last week I was living in Vegas hoping that it would be as amazing as Harold and Kumar show in their movie about how amazing White Castle is.  I literally went on a journey from Reno to Las Vegas, then finally got to White Castle with high hopes. Yea there was a long line (its Vegas, there are long lines everywhere and long wait times in Vegas on the strip). We got our food quickly, but oh my gawd it was disgusting.  I am so disappointed that the burgers were watery, like they were frozen and not cooked all the way. The sliders filled me up quickly, but it was not satisfying. Definitely really expensive and not worth the price.  Dont expect to have that amazing experience there, unless you are super drunk or high and dont care what you put in your mouth. Fries were ok.

RsbtcrqhAjvw2nKycEEoqw.text: White Castle is definitely overhype for what it's worth or maybe I came during the wrong time. You get a lot of food in your meal but it taste like your average fast food that you can easily get from any fast food restaurant. Some of the employees seem very impatient but you can't really expect much from a fast food restaurant that's always packed. It is worth the experience in Vegas to say the least. If I'm starving at 3 or 4 in the morning with no other option the next time I visit Vegas, I might give it a second chance?

r4wO4kez94h-dilxNMgJ6w.text: They are considered a east coast institution but they tasted like McDonalds Cheeseburgers to me. I think its the combination of pickles and onions and thin meat on a soft bun.  Would I try again, why not but I wouldn't expect outstanding at all.   Onion strips were okay. Staff was polite and kind and had me on my way with combo #2 in no time (4 cheeseburgers, onions or fries plus drink).  Place is located on the east wall of the Casino Royale which I think they took some space from a Denny's that use to be there or might still be there.   Security is there to keep people from cutting a very long line.  My experience was walking in and was asked by a guard if I just got there, I said yes and then he asked me to get in line but there was no long line, I asked him which line? He then said oh, another guard just said go ahead sir. Line was actually 5 deep at the time and not out the door to the strip like some mentioned.
