Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu part1
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate milk shake

oomU5MPU5hdxohAcr67Lkw.text: Four words. Over priced and over hyped. Thumps down. I know your known for small burgers, but seriously guys 5 french fries for $3 dollars is ridiculous.   ****Beware!! Patron here only if you are heavily intoxicated. (You will not enjoy these sober.)

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 70&#39;s porn legend Ron Jeremy

uk-6JADPZmfHTz4c3D0VfQ.text: Good memories from those sliders and bacon cheese fries.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jlEmzlLHaIDY3qgViFGFYQ.text: Looked good when Harold and Kumar ate it in the movie. Thought we gave it a try since it opened here. Much more costly than other states i heard as it's suppose to be a quarter each. We got 4 cheeseburger sliders with a drink and fries and it was $8.99.  The sliders were pretty gross. I think some frozen sliders even taste better. The bread were soggy on the bottom as if my bun was accidentally dropped in water. What makes it worse is its not water but the bun soaked up the fat juice from the meat (which some may like but a soggy bun, no thank you). The meat looked old and not fresh at all. One picture that a fellow yelper posted says it all.   Service was ok. Some were super nice while some looked as if they just crawled out of bed or have a bad hangover. Definitely a one time visit for me. Never again.

DTFAOD1e2Gbj-Bm6O8wIwg.text: Shit, for the price we paid I assumed that when I ate it, i'd taste the damn meat instead it felt like I was eating only the bun. Their meat is as flat and thin as the cheese..... I enjoyed more seeing the options of drinks than I did eating the meal... Fries were not salted and tables were dirty and filled with a lot of mess from previous people.

d_P8jjnzM45v02z8AQYjCQ.text: I'm embarrassed to admit that we visited White Castle 2x while in Vegas.  Fast Food?  Who me?  But we just couldn't resist!  It's a classic and not available anywhere near where we live.  How was it?  Exactly as it should have been:  grossly wonderful burgers, good fries and fantastic shakes.  Would I go again?  YES!  Probably every time I go to Vegas, I'll throw down a few at White Castle.

8RvZgEJM2ucLVrj2QYTYmQ.text: D. Freakin'. Licious. Best drunk food ever. My husband and I stayed at the Venetian and we ate here 3-4 times (we weren't drunk each time lol) during our 2 night 3 day stay. I'm not proud to admit that. Only qualm is that the line one time was ridiculously long and they only had one register. But what made up for it was the customer service. John, the cashier, was super nice. FYI they do offer military discounts.

zEoikZ9qkg04GeNcx5EMFQ.text: Burgers were soggy and order was incorrect. Good to stop by for a quick bite but if order for a family it would be hard to keep fresh and them not get soggy.

d4O7Lc-6ytnclK26YoCNEQ.text: The first time I came to White Castle, the line was out the door.  I was excited to try the sliders!  After the first bite, I had no idea what the fuss is about.  The sliders are small and sad looking.  Not much flavor aside from the cheese.  And that's only if you get the cheeseburger sliders!  The original sliders are underwhelming.  The lines are seriously puzzling... is there a secret menu I'm not aware of?!  On the most recent, the hubs wanted to try the chicken rings.  It's a rip off. It's like a nugget, pounded super thin and then they punched a hole in the middle to make it a "ring".  Better off going to Shake Shack or even McDonald's dollar menu.

ie4YyLMHekXX2DZr2rclEQ.text: First off, I've eaten at THE White Castle from the Harold and Kumar movie and a few others in Jersey, so I think my opinion should count for something.  So I came in here around 2pm on Sunday, and it was fairly busy. The staff was all helpful and friendly, and they got my order correct and ready in good time. The place itself is pretty clean, and the lady walking around the dining area was nice enough to clear away the trash on my table.  As for the food, you need to remember that it's FASTFOOD. Don't expect gourmet sandwiches or sliders, or even compare to In n Out. It's simple food. I got myself 10 cheeseburger sliders and loaded fries. In all honesty, the food was better than when I had it in Jersey. Fries were nice and crisp(I normally hate crinkle fries), slider bun was steamed nicely so it was very soft with fresh onions. The flavor was satisfying and hit the spot. I'm thinking about going to the grocery store to buy some microwaveable sliders just thinking about Vegas!

xJqBGcDX_QFzZUEt81YByQ.text: It's White Castle.   Shit is steamed delicious goodness. The Ritz it ain't but what else do you want? They serve glasses of beer and they are connected to the slot area of a hotel.  It is my humble opinion that this is a combination for success. Also, the line moves pretty quickly.

7eNi69fHyw0vAey4_3VOAA.text: Great place for a late night snack after a party hardy night on the Strip. Space is a bit cramped but food is up to par. Service was fairly quick, got our "Sack" of 10 sliders within 10 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hfaE65xXnkGQhY5p_rrWYg.text: For us West Coasters this is as close as we'll get to a White Castle with out taking a 4 hour flight.  My favorite is the chicken slider.  Its juicy, tender and delicious.  The regular sliders are good also.  My wife and I at here at around mid night on a Tuesday and it was pretty busy.  Expect to wait about 15 minutes for your food.

4VJASyhNW9k5OHp699tmNg.text: I had high expectations for White Castle because my friend kept talking about wanting to eat here while we were planning our Vegas trip. I thought it would taste better but the sliders literally taste like the frozen ones that you can make at home. The only difference is that they add pickles. It makes me wonder if they just reheat the frozen ones and serve it. I guess this is a nice place for drunchies but I wouldn't crave for it. The meals are also pretty pricey. I'd settle for the frozen ones.

K7avooSL44yrdBm_rPq9zg.text: Nasty!!!  Our first experience here was when they first opened...its was good! Food was good, customer service was good. This time its completely different. Burns gross fries, horrible nasty "customer" service, sent the fries back to only get back-talk from one of the employees!! Who does that!!! I'm guessing poor management is to blame? I'm not sure. The only thing good was the sliders!

zkTJngVrWVQf5ZBlZCFWMg.text: I've only had the frozen sliders, so I thought the fresh ones will taste much better. They were so bland. Maybe I should have gotten the cheese sliders. ! would give these 1.5 stars. Even if I was stoned, they wouldn't have taste any better.

ptg4kx2BVSVp6WmqMawaIw.text: TBH I only wanted to try this place out because of Harold & Kumar. Lol   Since they opened this location in Vegas, I decided to try this place out.  Location: This place is located on the strip near the Palazzo Hotel and right next to Walgreens. It's right across the street from The Mirage and Treasure Island.   Parking: You're gonna have to park at a nearby hotel and walk over if you aren't already staying at them because it is located directly on the strip.  Menu: Pretty straight forward. Original or Cheese Sliders. They serve beer on tap! How awesome is that?! Lol You can also buy meal packages, sets of 30, 100 lol  Boyfriend and I opted for 10 cheese sliders and 5 original to compare and we heard they were small.   ** TIP- You will not like these sliders if you do not like onions. I only like onions if they're cooked or caramelized or depending on my mood. I know I'm weird. Lol  I had low expectations going into this place despite reading other reviews. The cheese sliders wasn't too bad. I would eat it again. The cheese was so gooey and blended well with the onions and meat party. The original one was just too plain. The cheese definitely makes it taste 10x better. I don't recommend the original ones at all. The also come in cute little boxes.   This place would definitely be great drunk food lol but it's not amazing but it's not bad either! I just can't see myself craving it all the time.   Check this place out at least once so you can say you tried it!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assembly Line Setup
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They serve beer on tap!

bvi0l9jsg5KLgXn96ULeQg.text: Now I know why Harold and Kumar wanted White Castle. The burgers were yummy. And after a night of drinking it hit the spot. My new favorite drunk food place.

QtSUMZAILUFa-lws0PgZjQ.text: Got munchies?? Your place to go!! Small little burger siders!! We werent hungry at all but couldnt resist passing by without buying some!! Would recommend you at least try them out!!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pHS8b1RGc4jAHbdu_nVYGA.text: I adore White Castle burgers / sliders.  I use to eat them as a kid for a quarter when I lived in Brooklyn.  Unfortunately, they don't have a White Castle Franchise in California.  They sell them frozen in the Supermarkets, but they are NOT the same... perhaps 6/10.  Closest White Castle franchise is actually located in Las Vegas.  It was good, but not as good as the ones in N.Y.  I think they charge like a buck fifty for 1 slider.    If you are listening White Castle Corporate, please open some up in San Diego, California!!!

Z_QijfbyBjb-JWqiDPWrxA.text: Well, I finally made it to a White Castle. It is what it is and it doesn't try to be anything more. And that's basically how a 24-hour food joint on the strip should be. Be noted that I came here right after having a Filet Mignon at Mon Ami Gabi, so I really came in here with lower expectations. I like cheeseburgers so I went with their Castle Combo No. 2 which had 4 cheeseburgers, fries, and a drink (bit.ly/1d7fHzH). I can describe these little cheeseburgers in two words: Salt Bombs! These little suckers were pretty damn salty. I think after every bite I just keep going for my soda to soak it all up. Despite the saltiness, the cheeseburgers weren't that bad! But it might be because I had some alcohol beforehand. And definitely better than getting them frozen ones at the supermarket. For just under $10, the combo was decent. Luckily when I arrived to White Castle at around 10:30pm, there wasn't a line to order. So my experience was pretty quick as it should be. But when I walked by at around midnight, the place was super packed so I was glad that I just had beat the late night munchie rush. Amazing! Despite the novelty, I don't know if I'd come back to White Castle again. If I want a burger on the Strip late at night, there are plenty of other options at around the same price range.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Castle Combo No. 2 with 4 cheeseburgers, fries, and drink.

YAtCS0HWERGP2PL2DivrDQ.text: Ate there right after casino, ordered #2 with the cheeseburger... what a POS fast food, barely couldn't finish my meal.  Save your money for better quality burger like In and Out or even McDonald's.  Sorry White Castle, although I loved your funny movie Harold and Kumar.

FwmZv7voOO7rgAdNNdjNfg.text: It was pretty good. The fries sucked, but the burgers were pretty good. I would definitely buy the frozen burgers just to save some time in the line that I stood in. Like I said the burgers were pretty good. They definitely weren't the best but they are also far from being the worst. It's just an average tasting place.

g0GuYEg-bCrNHMZViS_s0Q.text: I came to White Castle with my cousins who were excited to try it out as they had been to White Castle locations when they lived on the East Coast but could not find any of its locations in LA. The beauty of the strip is that you could be eating gourmet burgers from super star chefs one day and sliders from the freezer section of your local grocery store the next. As expected we ordered a bunch of stuff like original sliders, cheese sliders, onion rings, curly fries, chicken nuggets etc. The onion rings and chicken nuggets were outright nasty. Do yourself a favor and stay clear of those. The sliders specially the cheese slider was surprisingly very good. The buns were nice and soft without any sogginess. The pickles, cheese and patties came together very well. I chomped on six of these bad boys with ease so definitely order a bunch of them to fill you up.  What I like about White Castle is that it does not try to be something that it is not. It is located opposite to one of the seediest dive bars that you will find on the strip and below a dumpy hotel both of which I have had the good fortune of sampling. Been there, done that, have no intention of repeating.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese slider - Surprisingly pretty good!!!

DlUeBDD_xQYAsWboy2SbBQ.text: Not Amazing food, but it's a great snack after a night out.  Burgers or sliders are actually really tiny but I thought they were super tasty.  I got a combo of 4 burgers, 1 fry & a drink  for $9. super Inexpensive fast food, like stated previously  it's not amazing but it's fast food so it's to be expected.

vkfEZIYZJaK_UQyZCpB-nQ.text: Yes I know.  One minute I can go from a gourmet Gordon Ramsay BurGR to straight ghetto White Castle belly bombers in an instant, haha!  What can I say!  Well I can say, "If you didn't grow up with White Castle, then you'll probably NEVER understand the sensation of biting into one of these heavenly sliders!"  Just keep in mind, they're NO comparison to a normal burger like In-n-Out.  So believe me, I'm McLovin' all the negative reviews.  Yes they're cute tiny little burgers and can be eaten in four bites.  But that soft steamy bun with a little bit of chopped onions, pickles, and melted cheese (or without) are just the best!  Not as healthy as a four start chain Habit Burger, or as beefy as Five Guys, but more of an "if I had a fast food burger choice" of a burger chain;  I'd choose the Dub C!  I mean, they made a movie out of it!  Plus I grew up with them in St. Louis, so it's a personal choice!      Located in the Casino Royale, and the only location in the west coast;  It's conveniently sitting between Fat Tuesday and Walgreens.  And thank goodness for being 24/7, as it's a great pre- or post-party snack!    Regarding service, it's fast food, not fine dining.  Luckily I had no issues with service, but what do you expect?  Just order and scarf them down!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Never seen this many peeps workin&#39; at a fast food joint!
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MINE!

XhJvLGORgHTda9op6Uf1ew.text: The same experience I get every year I come to Vegas. Except this time I ventured out a little and tried the Fish and Chicken slider. OH MY LORD THEYRE SO GOOD. The fish slider IS better than McDonalds Filet o Fish! Like whaaaaat?! The chicken slider was the right amount of crispiness and juicy and so was the fish slider. I got the double cheese slider as well and it was meh, I'm not a fan of White Castles Original, Classic, nor Cheeseburgers.. they're just too mushy for me and they smell weird. $10 for 1 double cheese slider, 1 fish slider, 1 chicken slider, and 1 soft drink.  I'll be back for the chicken and fish sliders! The Fried Onion Chips were actually pretty good too!

pAw5ZpvC7wjOp1Szdd0-Uw.text: Love eating here a quick snack at any time of day,  Got my burgers and fries in minutes and they were hot and fresh. Cant wait til the new location in Vegas is finished ,,

vtW8X2_eEizG1hOGX1U2Og.text: White Castle of the East on the Vegas of the West!  I've been to a White Castle before in the Bronx of NYC wile on tour being that is the only other time I've actually had their food you so know that we are going here especially late night after a few drinks!  Being from California we don't have White Castles anywhere around so we go to In In Out and it's always just magically delicious and what we crave!  The burgers here were soggy but I think it's because they steam them overall I'm not a fan of soggy buns I wasn't impressed enough by the burgers to ever really want to visit one of their locations again.  The onion chips were decently good though and went well with their BBQ sauce and made your burger taste a bit better if you added one to it.  The other thing I thought was funky was how they had chicken rings and onion chips either way I don't find my self craving anything from here like they advertise.  The line moves fairly quick though well at least for us it did as well as our food came out quickly too!  They sell beer here too so that's definitely awesome if your in it for a burger and beer!  Well what I will say is if you have never visited a White Castle and your next to one after you've had a few drinks pay them a visit because you might like it more than I did.

JeT-EnzG3NPUf_g2p_0dOA.text: Worst burgers I have ever had anywhere by a long shot.  Steamed burgers are just not right.  The only thing worse then food was the service and not by much.  Watching so many people fail miserably at production and communication takes it toll on your appetite and patience.  I propose as a society we ban them from serving food as it is truly just waist.  I would highly recommend going to the hospital or jail/prison for a better burger.

HXQsMpyw8kCFe38sYaJhNA.text: I had White Castle once before in when I was visiting Chicago and I didn't get it then.  When my sister-in-law saw that there was a White Castle in Las Vegas, one of her vacation stops here had to be White Castle--something that she fondly remembers from her youth.  I am still firmly in the I don't get it column.  There were three of us and we ordered a 10 pack bag with three bottles of water.  The sliders come out to be just over a dollar each but they were missing something.  Even the devoted sister-in-law thought they were missing at the very least some salt (and she doesn't use salt very much).    I was underwhelmed by the sliders.  The onion taste was about the best thing and it's really stretching it calling that little thin piece of beef a slider.  The thing is mostly bread.  Being in the Casino Royale doesn't make it an easily accessible place unless you're a tourist walking the Strip and decide to drop in.  We walked from the Venetian.  Again, I just don't get the cult following.  I'd rather spend a bit more and have something more substantial and a whole lot more flavorful!!

FqrBOiWtpc4UDVCev6Bk5Q.text: Vacationing in Vegas, I got excited that i saw there was a White Castle located on the strip. For those of you who don't know, the west coast remains White Castle-less and i'm glad that it remains that way.  Unless, you've had one too many cocktails or a yard of a margarita in need of say (1-100 burgers) to satisfy your hangover needs. It tastes just like the ones available at your local Vons/Safeway Freezer section. Save your money for other delicious foods in Vegas. Fh5KutT7zl4VhTQ6OXVwiQ.text: Came to White Castle a couple nights ago, and asked for the slider plain, meaning only the cheese and meet. The cashier who took my order then became very rude saying she can't guarantee there will be no onion because they have to manually scrape it off with their hands from the bread. I told her it was fine. Then I got my order and it had a lot of onion and pickles.  She did not even request my order plain. First time I visited and won't be back here. Terrible customer service.

xm66UOKtz2ve7eqvGZEgEQ.text: Charlton & the gang go to White Castle! Since this Vegas trip was primarily focused on burgers I wanted to experience as many places as possible. Ever since the movie Harold & Kumar go to White Castle popularized the existence of this burger chain to a wider audience, it has always been on the back of my mind to try it. Unfortunately since they are only located in the Midwestern United States, I had to settle on the frozen ones that they sell and love it or hate it, I find them quite tasty!   Las Vegas is known for housing popular "guilty pleasure" restaurants that can't be found outside of their respective regions or cities, making them must-visit destinations for tourists. Casinos have opened such iconic locations as Pink's Hot Dogs from Los Angeles in the Planet Hollywood Casino, and New York City's Shake Shack recently found a home inside the New York, New York Casino.  This White Castle is located across the street from the Mirage. You can easily walk to this location by parking either at the Ceaser's Palace self parking or at any other of the casinos close by and walk to it. The location is small but there is plenty of seating available inside. Since I've had the frozen ones plenty of times before, I wanted to order the exact ones which were the cheeseburger sliders. The lowest combo you can get is 4 sliders with fries and a drink which is what I decided to get (having still been fairly full from the buffet from earlier).   Once you place your order, you get a number to wait; thankfully orders are pushed out quick since they are made en masse. The sliders are all packaged individually; I can only imagine how many they go through a day. Taking my first bite, it instantly reminded me of the frozen ones. I don't know if that is a good or bad thing. The only difference was that there are pickles in the sliders that are not in the frozen ones. It does add more flavor to it but not much else. These sliders go quick, I can usually finish one in two bites or one if I really want to. The fries are crinkle cut, my personal favorite, they aren't as good as Del Taco's or Shake Shack's fries but it gets the job done.   I would suggest coming here if you have NEVER eaten the frozen ones before. Then you can brag to all your friends who live out in the west or east coast saying that you've actually been to an actually White Castle. This place is worth coming for a late night snack, drunk food or a quick meal. Otherwise, if you have had the frozen ones before then you are really not missing out on anything other than the pickle.   I am a fan of White Castle sliders but I'll settle for the frozen ones just fine.   CC out!

y4O4IfJ4DDDP_LePhYX2xg.text: I was pretty excited to try White Castle and I was a little shocked to see Vegas had a location. PJTez3WxrAABnz3VWpnAnQ.text: White Castle in NY is the best. When I visit that place is a must eat, a few times during visit we buy by the case. Well I live in henderson for 8 years. They were in silverton casino for the food truck fair. I waited in line for over an hour. They were worth waiting for. Cost 1.00 each. Today I went to the strip to get some. Very disappointed.    The burgers were over cooked, no ketchup , no salt and the roll was like it was sitting unwrapped for hours. Dry and firm.Like a hamburger roll gets when left in sun.  In NY you are able to watch them make them. Seems like they are not making them the same way.  Corporate needs to bring out someone to train them and I don't  mean a manager. There was a lady in NY that was there for over 20 years. Food could be good but the chef has to cook it good.......

y5WoBVe6PN8_vR9a9s731g.text: I had a terrible experience. It started off with me enjoying the fact that I'm in Vegas and seen a White Castle. I'm from Minnesota so to see a White Castle on the West Coast was like was Christmas in July. Finally found a parking spot this is really hard to there is no parking for them White Castle that is. Made it in and see no line, no surprise because White Castle always has a line. To my surprise a young man that was in line at the front front got upset because the people that were working we're laughing and doing nothing instead of working he being frustrated hit his cup off the counter counter. That's what got my attention he started screaming that there's a line of people and the people working are laughing joking not doing anything I noticed this was True they were all in a circle just kind of hanging burgers are sitting on the waiting table ready to be made or should I just say put together cuz they're already made and we're waiting. Fred the manager who was a woman I say that because I think they gave me the wrong name of the young lady but if Fred's the name Fred's the name Fred got mad at the young man for noticing that her workers weren't working and instead of apologizing threatened to give the money back, at first he was reluctant just wanted some ketchup but when that was a chore he said yes give me my money back. I just want to say that this made everyone get hands on deck when I say everyone's hands were moving they were all moving and I don't know if it was because Fred came out or if it was because the young man made a fuss but what I know is that I got my food a little bit quicker than I would have had he had not said anything... and he didn't even get to eat. Very sad to save my hometown restaurant Kansas City Missouri where my family is from, we grew up on White Castles. Bunch of onions piled up in the corner little mustard a pickle man that bread something else. I tell a lot of people about White Castles and everybody says this or says that me I love him Frozen from Minnesota or Frozen from in the grocery store what I don't like is bad customer service and that's exactly what I got at this White Castle with Fred as the manager. It was so bad that the drinks didn't even work and the young man who only was able to get his drink had to be mad about that as well.

y7Soa7Xa5Szh_fcJrMfROg.text: The only reason I went was because of all the hype I hear about this place, and I think that is why this place was somewhat of a let down for me. -4lz4jSlOeGyIbmFqbdPxQ.text: Got to get em hot fresh off the grill! No you can't take these Lil babies home. They get cold quick. They don't sit on your belly all day. HnP-mH06EP4mYGNT0Xx0sA.text: Oh, how I love White Castles. I haven't been to one in years but I saw the sign in Vegas and had to stop. This is a "only choice" type of eat. Don't eat here if you have other options. pOGiHnBqvMjaPLRjLmCLNw.text: White Castle?  My Wife and I were so excited to try this place and it was a major let-down.  First off the food- ok the sliders are good, not great, and definitely nothing to rave about.  The fries and mozzarella sticks are phenominal.  Why the 3 stars??? Never too busy to keep up routine cleaning...

6Yh4drGp1kw-6NzXKHW6vA.text: This was just freaking gros in my opinion, a couple of my friends liked it, for me the smell alone was enough for me to hurl. But as a foodie groupie such as myself lol, i don't let smell detour me its unfair. First off this place is constantly packed, fast service though. Price is a tad below average which is a small plus seeing its located on the strip. You might notice that the place is a dump in the inside, understandbly so many people. As for the burgers/sliders they were tiny and light and also tasteless nothing to write about but an after taste that stays in your mouth tasting like old onion. I went to use their toilets after waiting in line for 5 minutes, just as disgusting , it looks like the burgers rushed out of people's systems in a hurry. Save some gambling money eat somewhere better, this place is for the those in desperation to eat cheap.

qtMk5fQFvH17B0MBsUHheQ.text: It was exactly as how I expected it to be. Sliders were just like the frozen ones I buy at the grocery store. People hype up this place too much and I blame Harold and Kumar for that. Food here is just like the food at the White Castle in Chicago.   Beef patties are thin, just like the frozen ones. Slider is small, exact size like the frozen one. Service here is ok, just like how it is at with any other fast food chain. They do however, have other options to choose from other than cheese sliders and the original sliders. Line is long but moves quickly and food comes out quickly. Just like any other fast food joint.   Don't come here and expect it to be a 4 star restaurant. It's just another 3 star fast food place.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HXaFETDCxGGUefLQWOUPhA.text: This probably deserves a 4-star rating given most people's expectations, so let me clarify before I get into the review: I have no real qualms about this place besides the price. The burgers are nearly as good as those in the Midwest.  So, the GOOD:  - Burgers are nearly as good as the Midwest - They give you as many ketchup packets as you want (you probably need to ask if you want any at all) - The place seemed clean enough during a busy night around 1 in the morning - The wait wasn't bad, for the ordering line or for the pickup line  The BAD:  - The main thing is the price. It shouldn't be more than a dollar per burger, and obviously buying more burgers should give you some sort of deal. But it's (as of April 2016) $35.99 for a crave case (30 plain sliders), which is almost the exact same price as 30 individual sliders. Likewise, it costs 30 cents to add cheese to a slider. If you add cheese to all 30 sliders, you might expect some deal. Nope. 30 cents times 30 slices of cheese is 9 dollars, which is the exact amount you'll have to add to your price if you want 30 sliders with cheese instead of regular sliders. That means you're paying $44.99 for 30 tiny sliders...and that's before taxes.  Look, I know it's the Vegas strip, so I don't really mind the price that much. Everything's more expensive, and the constant stream of customers proves they're asking a fair market price. Still, I'm taking away a star because that's just way too much money for those tiny burgers. It costs the same amount for 30 tiny sliders as for like 30 full size McDoubles.  - The burgers aren't quite as good as in the Midwest. They're still good -- they'll satisfy if you're a White Castle fan like myself -- but they're just slightly lacking. I think the problem is that they use this large island grill where something like 4 people work at once, and that open setup results in the steam escaping. For those who don't know, part of the magic of White Castle is that the burgers are cooked by steaming them over a bed of onions. So that onion flavor permeates the entire burger and bun. But with the Vegas location setup, I think the steam doesn't do it's job. Which also results in less moist buns.  But don't let this sway you from going here. Still very good.  - The staff wasn't all that friendly. Not that they were rude. When I asked for ketchup, the guy gave me plenty of ketchup, but didn't even look at me as he was serving me. The people on the grill looked a bit miserable. That's understandable, given they probably spend their day making millions of sliders non-stop because this is a hugely busy location. The girl taking orders was neither friendly nor unfriendly.  - The menu is a bit poorly done. The cheese options, for instance, are listed as a footnote at the top (are those still called footnotes?) where it mentions that you can add cheese or jalapeno cheese. For those unfamiliar with the White Castle menu, they'll probably just miss that option entirely.  - It's WAY at the end of the strip (that is, the part furthest from the 15 freeway). Not as far as Trump Hotel, but past the Venetian. So if you're down near Excalibur, or even the Cosmopolitan, you've got a long walk ahead of you. Might be better to drive to closer hotel and walk. Harrah's parking is free and easy to access off the strip (not sure about other hotels -- do your own research).  SUMMARY:  Go here. It's good.  So why the low rating? I'm taking off two stars because of 1) price and 2) not having the service or taste that lives up to the Midwest experience. But it's still quite good -- I just can't justify mathematically giving it 5 stars because 5 stars would be the standard White Castle experience, which this misses. But going here was still awesome.  PRO TIP: White Castles are excellent breakfast food. Let them sit overnight -- keep the burger cases overlapping to trap the moisture in! -- then let them sit out overnight and enjoy the next day.  Always consume with ketchup.  HELPFUL INFO for the uninitiated:  White Castle sliders are tiny and come standard with chopped, slightly grilled onion, and a pickle. No mustard or ketchup. You have to ask for ketchup packets if you want, but it's easier to bring your own bottle so you don't spend your meal opening and squeezing out 30 packets.  For guys with a young appetite, you could easily consume 10 sliders. Something like 6 might be enough for you.  Women and girls with lesser appetites might be satisfied with 2-4 sliders.  Don't forget to try out their other stuff, like jalapeno cheese, onion rings, etc. It's all good stuff.

BBQQlwiq4-C8sjT3hs8niQ.text: I wanted to come to a White Castle since forever, or at least when we watched Harold and Kumar. This place is just iconic, but there is nothing on the west coast, until they opened up one in Las Vegas. We had to come here. Our hopes were not very high because how difference can it be compared to those frozen White Castle burgers you find in your local grocer store? Well.....moment of truth....not much different. They are fresh, but they taste the same. We just came here to say that we have been to a White Castle. The food was just mediocre, even when we were starving, the food should taste way better, but it didn't. We took our share of pictures and that was it. Would we come here again? Probably not. Would we buy those ones offered in the freezer section again? Probably not.

66U2zxGHTGk15Sgojv8O1w.text: Really fast and pretty good for the price! 24hrs so if you get hungry from gambling your life away, and you can't afford those fancy buffets, THIS is the perfect midnight snack! Loved it!

s_gg-GP7SadV2NtLR6P_SA.text: If this wasn't in a part of the strip that is a little...questionable, then I think the overall vibe would be a bit better. Anyway. The food is cheap. It's tasty. It's a novelty. Go for the experience. Try the onion strips. Mmmm.

lE3nnM8qCX4fglUQT0lgVw.text: Go to the Mcdonald's just a few minutes away if you want a cheeseburger.  The sliders were pretty gross but the mozzarella sticks and fries were great. This place is overhyped for the taste and quality.

gYXb-Ojf0ZugufKvZGEXyA.text: Way overrated! Only famous from Harold and Kumar. The food isn't that great and it is pricy. I would never recommend white castle but if you understand you aren't here for great food and willing to pay the premium, then by all means take the shot!

D-2Otf6VVMbcOpIRxBl7NA.text: I don't understand the rave about this place. Out of years of curiosity, I finally decided to try this place out. Why in Las Vegas? I don't know maybe because it is the only location I know of for now and no I would not try it from frozen bought from grocery stores. I'd rather have it freshly made to have a real experience of the slider.  Now, I've heard that the grilled onions are the specialty ingredient that gives the slider buns and patty a flavorful taste. Although True, the slider is very simplistic. Cheese and an extremely thin piece of Wendy's shaped patty, that is it. And guess how much it is, almost $2!! Seriously, this little tiny cube of a slider is more expensive than a burger from the dollar menu in Mc Donald's? Nuh uh... I can't comprehend the favoritism of this place.  Chicken rings were alright as what I would expect, a chicken nugget in the shape of a ring like an onion ring. What is weird is that the onion, on the other hand, doesn't come in rings as we are used to, but in chip form. The onion chips might be the only reason why I would come back to White Castle now. The pieces of onion are thick and wide and yep it does taste like onion and not just the fried batter.  Overall I think I'd appreciate this place more if their menu was less expensive for the amount they serve. This place is 24 hours so it caters to the drunk club goers. Actually now that I've thought of it, maybe the prices are high in order to keep dirty homeless people from coming in or hanging around. If I end up visiting the East Coast maybe I'd give White Castle another try someday but for now I'll stick with other burger places.

T-p5xYc1dFdq_mKlHsoZsg.text: This was my first White Castle experience.  I had tried the frozen ones before and didn't care for them and was assured by many that I had to try the real thing.    I was excited that White Castle had opened in Vegas since it was more likely that I would make it to Vegas than the east coast.  Final the Vegas trip was booked and I was excited to try out White Castle.    Flash forward to Sunday morning.  The breakfast debate begins and me and my home skillet decide on White Castle.  Since its Vegas it's open 24/7 so why not!  White Castle is located on the strip in the Casino Royale.  The store front is located on the strip and easy to find.    As you walk in it feels like any fast food restaurant.  Ordering was quick, easy and friendly.  We ordered the 2 person combo with 10 sliders (5 with cheese, 5 original), a fry, an onion chip and two soda's for a little over $20.  Our order was up pretty quick.  They do require you show your receipt when you pick up your order.  I'm sure this is a safety measure as I can imagine as day turns to night and the party animals are on the loose there has been previous burger burglaries.    The moment has arrived the tiny little boxes of meat onions and bread is before me!  I take my first bite and.....it's alright.  I figure it's a east coast thing.  I'll stick to my my west coast In n' Out.  The restaurant itself was good, I can't blame them for my taste buds being born and raised on the west coast.   Moral of the story.....try it, you might like it, even if I didn't!

fVSmx1SDQyHz3fbiWTNk5g.text: Don't close store for private events.  That's not the White Castle motto .   That's why u have 1 star. Very disappointing.   Get to the ture roots.  burgers and fries!!!!!

wVnvOBKrHygH3oRZeVAu-g.text: Good luck finding a White Castle stand-alone restaurant anywhere in California or the West Coast. This White Castle is the closest one I know where I live, but I wouldn't make the drive solely for WC. If I'm going to Vegas, I'm gambling, going to different buffets, and having my fun while I'm out here! I've came here on two separate visits to enjoy WC burgers. Cooked fresh in front of me instead of buying the WC burgers in my local supermarket freezer or convenience store.  I'd imagine this WC gets a ton of foot traffic and their employees getting paid well doing what they do. Do they deserve $15/hr? Hell no! Because of what I said, there will often be long lines which doesn't bother me much. The food is well worth the wait, and if you love their food wouldn't you mind waiting a little longer? They also don't serve burgers, nope. Veggie sliders, fish sliders, etc are also on their menu. I don't come here for anything but their burgers. I mean aren't they known for their burgers? I don't mind variety and options, but In N Out has done so well just serving burgers!

RQVPYdmHJFKYcE4_KqNTOw.text: The dying question, is it worth all the hype?! Really hard to say but leaning closer to a "nope." I never had the pleasure of trying the "real thing" but I do love the frozen ones. Frankly, it was not much of a difference from those, just the bread was "fluffier." Them pickles killed it for me though. :( I also got the an order of onion chips and fries for good measure. Yea...not really impressed and feel I haven't been missing out on much because we have In n Out. Yup, I said it. Deal with it. Luckily the wait was like 10 minutes so hey, at least I can say I tried it.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xN2Dto1lQe2O-R_6rjqpiA.text: I always wanted to try this place because of the movie. It was not disappointing and I like the  taste of the little burgers. The staff was very friendly unlike other burger joints.

L2qWrQ4NcjX7FtKGfako8Q.text: Finally, eating at a White Castle!! It everything I hoped it would be and locals get 10% off too. Can't wait to comeback again. Only wish was that they had another location off the strip.

33mWVSB70hwqfreMJYimkg.text: Got there around 3 and the line went by pretty quickly. Order the 2 double sliders with cheese meal and chicken rings (since everyone suggested to do so). Since they're sliders I suspected that they'd be small which was why I ordered two. The sliders come with grilled onions and pickles inside just an FYI if you don't like those stuff. You can see the chefs in the back cooking and boxing all the orders so I would say it's not exactly "fresh" because they're just constantly making the same thing over and over again. The chicken rings were good, they were like thinner chicken nuggets in a ring shaped form. Overall, this place was nothing special. Never been to the east coast to try the legit thing nor have I tried the frozen boxed one.   At least the workers were nice and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 sliders, fries, chicken rings, and a drink

AjJftOYXwy_VRdqe3reVkA.text: Such a long wait for such small burgers, but I would wait again, totally worth it if you are a fan of sliders. I got the 20pack w/fries and an order of onion chips. Tasted great . Wished they had more workers for the long lines they have of hungry people waiting .

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iYgIkj6VXo9A1FHaJAbrOg.text: I remember eating here when I was 10 and hated it. I think 27 yrs later my taste buds have either changed or their food became extremely better. This place was quite busy but the service was fast and food was Awesome. Definitely a spot I'll frequent while I'm down on the strip!

LfY7kEps_rQQAgnZyRIRdg.text: Can I review this place a billion times so it receives 5 stars?! Place is amazing!!! These burgers are little morsels that melt in your mouth!!! They have cool beer cups and the service is good!! Love it

jxZYwTb1VncMvV1mDUo5cg.text: I never knew I could hate a burger so much. It was so greasy that it soaked the bun. The meat made McDonalds look bomb. Everything about the burger was unappealing.  I had to try this place just to see what Harold and Kumar chowed down on. I literally have no idea why it couldn't have been Harold And Kumar Go To Any Other Burger Place Cause White Castle Is Nasty.  Worst $1.00 I've ever spent in my life.

kTdvdp0dFu2Q4hAO4hk2Dw.text: Located inside the Casino Royale Hotel & Casino.  Get the loaded fries along with your sliders.  Warning, i've seen this line go 40 deep at times.

vvKF9DvIp3oByvH4dqK1Aw.text: Out of veggie burgers. Fries were stale. Onion chips are greasy and nasty. Mozzarella sticks were okay. Seating area is dirty. Out of ice.

JhMsT5ssB910b09mDfdB2A.text: Don't see what the attraction is, no substance.  I think even McDonald's basic cheeseburger taste better.  Service was slow and lackluster. Well, I always wanted to give it a chance, but i don't know if I would go back.  In n out no competition, here.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dSnXWFHWKcVl4Y8O0tkJzA.text: After walking up and down the Strip twice I was craving some White Castle almost as much as Roldy and Kumar!  From the outside it looked like a tiny standalone but actually the location is inside the Casino Royale.  Got the #7 Castle Pack, which was 10 sliders, two regular fries and two drinks.  Service was good as they got my order out quickly in spite of the place being packed but for my first time eating White Castle burgers at a White Castle I was rather disappointed.   These certainly did not hit the spot! I know sliders don't have much meat but these were practically meatless! And the onions could've tasted a whole lot better. The Fries were meh too as they were a bit soggy.  Not gonna lie, I enjoyed the microwave White Castle burgers you get from the grocery better...

n65fwd31VV7EFqbk88xgVw.text: SO GOOD! Not sure if it was the alcohol or if it was THAT good! Service was really quick,ordered and within minutes, food was ready. The food was freshly made, everything nice and hot, it was delightful! There was about 8 of us, we ordered cheeseburgers, chicken rings, fries (regular, fully loaded and the cheese fries) along with mozzarella sticks. My sister was raving about this place and it was nothing short of UH-MAZING!! Cannot wait to go back to Vegas :)

0yqkZBRkjaaMmfFxVdPPHQ.text: Burgers were meh. Kinda tasted like microwave burgers or like elementary school lunch burgers. The onion strips were good. Even the chicken rings were decent. Just wasn't my taste personally. The servers were a mix of cool people and people that said nothing as I said thank you have a nice day to them as I picked up my order. Probably wouldn't buy again.

g62j5KrmqxW4F2uyWjR7Ow.text: Long long lines during the night. Basic white castle meals perfect for hangovers.

9VlUxstf22VBfFPIcZM6eg.text: Very small restaurant capitalizing off the brand's nostalgia and charm. They sell their signature miniature "slider" sized burgers at an overpriced rate. This seems to be the selling gimmick for White Castle, luring in drunk gamblers or curious tourists to stop in.   The restaurant itself is attached to the casino of the Venetian I believe. It is located on the Strip, with a one door entry point. A long line of hungry customers fills the restaurant, although it moves rather quickly. There are only 5-6 tables, with 2 larger bar-stool type tables for seating. As you reach closer to the register, you are welcomed with a better view to the behind-the-scenes look of White Castle. Rapid hands swiftly assemble buns amongst grilled onions and juicy meat patties, exchanging between different work stations to finally end up placed in a singular order, ready for the customer.   A large glass window display showcases some of the White Castle souvenirs that are available to purchase to take home. A $10 coffee cup or a $25 T-shirt? Not for me but maybe for others.   Last, but certainly not least, was the food. If you're familiar with the case and recognition of White Castle, then eating at the actual location only provides a slightly more fresh experience than the frozen, store-bought burgers. The buns are much softer and are squishy to the touch. The taste and aroma of the grilled onions complement the meat patty. It's White Castle, there isn't much too glorify about it or expect.   My experience was pleasant, but to each their own. For $8.99 you can get 4 Cheese Sliders, a small fry and a small drink. The price is consistent with the glamorization of the branding. I ate each slider in about 2 bites and was still hungry afterwards, but didn't want to face waiting in a long line again.   If you are nearby in the area, take a look!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu, 1/5 of the line, and a look at the clear glass merchandise display. They also sell beer which is interesting.
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The White Castle menu (really long line with only 1 tired cashier to monotonously service everyone)
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo #2: 4 cheese sliders, fry (upgraded to large), and a drink.

FDKXlbAMGGcObRDVqKO-0w.text: Had White Castle for the first time at this location. It was not what I was expecting at all. I was very disappointed with the flavor in general. The sliders were very mushy. I will not be trying White Castle again.

Zs0sTQv576uPZHUC3kTF-w.text: This place is open 24/7 (as almost everything else is on the main part of the strip). My bf and I shared a (4) Cheese Sliders meal with Fries and a Drink for a quick meal before we headed back home. The meal meal came up to $8.99. Sure, this was filling, but there's better places out there to eat. This would be a good spot for drunchies. I really appreciated the crunchy crinkle fries though! I'm not about the soggy fries life. Lol. This is good place if you haven't had White Castle, but you're better off grabbing so much better out there on the strip.  Note: Find White Castle on the strip next to Harrah's Casino.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 of the 4 Cheese Sliders + Crinkle Fries + drink (not pictured) = $8.99 meal!

HsWJSZLzutvSHIgdxHG4rw.text: Good service. Terrible food. I got a double slider. Why does the food smell like ass? The bread is wet and sawggy. The meat is grey. The onions look weird. $3? Really? Lol. "At least the chicken looks like normal meat. Smells normal too." Overheard someone say this at another table.  Never again.

USjcbgyKYdOlHR-uldU5VQ.text: First, if you come here for an earth shattering meal to a place known for feeding small burgers that is the basis of a stoner movie, you really need to get a CAT scan and a reality check.   However, if you come here to try a typically East Coast only chain that serves small greasy little burgers that spawned a Stoner movie, then you won't be disappointed. This place is inside a casino but has about 10 tables, is stylized like the East coast locations, and has an assembly crew to handle the giant lines.  Expect about a 20-30 minute wait when you go to order.  I love these little burgers, they are the size of a post-it note and about 2 inches tall. Each one is served in a small cardboard box. I like the original without cheese (its just a greasy bun, onions, and patty), the wife likes the ones with cheese.  We pick up 15-20 when we are in the mood for them and these hit the spot from this location.  These will not stack up against "premium burger" joints, they are not a premium burger.  This is your 2 am burger where you got a hangover and you need grease.  This is what you get, greasy, greasy goodness. If you want great beef flavor, go to one of the million other burger joints on the strip.  If you order any of the sides beware, they are all mediocre. Imagine going to a Burger King and ordering fried chicken... Are you really surprised that it sucks? If you go to White Castle, just get the burgers, skip the rest. If you get the rest, that is on you...  The price is a little more than the locations on the East Coast but when everyone else is price gauging on the strip, you can't blame White Castle for doing the same... Worth a try if you have never had it, but do yourself a favor, drink a yard long margarita with a few extra shots first.  That will put you in the right state of mind for White Castle.

HrHC1CbhZqUUE6Ag8YPTGQ.text: Okay....it's White Castle.  This isn't a gourmet burger joint.  With that in mind, I had a great experience!  I loved each mini cheeseburger with a sliced pickle and chopped onions on it.  I didn't give it 5 stars, as the fries definitely needed some fresh oil and some TLC.  They were a bit brown and sad for fries, so I'd recommend going with the onion chips (like pieces of crispy onion rings).  If you haven't gone, you just need to!

s2v4Ca1IxicHjsV40vnP7A.text: What can I say. It's a White Castle on the Strip. Not a lot of folks yet at 11:30 but I bet this will be packed at 3-4 am.  I just got a slider with cheese and a ice water, since I had a concoction with me already haha...the service was sort of slow even though there were not a lot of customers.  The workers seem to have attitudes as well, but I guess they have had a long hard day however that is not an excuse.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My order

W8ewdzpjHAxtnhmu8E2EVg.text: So you're drunk on the Strip and you want that delicious but poor food choice? Yep White Castle fits the bill. The sliders are little bites of heaven which do a great job coating your alcohol laden belly. Being originally from Detroit there was a White Castle on every corner so it wasn't an urgent run to try them when they arrived on the Strip. Being drunk and at Harrah's seeing the White Castle was like a beacon calling us over. The place was packed as we weren't the only ones with the same brilliant idea. The cashiers do a pretty efficient job filling all the orders as quick as possible so expect to wait 15 minutes on a busy weekend night. 4 cheeseburgers, fries, and a pop (dammit I'm from Michigan and it's POP not soda) will set you back $8.99 but the extra space it soaks up for more alcohol consumption is priceless. Thank you White Castle!

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buy &#39;em by the sack!
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious slider goodness
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He came all the way from Orlando for these!

P-C2XKxc-vHwEthwzdL3zA.text: My love for white castle will never go away, since I had my first on Hollywood Blvd in 1984 right before I was going to watch Ghostbusters at the Egyptian theatre.  After that was gone, I was subjected to Frozen White Castle burgers from the grocery store.  I believe the now gone famous Mermaid casino served white castle burgers, but they were not made there, but I was still happy.  I was even thinking about flying out of state to Kentucky just to experience the restaurant again 33 years later.  After a taxi ride down the boulevard, I spotted the White House logo in the Best Western Plaza.  Instead of going to Caesars palace, I had the taxi turn around and take me to white castle.  There are so many great restaurants in Las Vegas, and I love gourmet food.....but something about this place reminds me of my childhood.  I ordered 6 cheeseburgers and fries. Pigged out like there was no tomorrow.  Did not care if I would have a stomachache later that night.  The burger is a mini bun, with an oh so thin patty, and slicer of cheese. I like mine with a pack of ketchup.its like a fast food appetizer, except I got greedy.  All I know is thank you for having a White Castle in Vegas, when I thought there was no more around.  I was too hungry to even take a pic of my food, just had the empty box.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of 6 cheeseburger

sTSmWjji8MdRLR_AxmN2CA.text: Super disgusting food, tastes so old, and the line is so backed up. Be careful too because there's homeless guys waiting to snatch up your food

P89z2gJ9wd6mySXWQ5_9Dg.text: If I could give it 0 stars I would , the fact that they cant make a burger without onions is the dumbest shit I have ever heard , the burgers are not that good to begin with , so save your money and dont waste your time coming here especially the Vegas location

maZnIEAsg8S8o_xjG1qCkg.text: I love White Castle!! I used to go in Ohio when I was a kid, and had since resorted to buying the overpriced packages in the freezer section of my grocery store. I was so excited to hit up an actual White Castle location again.  I ordered a good amount of sliders and a drink, and was no disappointed at all! Food took a while to come because it was really busy, but so worth it. Must stop here on your Vegas trip!

1FxVD9JjmcKzEiWsXBd2ww.text: Grew up in Chicago and always loved sliders! This is more of a white castle "light" location meaning, they have a limited menu. However, for me the double cheeseburgers were awesome! They nailed it! Onion chips (think cut up rings) were very good as well. Negatives were the smaller menu (would love some jalapeno burgers), location is not the best, gets a bit crowded/long lines, over priced for sure, and the fries, meh, still not very good. Still, living in Phoenix now, I am thrilled I can get great sliders without having to fly back to Chi-town - I would definitely hit this place every time I was in town.

9Oddr-XeyovKiMyKI42F6w.text: This White Castle is awesome. Definitely a great late night stop in Vegas. Service was fast, location was easy to find & it was clean! Definitely will be back!

av-0PAByTokF8UUKoxh4bw.text: Walked in around 1am. I know I shouldn't have high expectations at this time of hour. But I was hungry and in the mood for  mini burgers. Man... Was I wrong. I should have followed my gut and not eaten here. I saw about 6 employees, just one cashier and two standing around not doing anything. The grills and floor looked a mess and needless to say it did not look appealing. We paid and the food was ready two secs later. What does that that mean? That we were served burgers that most likely had been prepared who knows how long ago. Sliders were super soggy.  The fries were not hot, tasted rubbery and old.  About 15 minutes after eating, I started feeling nauseous with a stomach pains. I pride myself on being able to eat anything without consequence.. but never again.

zf3Qd_c9sJ6Y3K-lMGBNZg.text: Went here while on vacation in Vegas, because I have never been and you always have to try something once, otherwise, you don't know what you are missing.  However, I could have missed it and been okay with it.  My wife and I had some chicken sandwiches.  They were not amazing, but okay.  The bun was soft and patty had a little kick of flavor.  The wait was a bit long for just 4 sandwiches, and the dining area was a bit messy and was hard to find a clean table.  Hey, at least I can say I went to a White Castle.

eOmfJF_3zSAMVO4UwosnYQ.text: This is the farthest West location, which means the hype is real.   If you go in the wee hours of the morning like we did, just hang around, there's usually a drunk party that orders a Crave Case or Crate that ends up giving them out, because they can't finish it.  FYI, they start serving breakfast at midnight, so hash browns are a great alternative to fries.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Sliders &amp; hash browns

b0SRZVtHTyg8LpydcFmV4w.text: To be elaborated upon later: -food took twice the time given -could not tell vegan from beef burger -no ketchup anywhere -autism speaks -literally 10 burgers sitting on the counter for 15min while the lady takes her sweet time to pack them, feat. massive line -the most hastily assembled burgers of all time, only half of them even had pickles

mgNd5l-Y3tjknmaMG4pQxg.text: I was so excited to try the famous White Castle since my home town doesn't have one. It's ass good as most people say too! The fish and chicken slider are sooo good it's scary, The original wasn't what I though tho. Definitely would stop by again!

Gm2uWZHx7lpI_ugGQT5CGg.text: Didn't know they put a White Castle in Vegas. It's connected to best western casino royale. Had to stop in since I've never had White Castle before. Line went quick and it was maybe an 8 minute wait until our number was called. It wasn't as a magical as I thought it would be. There was a cracked head sitting in the corner tweaking out and talking to herself though.

b-wkOsxpwFArCtfYLgjVCA.text: Ate here far to many times during my 2 night stay in Vegas, but it calls to you when your drunk stumbling around on the strip. Cheap prices make it a easy stop. Can be some shady people eating there late at night.

Yr77PGem9Sv-_I_VzpavcQ.text: The absolute opposite of Fast Food! The cooking staff could not be more uninterested in quickly serving the customers. And, BTW, not that many!!! They definitely need a lesson from In n Out.

yWvCNZVu2aw-Spp1WwOetQ.text: So I've had the frozen White Castle burgers from my local grocery store & always liked those. So when I first came across White Castle out here in Vegas it was @ a Foodie Truck festival & OMG they were soooo gross, they made me want to get sick so I threw them away.   Last year I was on the strip with some of my friends & they stopped by this location for some food but I skipped the lines & opt out due to not liking them that time @ the Foodie Fest.   But the other night (late thurs am) my friend & I were out on the strip & he's a vegetarian & heard they sold vegetarian burgers & wanted to go & check it out. So this time I actually decided to give them another try. We were so hungry & ordered a bunch of stuff, as their burgers are very tiny. We got 2 burgers, 1 chicken sandwich, 1 fish & 1 veggie sandwich. An order of cheese sticks, french fries & onion chips.   So we start to go to town on our food & I realize I have no marinara dipping sauce for the cheese sticks so I have to go up to the counter & request some & also got some Honey mustard sauce. Everything I ate was good. After my friend ate his veggie burger he couldn't find his fish sandwich. We double checked everything, accounted for the empty containers & realized we never got it. So he went up to the counter to let staff know this. Next thing I know he comes back to the table with the manager all angry & upset. I told the lady "my friend didn't get his fish sandwich." They were arguing with each other because the manager didn't believe him, she thought he was lying so that's why my friend became so angry with her. Really lady?? My friend is going to make up a lie about something he didn't get when he could afford 100+ of them........I've never been to a business where one was questioned about a missing item from their order. The manager eventually told him she would get him another one & walked off. He filled me in on what happened & I felt like she probably would spit in his sandwich after all that arguing so he didn't want his sandwich now so we got up & left.   It was late @ night & not very busy @ all. There were probably 7 people in the eating area. The one thing that was an eye sore was a guy passed out with his head on the table drooling all over it. Money was hanging out of his pocket & he had an open bottle of baby lotion with lotion all over the table with his trash on the table. The manager had to have seen this guy as he was sitting behind me & never went over to wake the guy up & tell him to either stay awake or leave. His food was gone so it looked like he was just looking for a place to take a nap. I even woke him up to tell him his money was falling out of his pocket & he woke up briefly then went back to sleep. I can't believe the manager would allow someone to just be passed out like that. There even was a guy who was sweeping the floor who had to have seen this guy too as he swept by him & didn't try to wake him up.   Besides being disgusted with how the manager treated & spoke to my friend over one tiny fish sandwich that he paid for and didn't get then stood there & argued with him about it in front of everyone in the dinning room, the fact that she lets people pass out/sleep & drool on their table is a major reason why I won't go back here & advise my friends to skip a trip here too.   The next day something even more major happened.......I got sick from their food. Let's just say the food turned into liquid & found a quick way out of my body. Becareful eating here guys, stay close to a toilet afterwards!!!

zMPQpxRm9wwk0qL5xGeP6w.text: White Castle, famous for its name, but other fast food places such as in-n-out or shake shack are definitely way better. I had to try this place though to say that I've been, but as for going back, I'm not sure about that....   The sliders are extremely tiny. If you do choose to get them, the CHEESE SLIDERS are way better than the ORIGINAL SLIDER which pretty much consist of bun, patty and pickle. Most definitely can make something way better at home. I think I need some more content in the sliders. They're dry and bland. Sadly do not taste good. Definitely for those with the munchies and just want a quick bite to eat. You'll definitely also need way more than a few sliders to get filled up. The CHICKEN RINGS, they are just ok. Not as great as everyone says it is, just reminds me of the dinonuggets we can heat up at home, but in a shape of a ring. The LOADED CHEESE FRIES were probably my favorite part of the whole meal. Simple, but the most tasty with the bacon, cheese, some mayo ranch smothered on top of crinkle fries.  Ultimately, good to know that I've tried it, but not a place to return to. Good thing is, I didn't have to pay for parking because there's a tiny lot in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yqqGEriFBEIIjvScveU1Dw.text: Always have to stop in and get some Sliders, a large Onion Chip and an iced tea when I'm in LV. This place has always been clean, friendly and quick staff and the food is as expected.

CjMga1gP15-QezLzxb1RjA.text: Maybe it was Harold and Kumar or maybe it's a well-known Midwest/Mid-Atlantic burger joint or maybe I've seen it in the frozen section of the supermarket. Whatever the reason, White Castle has been on my bucket list of burger joints.  I thought what a perfect time to check White Castle off my list when I saw it on the Las Vegas Strip.  Las Vegas is actually White Castle's presence in the West.   Strolling the Strip after lunch, we decided to check out the offerings at White Castle. Known for introducing The Slider, we got two Original sliders to try. The sliders are steam-grilled and consists of a thin 2"x2" all beef patty with onions and a slice of pickle.  The square shaped beef patty looked like a processed patty. The original does not include ketchup, mustard and or mayonnaise. So I put some ketchup on my slider. The beef was bland tasting.   While ordering, I noticed that the sliders are mass produced and are lined a sheet pan.  They are not made to order.   Compared to other burger chains, it doesn't match up to In-N-Out or Habit.  Maybe good enough to stop by for a quick snack?  But I'm glad I got my White Castle curiosity out of the way and know that I won't be having craving for The Original Slider.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bland processed looking squared patty
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mass produced

0QQcJcweWgJ6JMzC97PJUQ.text: I never had White Castle before and heard about it a lot. Not sure if that place serves really bad food or the whole chain is bad.  The meat has no taste. You can see it a bit red not sure if it is undercooked or what. The cheese gives it some taste but the original sliders (without cheese) is just awful.   I have to say the chicken and fish are not bad. But all in all I don't recommend this place at all (or the chain for that matter).

zMNi7nrsXTKcUJVtGMTklA.text: Not worth it. The frozen White Castle taste the same as the one in the restaurant. Came here for the experience and I'm glad I did because now I know it's not all that great.

A7nRC08JGsywv2dyNTp2-A.text: People often talk about a place that is mystical. A place everyone is happy. War and hunger don't exist. Heaven on Earth? No, but very close.... I'm talking about a place where the soda flows and the decadent burgers sizzle in a cozy bed of onions. WHITE CASTLE.   What are you about to experience? A miracle on Earth! A culinary climax. You will leave here holding your loved ones weaping in joy. Your legs will be shaking from the endorphins coursing through your body. The sacred patty can be had for under $2!!!  The employees...I mean heroes that work in the heat work hard to bring joy to all. I spoke to a manager named Kris ....Kris Kringle because he really was like santa giving happiness to all the boys and girls of the world.

kem4cqbicKJHi1ZPK71EFg.text: Pretty unspectacular burgers. These are worth a try, I suppose... but you're better off eating at mcdonald's. The sandwiches here are small. They don't cost too much but you also don't get too much so it's not a huge value. Even as drunk eats are concerned, this ranks way below taco truck. Not worth a repeat.   SERVICE Typical fast food. You order at the counter and pick up when ready.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I-HXjtbKq25k37qID8MkfA.text: My family and I are on a short vacation in Vegas on the weekend before July 4th when my dad, who is familiar with the movie involving White Castle, suggests trying this "iconic" hamburger chain for lunch.   LOCATION: This store was along the Vegas Strip and was actually in a casino. The tables and chairs were clean, but there is smoke in the air from the casinos nearby, and if you are like me and you don't like the smell, then it would be better to eat somewhere else.   SERVICE: The ladies at the register were really abrupt and a bit impatient when it came to ordering. Although I do understand that they are doing their job, I still had hoped for better service, especially when we arrived around 11 a.m. and they only had a guest behind us.   CONS: -Price: It was pretty expensive for very small portions, but then again, it IS Vegas. I ordered the original sliders (4 sliders) with onion fries and loaded fries combo. and it already costed $8.  -Portion: The sliders were VERY small and unsatisfactory. There was a special pack that included about 10 sliders for about $18 which STILL wouldn't have been fulfilling.  -Loaded Fries: It was okay, but visually, not appealing because it looked like they just dumped the cheese and the bacon onto fries.  -Self-Serve: We had to add on our own mayo and ketchup onto the hamburgers. For some people, they might prefer it this way because they can adjust how much they'd want in each slider, but for me, I had to use multiple packets of the condiments, which wastes a lot of plastic.   PROS: The hamburger sliders themselves were not too bad and the location was conveniently close to the Flamingo and Bally's Hotels. I also got a souveneir cup for upgrading to loaded fries which was pretty cool.   Overall, this place, for me, functions as a place for a quick snack and if you're willing to pay the price for more sliders to fulfill yourself, then go ahead. However, the price to do so, in my opinion, would be better used for a buffet or some sort... where the food is more appealing, more satisfactory, and more fulfilling. I would not come here again unless I am really desperate for something to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l0RdwKjmsLqySES8r8HXRg.text: Unless you're here to try the veggie burger, you're better off just grabbing the frozen white castle burgers from the grocery store.

photos.caption: Photo of White Castle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original and veggie

b5cOAiqZ6o0pQEcU_8ASyQ.text: I've secretly been stalking White Castle for YEARS. I live no where near one. California's first White Castle is light years away. Took a trip to Vegas to pick up the Mister from a business trip and he asked where should we eat... Duh....White Castle. This was our one and only chance to get our hands on these mini burgers.   There is no easy way here. You have to park at The Venetian then walk outside. No biggie. You can see on the strip, it's near Sephora and attached to Casino Royale.  Not going to lie. These pint size burgers taste a step above the ones you buy from your local grocery store. But the onions are fresher and you get a pickle. It's all about the hype. If you like frozen White Castle then you will like this place. If you hate those frozen White Castle burgers then steer clear. In case you dont know. These burgers are steamed. They then pile steamed onions on top then slide them into little boxes. They are paper thin. So go with the doubles.  Between the 2 of us we ate 4 double castle cheeseburgers. 2 regular cheeseburgers. 1 chicken burger and ALL the sides. The fries are horrible. I mean super gross. Save your money and get the onion chips. The mozerella sticks were average. Ask for marinara sauce because they won't give them to you.   Either you love White Castle or hate White Castle. Or maybe your just curious. I was just curious. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. But if I were passing by, and lived 1000 miles away from the nearest White Castle then I would go.  P.S. the soda is extra fizzy and bubbley.

kVO0T9tvZ4DPIqOsMHwv_g.text: I been wanting to try this place since they only have it in the inner states. When I came in, the place wasn't so packed. The cashier did tell me that the place does get packed for certain hours and some history of it. The sliders weren't that great. The fries were alright! I was expecting it to be a whole different taste compared to McDonald's or other fast food spots.

-ajZ-EmAqEBKo5BGeVgsUA.text: This place is hyped from the movie ; harold and kumar. It's a small joint located near the harrahs casino where you can buy their main entree ; sliders. We bought the 20 slider pack for 4 people which came with fries and it was an okay amount for the 4 people. The sliders were pretty basic tasting cheese burger but I suppose does the job, especially if you're drunk.   You can buy these frozen sliders from your local supermarket too which decreases the value by alot. Next time, if you really want these sliders, check our local supermarket and buy it to microwave at home. Nothing too fancy here!

Fb9hlJ0Ly-Fm-ES4tAKmzw.text: Native New Yorker living in the South I was happy to visit here as soon as we landed. Bangin!! Just like I remembered... 30 years ago!

QeoZogaFWX5S6pXC11RNew.text: Since there isn't a White Castle where we live, my husband requested to come here when we're in Vegas.  We walked in around dinner time and there were only 2 customers in front of me.  When it was my turn, I ordered 4 cheese sliders, 1 fish slider, 1 chicken slider, 1 french fries and a drink (for my husband and my daughter to share).  I tried the fish slider, chicken slider and the fries and they were just okay.  The ingredients didn't taste fresh (especially the fish slider).  No comment on the cheese slider since I don't eat beef but my husband said it was just okay.  Overall, we're not aching to come back anytime soon.

jEukcC5UOw2LvqeLKyWnlQ.text: THESE BURGERS ARE ONLY OKAY but I like them still. Hence, the 4 stars I gave.  My favorite late night junk food in Vegas.    **There is definitely a type of crowd here.  So, don't expect anything special.   The burger buns are super delicate, with small meat patties, and grilled onions.  I only order the sliders and I always tack on two extra burgers (for the morning).  These burgers are great as a cold snack.    I would come back

Nkk7mhjWt04eO3-x2ES88Q.text: We went on a whim...our first White Castle experience...I expected it to be more Harold & Kumar-ish...sadly, the dining tables were trashed, hadn't been cleared off in a while (we had to wipe down our own table) and the wait was long...but the food made up for it...tried every possible combination we could think of...my personal fave: jalapeno cheese slider with bacon...oh, and I highly recommend the brownie on a stick too

TBmKS6TR_QnwT4H9U-zqVw.text: This is my first time going to a White Castle as I've never tried the originals in the mid-west or anywhere else this chain is located. Not sure why they got such low reviews but I'm a fan and it was delicious for me.  The sliders are small. I can see why a meal offers a set of 4 sliders compared to just getting one. It wasn't too bad as I liked how the bread was fresh and everything was freshly made. I also liked how there was fresh onions on it too. It was pretty cool how you could see the kitchen from the register at this particular location so everything is made fresh and you can watch it being made.   No complaints about service either. Even if its just a fast food chain, the staff was friendly and working as fast as they could since there was a huge line of people waiting for their food. Overall everything tasted great and it came out in a timely manner.   Yelp 2017 Review Challenge 91/100
